29 #ifndef NLOHMANN_JSON_HPP
30 #define NLOHMANN_JSON_HPP
31 
32 #include <algorithm> // all_of, copy, fill, find, for_each, none_of, remove, reverse, transform
33 #include <array> // array
34 #include <cassert> // assert
35 #include <ciso646> // and, not, or
36 #include <clocale> // lconv, localeconv
37 #include <cmath> // isfinite, labs, ldexp, signbit
38 #include <cstddef> // nullptr_t, ptrdiff_t, size_t
39 #include <cstdint> // int64_t, uint64_t
40 #include <cstdlib> // abort, strtod, strtof, strtold, strtoul, strtoll, strtoull
41 #include <cstring> // memcpy, strlen
42 #include <forward_list> // forward_list
43 #include <functional> // function, hash, less
44 #include <initializer_list> // initializer_list
45 #include <iomanip> // hex
46 #include <iostream> // istream, ostream
47 #include <iterator> // advance, begin, back_inserter, bidirectional_iterator_tag, distance, end, inserter, iterator, iterator_traits, next, random_access_iterator_tag, reverse_iterator
48 #include <limits> // numeric_limits
49 #include <locale> // locale
50 #include <map> // map
51 #include <memory> // addressof, allocator, allocator_traits, unique_ptr
52 #include <numeric> // accumulate
53 #include <sstream> // stringstream
54 #include <string> // getline, stoi, string, to_string
55 #include <type_traits> // add_pointer, conditional, decay, enable_if, false_type, integral_constant, is_arithmetic, is_base_of, is_const, is_constructible, is_convertible, is_default_constructible, is_enum, is_floating_point, is_integral, is_nothrow_move_assignable, is_nothrow_move_constructible, is_pointer, is_reference, is_same, is_scalar, is_signed, remove_const, remove_cv, remove_pointer, remove_reference, true_type, underlying_type
56 #include <utility> // declval, forward, make_pair, move, pair, swap
57 #include <vector> // vector
58 
59 // exclude unsupported compilers
60 #if defined(__clang__)
61  #if (__clang_major__ * 10000 + __clang_minor__ * 100 + __clang_patchlevel__) < 30400
62  #error "unsupported Clang version - see https://github.com/nlohmann/json#supported-compilers"
63  #endif
64 #elif defined(__GNUC__)
65  #if (__GNUC__ * 10000 + __GNUC_MINOR__ * 100 + __GNUC_PATCHLEVEL__) < 40900
66  #error "unsupported GCC version - see https://github.com/nlohmann/json#supported-compilers"
67  #endif
68 #endif
69 
70 // disable float-equal warnings on GCC/clang
71 #if defined(__clang__) || defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
72  #pragma GCC diagnostic push
73  #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wfloat-equal"
74 #endif
75 
76 // disable documentation warnings on clang
77 #if defined(__clang__)
78  #pragma GCC diagnostic push
79  #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wdocumentation"
80 #endif
81 
82 // allow for portable deprecation warnings
83 #if defined(__clang__) || defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
84  #define JSON_DEPRECATED __attribute__((deprecated))
85 #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
86  #define JSON_DEPRECATED __declspec(deprecated)
87 #else
88  #define JSON_DEPRECATED
89 #endif
90 
91 // allow to disable exceptions
92 #if (defined(__cpp_exceptions) || defined(__EXCEPTIONS) || defined(_CPPUNWIND)) && not defined(JSON_NOEXCEPTION)
93  #define JSON_THROW(exception) throw exception
94  #define JSON_TRY try
95  #define JSON_CATCH(exception) catch(exception)
96 #else
97  #define JSON_THROW(exception) std::abort()
98  #define JSON_TRY if(true)
99  #define JSON_CATCH(exception) if(false)
100 #endif
101 
102 // manual branch prediction
103 #if defined(__clang__) || defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
104  #define JSON_LIKELY(x) __builtin_expect(!!(x), 1)
105  #define JSON_UNLIKELY(x) __builtin_expect(!!(x), 0)
106 #else
107  #define JSON_LIKELY(x) x
108  #define JSON_UNLIKELY(x) x
109 #endif
110 
111 namespace possumwood
112 {
113 
114 namespace io
115 {
116 
125 namespace detail
126 {
128 // exceptions //
130 
143 class exception : public std::exception
144 {
145  public:
147  virtual const char* what() const noexcept override
148  {
149  return m.what();
150  }
151 
153  const int id;
154 
155  protected:
156  exception(int id_, const char* what_arg)
157  : id(id_), m(what_arg)
158  {}
159 
160  static std::string name(const std::string& ename, int id)
161  {
162  return "[json.exception." + ename + "." + std::to_string(id) + "] ";
163  }
164 
165  private:
167  std::runtime_error m;
168 };
169 
205 class parse_error : public exception
206 {
207  public:
216  static parse_error create(int id, size_t byte_, const std::string& what_arg)
217  {
218  std::string w = exception::name("parse_error", id) + "parse error" +
219  (byte_ != 0 ? (" at " + std::to_string(byte_)) : "") +
220  ": " + what_arg;
221  return parse_error(id, byte_, w.c_str());
222  }
223 
234  const size_t byte;
235 
236  private:
237  parse_error(int id_, size_t byte_, const char* what_arg)
238  : exception(id_, what_arg), byte(byte_)
239  {}
240 };
241 
266 class invalid_iterator : public exception
267 {
268  public:
269  static invalid_iterator create(int id, const std::string& what_arg)
270  {
271  std::string w = exception::name("invalid_iterator", id) + what_arg;
272  return invalid_iterator(id, w.c_str());
273  }
274 
275  private:
276  invalid_iterator(int id_, const char* what_arg)
277  : exception(id_, what_arg)
278  {}
279 };
280 
305 class type_error : public exception
306 {
307  public:
308  static type_error create(int id, const std::string& what_arg)
309  {
310  std::string w = exception::name("type_error", id) + what_arg;
311  return type_error(id, w.c_str());
312  }
313 
314  private:
315  type_error(int id_, const char* what_arg)
316  : exception(id_, what_arg)
317  {}
318 };
319 
336 class out_of_range : public exception
337 {
338  public:
339  static out_of_range create(int id, const std::string& what_arg)
340  {
341  std::string w = exception::name("out_of_range", id) + what_arg;
342  return out_of_range(id, w.c_str());
343  }
344 
345  private:
346  out_of_range(int id_, const char* what_arg)
347  : exception(id_, what_arg)
348  {}
349 };
350 
362 class other_error : public exception
363 {
364  public:
365  static other_error create(int id, const std::string& what_arg)
366  {
367  std::string w = exception::name("other_error", id) + what_arg;
368  return other_error(id, w.c_str());
369  }
370 
371  private:
372  other_error(int id_, const char* what_arg)
373  : exception(id_, what_arg)
374  {}
375 };
376 
377 
378 
380 // JSON type enumeration //
382 
407 enum class value_t : uint8_t
408 {
409  null,
410  object,
411  array,
412  string,
413  boolean,
414  number_integer,
415  number_unsigned,
416  number_float,
417  discarded
418 };
419 
429 inline bool operator<(const value_t lhs, const value_t rhs) noexcept
430 {
431  static constexpr std::array<uint8_t, 8> order = {{
432  0, // null
433  3, // object
434  4, // array
435  5, // string
436  1, // boolean
437  2, // integer
438  2, // unsigned
439  2, // float
440  }
441  };
442 
443  // discarded values are not comparable
444  if (lhs == value_t::discarded or rhs == value_t::discarded)
445  {
446  return false;
447  }
448 
449  return order[static_cast<std::size_t>(lhs)] <
450  order[static_cast<std::size_t>(rhs)];
451 }
452 
453 
455 // helpers //
457 
458 // alias templates to reduce boilerplate
459 template<bool B, typename T = void>
460 using enable_if_t = typename std::enable_if<B, T>::type;
461 
462 template<typename T>
463 using uncvref_t = typename std::remove_cv<typename std::remove_reference<T>::type>::type;
464 
465 /*
466 Implementation of two C++17 constructs: conjunction, negation. This is needed
467 to avoid evaluating all the traits in a condition
468 
469 For example: not std::is_same<void, T>::value and has_value_type<T>::value
470 will not compile when T = void (on MSVC at least). Whereas
471 conjunction<negation<std::is_same<void, T>>, has_value_type<T>>::value will
472 stop evaluating if negation<...>::value == false
473 
474 Please note that those constructs must be used with caution, since symbols can
475 become very long quickly (which can slow down compilation and cause MSVC
476 internal compiler errors). Only use it when you have to (see example ahead).
477 */
478 template<class...> struct conjunction : std::true_type {};
479 template<class B1> struct conjunction<B1> : B1 {};
480 template<class B1, class... Bn>
481 struct conjunction<B1, Bn...> : std::conditional<bool(B1::value), conjunction<Bn...>, B1>::type {};
482 
483 template<class B> struct negation : std::integral_constant < bool, !B::value > {};
484 
485 // dispatch utility (taken from ranges-v3)
486 template<unsigned N> struct priority_tag : priority_tag < N - 1 > {};
487 template<> struct priority_tag<0> {};
488 
489 
491 // constructors //
493 
494 template<value_t> struct external_constructor;
495 
496 template<>
497 struct external_constructor<value_t::boolean>
498 {
499  template<typename BasicJsonType>
500  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t b) noexcept
501  {
502  j.m_type = value_t::boolean;
503  j.m_value = b;
504  j.assert_invariant();
505  }
506 };
507 
508 template<>
509 struct external_constructor<value_t::string>
510 {
511  template<typename BasicJsonType>
512  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const typename BasicJsonType::string_t& s)
513  {
514  j.m_type = value_t::string;
515  j.m_value = s;
516  j.assert_invariant();
517  }
518 };
519 
520 template<>
521 struct external_constructor<value_t::number_float>
522 {
523  template<typename BasicJsonType>
524  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t val) noexcept
525  {
526  j.m_type = value_t::number_float;
527  j.m_value = val;
528  j.assert_invariant();
529  }
530 };
531 
532 template<>
533 struct external_constructor<value_t::number_unsigned>
534 {
535  template<typename BasicJsonType>
536  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t val) noexcept
537  {
538  j.m_type = value_t::number_unsigned;
539  j.m_value = val;
540  j.assert_invariant();
541  }
542 };
543 
544 template<>
545 struct external_constructor<value_t::number_integer>
546 {
547  template<typename BasicJsonType>
548  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t val) noexcept
549  {
550  j.m_type = value_t::number_integer;
551  j.m_value = val;
552  j.assert_invariant();
553  }
554 };
555 
556 template<>
557 struct external_constructor<value_t::array>
558 {
559  template<typename BasicJsonType>
560  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const typename BasicJsonType::array_t& arr)
561  {
562  j.m_type = value_t::array;
563  j.m_value = arr;
564  j.assert_invariant();
565  }
566 
567  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType,
568  enable_if_t<not std::is_same<CompatibleArrayType,
569  typename BasicJsonType::array_t>::value,
570  int> = 0>
571  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleArrayType& arr)
572  {
573  using std::begin;
574  using std::end;
575  j.m_type = value_t::array;
576  j.m_value.array = j.template create<typename BasicJsonType::array_t>(begin(arr), end(arr));
577  j.assert_invariant();
578  }
579 
580  template<typename BasicJsonType>
581  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const std::vector<bool>& arr)
582  {
583  j.m_type = value_t::array;
584  j.m_value = value_t::array;
585  j.m_value.array->reserve(arr.size());
586  for (bool x : arr)
587  {
588  j.m_value.array->push_back(x);
589  }
590  j.assert_invariant();
591  }
592 };
593 
594 template<>
595 struct external_constructor<value_t::object>
596 {
597  template<typename BasicJsonType>
598  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const typename BasicJsonType::object_t& obj)
599  {
600  j.m_type = value_t::object;
601  j.m_value = obj;
602  j.assert_invariant();
603  }
604 
605  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleObjectType,
606  enable_if_t<not std::is_same<CompatibleObjectType,
607  typename BasicJsonType::object_t>::value,
608  int> = 0>
609  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleObjectType& obj)
610  {
611  using std::begin;
612  using std::end;
613 
614  j.m_type = value_t::object;
615  j.m_value.object = j.template create<typename BasicJsonType::object_t>(begin(obj), end(obj));
616  j.assert_invariant();
617  }
618 };
619 
620 
622 // has_/is_ functions //
624 
635 #define NLOHMANN_JSON_HAS_HELPER(type) \
636  template<typename T> struct has_##type { \
637  private: \
638  template<typename U, typename = typename U::type> \
639  static int detect(U &&); \
640  static void detect(...); \
641  public: \
642  static constexpr bool value = \
643  std::is_integral<decltype(detect(std::declval<T>()))>::value; \
644  }
645 
646 NLOHMANN_JSON_HAS_HELPER(mapped_type);
647 NLOHMANN_JSON_HAS_HELPER(key_type);
648 NLOHMANN_JSON_HAS_HELPER(value_type);
649 NLOHMANN_JSON_HAS_HELPER(iterator);
650 
651 #undef NLOHMANN_JSON_HAS_HELPER
652 
653 
654 template<bool B, class RealType, class CompatibleObjectType>
655 struct is_compatible_object_type_impl : std::false_type {};
656 
657 template<class RealType, class CompatibleObjectType>
658 struct is_compatible_object_type_impl<true, RealType, CompatibleObjectType>
659 {
660  static constexpr auto value =
661  std::is_constructible<typename RealType::key_type,
662  typename CompatibleObjectType::key_type>::value and
663  std::is_constructible<typename RealType::mapped_type,
664  typename CompatibleObjectType::mapped_type>::value;
665 };
666 
667 template<class BasicJsonType, class CompatibleObjectType>
668 struct is_compatible_object_type
669 {
670  static auto constexpr value = is_compatible_object_type_impl <
671  conjunction<negation<std::is_same<void, CompatibleObjectType>>,
672  has_mapped_type<CompatibleObjectType>,
673  has_key_type<CompatibleObjectType>>::value,
674  typename BasicJsonType::object_t, CompatibleObjectType >::value;
675 };
676 
677 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
678 struct is_basic_json_nested_type
679 {
680  static auto constexpr value = std::is_same<T, typename BasicJsonType::iterator>::value or
681  std::is_same<T, typename BasicJsonType::const_iterator>::value or
682  std::is_same<T, typename BasicJsonType::reverse_iterator>::value or
683  std::is_same<T, typename BasicJsonType::const_reverse_iterator>::value or
684  std::is_same<T, typename BasicJsonType::json_pointer>::value;
685 };
686 
687 template<class BasicJsonType, class CompatibleArrayType>
688 struct is_compatible_array_type
689 {
690  static auto constexpr value =
691  conjunction<negation<std::is_same<void, CompatibleArrayType>>,
692  negation<is_compatible_object_type<
693  BasicJsonType, CompatibleArrayType>>,
694  negation<std::is_constructible<typename BasicJsonType::string_t,
695  CompatibleArrayType>>,
696  negation<is_basic_json_nested_type<BasicJsonType, CompatibleArrayType>>,
697  has_value_type<CompatibleArrayType>,
698  has_iterator<CompatibleArrayType>>::value;
699 };
700 
701 template<bool, typename, typename>
702 struct is_compatible_integer_type_impl : std::false_type {};
703 
704 template<typename RealIntegerType, typename CompatibleNumberIntegerType>
705 struct is_compatible_integer_type_impl<true, RealIntegerType, CompatibleNumberIntegerType>
706 {
707  // is there an assert somewhere on overflows?
708  using RealLimits = std::numeric_limits<RealIntegerType>;
709  using CompatibleLimits = std::numeric_limits<CompatibleNumberIntegerType>;
710 
711  static constexpr auto value =
712  std::is_constructible<RealIntegerType,
713  CompatibleNumberIntegerType>::value and
714  CompatibleLimits::is_integer and
715  RealLimits::is_signed == CompatibleLimits::is_signed;
716 };
717 
718 template<typename RealIntegerType, typename CompatibleNumberIntegerType>
719 struct is_compatible_integer_type
720 {
721  static constexpr auto value =
722  is_compatible_integer_type_impl <
723  std::is_integral<CompatibleNumberIntegerType>::value and
724  not std::is_same<bool, CompatibleNumberIntegerType>::value,
725  RealIntegerType, CompatibleNumberIntegerType > ::value;
726 };
727 
728 
729 // trait checking if JSONSerializer<T>::from_json(json const&, udt&) exists
730 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
731 struct has_from_json
732 {
733  private:
734  // also check the return type of from_json
735  template<typename U, typename = enable_if_t<std::is_same<void, decltype(uncvref_t<U>::from_json(
736  std::declval<BasicJsonType>(), std::declval<T&>()))>::value>>
737  static int detect(U&&);
738  static void detect(...);
739 
740  public:
741  static constexpr bool value = std::is_integral<decltype(
742  detect(std::declval<typename BasicJsonType::template json_serializer<T, void>>()))>::value;
743 };
744 
745 // This trait checks if JSONSerializer<T>::from_json(json const&) exists
746 // this overload is used for non-default-constructible user-defined-types
747 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
748 struct has_non_default_from_json
749 {
750  private:
751  template <
752  typename U,
753  typename = enable_if_t<std::is_same<
754  T, decltype(uncvref_t<U>::from_json(std::declval<BasicJsonType>()))>::value >>
755  static int detect(U&&);
756  static void detect(...);
757 
758  public:
759  static constexpr bool value = std::is_integral<decltype(detect(
760  std::declval<typename BasicJsonType::template json_serializer<T, void>>()))>::value;
761 };
762 
763 // This trait checks if BasicJsonType::json_serializer<T>::to_json exists
764 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
765 struct has_to_json
766 {
767  private:
768  template<typename U, typename = decltype(uncvref_t<U>::to_json(
769  std::declval<BasicJsonType&>(), std::declval<T>()))>
770  static int detect(U&&);
771  static void detect(...);
772 
773  public:
774  static constexpr bool value = std::is_integral<decltype(detect(
775  std::declval<typename BasicJsonType::template json_serializer<T, void>>()))>::value;
776 };
777 
778 
780 // to_json //
782 
783 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T, enable_if_t<
784  std::is_same<T, typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t>::value, int> = 0>
785 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, T b) noexcept
786 {
787  external_constructor<value_t::boolean>::construct(j, b);
788 }
789 
790 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleString,
791  enable_if_t<std::is_constructible<typename BasicJsonType::string_t,
792  CompatibleString>::value, int> = 0>
793 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleString& s)
794 {
795  external_constructor<value_t::string>::construct(j, s);
796 }
797 
798 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename FloatType,
799  enable_if_t<std::is_floating_point<FloatType>::value, int> = 0>
800 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, FloatType val) noexcept
801 {
802  external_constructor<value_t::number_float>::construct(j, static_cast<typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t>(val));
803 }
804 
805 template <
806  typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleNumberUnsignedType,
807  enable_if_t<is_compatible_integer_type<typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t,
808  CompatibleNumberUnsignedType>::value, int> = 0 >
809 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, CompatibleNumberUnsignedType val) noexcept
810 {
811  external_constructor<value_t::number_unsigned>::construct(j, static_cast<typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t>(val));
812 }
813 
814 template <
815  typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleNumberIntegerType,
816  enable_if_t<is_compatible_integer_type<typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t,
817  CompatibleNumberIntegerType>::value, int> = 0 >
818 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, CompatibleNumberIntegerType val) noexcept
819 {
820  external_constructor<value_t::number_integer>::construct(j, static_cast<typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t>(val));
821 }
822 
823 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename EnumType,
824  enable_if_t<std::is_enum<EnumType>::value, int> = 0>
825 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, EnumType e) noexcept
826 {
827  using underlying_type = typename std::underlying_type<EnumType>::type;
828  external_constructor<value_t::number_integer>::construct(j, static_cast<underlying_type>(e));
829 }
830 
831 template<typename BasicJsonType>
832 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const std::vector<bool>& e)
833 {
834  external_constructor<value_t::array>::construct(j, e);
835 }
836 
837 template <
838  typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType,
839  enable_if_t <
840  is_compatible_array_type<BasicJsonType, CompatibleArrayType>::value or
841  std::is_same<typename BasicJsonType::array_t, CompatibleArrayType>::value,
842  int > = 0 >
843 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleArrayType& arr)
844 {
845  external_constructor<value_t::array>::construct(j, arr);
846 }
847 
848 template <
849  typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleObjectType,
850  enable_if_t<is_compatible_object_type<BasicJsonType, CompatibleObjectType>::value,
851  int> = 0 >
852 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleObjectType& arr)
853 {
854  external_constructor<value_t::object>::construct(j, arr);
855 }
856 
857 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T, std::size_t N,
858  enable_if_t<not std::is_constructible<
859  typename BasicJsonType::string_t, T (&)[N]>::value,
860  int> = 0>
861 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, T (&arr)[N])
862 {
863  external_constructor<value_t::array>::construct(j, arr);
864 }
865 
867 // from_json //
869 
870 // overloads for basic_json template parameters
871 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename ArithmeticType,
872  enable_if_t<std::is_arithmetic<ArithmeticType>::value and
873  not std::is_same<ArithmeticType,
874  typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t>::value,
875  int> = 0>
876 void get_arithmetic_value(const BasicJsonType& j, ArithmeticType& val)
877 {
878  switch (static_cast<value_t>(j))
879  {
880  case value_t::number_unsigned:
881  {
882  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(
883  *j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t*>());
884  break;
885  }
886  case value_t::number_integer:
887  {
888  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(
889  *j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t*>());
890  break;
891  }
892  case value_t::number_float:
893  {
894  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(
895  *j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t*>());
896  break;
897  }
898  default:
899  {
900  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be number, but is " + j.type_name()));
901  }
902  }
903 }
904 
905 template<typename BasicJsonType>
906 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t& b)
907 {
908  if (not j.is_boolean())
909  {
910  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be boolean, but is " + j.type_name()));
911  }
912  b = *j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t*>();
913 }
914 
915 template<typename BasicJsonType>
916 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::string_t& s)
917 {
918  if (not j.is_string())
919  {
920  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be string, but is " + j.type_name()));
921  }
922  s = *j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::string_t*>();
923 }
924 
925 template<typename BasicJsonType>
926 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t& val)
927 {
928  get_arithmetic_value(j, val);
929 }
930 
931 template<typename BasicJsonType>
932 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t& val)
933 {
934  get_arithmetic_value(j, val);
935 }
936 
937 template<typename BasicJsonType>
938 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t& val)
939 {
940  get_arithmetic_value(j, val);
941 }
942 
943 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename EnumType,
944  enable_if_t<std::is_enum<EnumType>::value, int> = 0>
945 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, EnumType& e)
946 {
947  typename std::underlying_type<EnumType>::type val;
948  get_arithmetic_value(j, val);
949  e = static_cast<EnumType>(val);
950 }
951 
952 template<typename BasicJsonType>
953 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::array_t& arr)
954 {
955  if (not j.is_array())
956  {
957  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be array, but is " + j.type_name()));
958  }
959  arr = *j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::array_t*>();
960 }
961 
962 // forward_list doesn't have an insert method
963 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T, typename Allocator,
964  enable_if_t<std::is_convertible<BasicJsonType, T>::value, int> = 0>
965 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, std::forward_list<T, Allocator>& l)
966 {
967  if (not j.is_array())
968  {
969  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be array, but is " + j.type_name()));
970  }
971 
972  for (auto it = j.rbegin(), end = j.rend(); it != end; ++it)
973  {
974  l.push_front(it->template get<T>());
975  }
976 }
977 
978 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType>
979 void from_json_array_impl(const BasicJsonType& j, CompatibleArrayType& arr, priority_tag<0>)
980 {
981  using std::begin;
982  using std::end;
983 
984  std::transform(j.begin(), j.end(),
985  std::inserter(arr, end(arr)), [](const BasicJsonType & i)
986  {
987  // get<BasicJsonType>() returns *this, this won't call a from_json
988  // method when value_type is BasicJsonType
989  return i.template get<typename CompatibleArrayType::value_type>();
990  });
991 }
992 
993 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType>
994 auto from_json_array_impl(const BasicJsonType& j, CompatibleArrayType& arr, priority_tag<1>)
995 -> decltype(
996  arr.reserve(std::declval<typename CompatibleArrayType::size_type>()),
997  void())
998 {
999  using std::begin;
1000  using std::end;
1001 
1002  arr.reserve(j.size());
1003  std::transform(j.begin(), j.end(),
1004  std::inserter(arr, end(arr)), [](const BasicJsonType & i)
1005  {
1006  // get<BasicJsonType>() returns *this, this won't call a from_json
1007  // method when value_type is BasicJsonType
1008  return i.template get<typename CompatibleArrayType::value_type>();
1009  });
1010 }
1011 
1012 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType,
1013  enable_if_t<is_compatible_array_type<BasicJsonType, CompatibleArrayType>::value and
1014  std::is_convertible<BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType::value_type>::value and
1015  not std::is_same<typename BasicJsonType::array_t, CompatibleArrayType>::value, int> = 0>
1016 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, CompatibleArrayType& arr)
1017 {
1018  if (not j.is_array())
1019  {
1020  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be array, but is " + j.type_name()));
1021  }
1022 
1023  from_json_array_impl(j, arr, priority_tag<1> {});
1024 }
1025 
1026 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleObjectType,
1027  enable_if_t<is_compatible_object_type<BasicJsonType, CompatibleObjectType>::value, int> = 0>
1028 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, CompatibleObjectType& obj)
1029 {
1030  if (not j.is_object())
1031  {
1032  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be object, but is " + j.type_name()));
1033  }
1034 
1035  auto inner_object = j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::object_t*>();
1036  using std::begin;
1037  using std::end;
1038  // we could avoid the assignment, but this might require a for loop, which
1039  // might be less efficient than the container constructor for some
1040  // containers (would it?)
1041  obj = CompatibleObjectType(begin(*inner_object), end(*inner_object));
1042 }
1043 
1044 // overload for arithmetic types, not chosen for basic_json template arguments
1045 // (BooleanType, etc..); note: Is it really necessary to provide explicit
1046 // overloads for boolean_t etc. in case of a custom BooleanType which is not
1047 // an arithmetic type?
1048 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename ArithmeticType,
1049  enable_if_t <
1050  std::is_arithmetic<ArithmeticType>::value and
1051  not std::is_same<ArithmeticType, typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t>::value and
1052  not std::is_same<ArithmeticType, typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t>::value and
1053  not std::is_same<ArithmeticType, typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t>::value and
1054  not std::is_same<ArithmeticType, typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t>::value,
1055  int> = 0>
1056 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, ArithmeticType& val)
1057 {
1058  switch (static_cast<value_t>(j))
1059  {
1060  case value_t::number_unsigned:
1061  {
1062  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t*>());
1063  break;
1064  }
1065  case value_t::number_integer:
1066  {
1067  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t*>());
1068  break;
1069  }
1070  case value_t::number_float:
1071  {
1072  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t*>());
1073  break;
1074  }
1075  case value_t::boolean:
1076  {
1077  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t*>());
1078  break;
1079  }
1080  default:
1081  {
1082  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be number, but is " + j.type_name()));
1083  }
1084  }
1085 }
1086 
1087 struct to_json_fn
1088 {
1089  private:
1090  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
1091  auto call(BasicJsonType& j, T&& val, priority_tag<1>) const noexcept(noexcept(to_json(j, std::forward<T>(val))))
1092  -> decltype(to_json(j, std::forward<T>(val)), void())
1093  {
1094  return to_json(j, std::forward<T>(val));
1095  }
1096 
1097  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
1098  void call(BasicJsonType&, T&&, priority_tag<0>) const noexcept
1099  {
1100  static_assert(sizeof(BasicJsonType) == 0,
1101  "could not find to_json() method in T's namespace");
1102  }
1103 
1104  public:
1105  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
1106  void operator()(BasicJsonType& j, T&& val) const
1107  noexcept(noexcept(std::declval<to_json_fn>().call(j, std::forward<T>(val), priority_tag<1> {})))
1108  {
1109  return call(j, std::forward<T>(val), priority_tag<1> {});
1110  }
1111 };
1112 
1113 struct from_json_fn
1114 {
1115  private:
1116  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
1117  auto call(const BasicJsonType& j, T& val, priority_tag<1>) const
1118  noexcept(noexcept(from_json(j, val)))
1119  -> decltype(from_json(j, val), void())
1120  {
1121  return from_json(j, val);
1122  }
1123 
1124  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
1125  void call(const BasicJsonType&, T&, priority_tag<0>) const noexcept
1126  {
1127  static_assert(sizeof(BasicJsonType) == 0,
1128  "could not find from_json() method in T's namespace");
1129  }
1130 
1131  public:
1132  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
1133  void operator()(const BasicJsonType& j, T& val) const
1134  noexcept(noexcept(std::declval<from_json_fn>().call(j, val, priority_tag<1> {})))
1135  {
1136  return call(j, val, priority_tag<1> {});
1137  }
1138 };
1139 
1140 // taken from ranges-v3
1141 template<typename T>
1142 struct static_const
1143 {
1144  static constexpr T value{};
1145 };
1146 
1147 template<typename T>
1148 constexpr T static_const<T>::value;
1149 } // namespace detail
1150 
1151 
1153 namespace
1154 {
1155 constexpr const auto& to_json = detail::static_const<detail::to_json_fn>::value;
1156 constexpr const auto& from_json = detail::static_const<detail::from_json_fn>::value;
1157 }
1158 
1159 
1167 template<typename = void, typename = void>
1168 struct adl_serializer
1169 {
1179  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename ValueType>
1180  static void from_json(BasicJsonType&& j, ValueType& val) noexcept(
1181  noexcept(::possumwood::io::from_json(std::forward<BasicJsonType>(j), val)))
1182  {
1183  ::possumwood::io::from_json(std::forward<BasicJsonType>(j), val);
1184  }
1185 
1195  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename ValueType>
1196  static void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, ValueType&& val) noexcept(
1197  noexcept(::possumwood::io::to_json(j, std::forward<ValueType>(val))))
1198  {
1199  ::possumwood::io::to_json(j, std::forward<ValueType>(val));
1200  }
1201 };
1202 
1203 
1285 template <
1286  template<typename U, typename V, typename... Args> class ObjectType = std::map,
1287  template<typename U, typename... Args> class ArrayType = std::vector,
1288  class StringType = std::string,
1289  class BooleanType = bool,
1290  class NumberIntegerType = std::int64_t,
1291  class NumberUnsignedType = std::uint64_t,
1292  class NumberFloatType = double,
1293  template<typename U> class AllocatorType = std::allocator,
1294  template<typename T, typename SFINAE = void> class JSONSerializer = adl_serializer
1295  >
1296 class basic_json
1297 {
1298  private:
1299  template<detail::value_t> friend struct detail::external_constructor;
1301  using basic_json_t = basic_json<ObjectType, ArrayType, StringType,
1302  BooleanType, NumberIntegerType, NumberUnsignedType, NumberFloatType,
1303  AllocatorType, JSONSerializer>;
1304 
1305  public:
1306  using value_t = detail::value_t;
1307  // forward declarations
1308  template<typename U> class iter_impl;
1309  template<typename Base> class json_reverse_iterator;
1310  class json_pointer;
1311  template<typename T, typename SFINAE>
1312  using json_serializer = JSONSerializer<T, SFINAE>;
1313 
1314 
1316  // exceptions //
1318 
1322 
1324  using exception = detail::exception;
1326  using parse_error = detail::parse_error;
1328  using invalid_iterator = detail::invalid_iterator;
1330  using type_error = detail::type_error;
1332  using out_of_range = detail::out_of_range;
1334  using other_error = detail::other_error;
1335 
1337 
1338 
1340  // container types //
1342 
1347 
1349  using value_type = basic_json;
1350 
1352  using reference = value_type&;
1354  using const_reference = const value_type&;
1355 
1357  using difference_type = std::ptrdiff_t;
1359  using size_type = std::size_t;
1360 
1362  using allocator_type = AllocatorType<basic_json>;
1363 
1365  using pointer = typename std::allocator_traits<allocator_type>::pointer;
1367  using const_pointer = typename std::allocator_traits<allocator_type>::const_pointer;
1368 
1370  using iterator = iter_impl<basic_json>;
1372  using const_iterator = iter_impl<const basic_json>;
1374  using reverse_iterator = json_reverse_iterator<typename basic_json::iterator>;
1376  using const_reverse_iterator = json_reverse_iterator<typename basic_json::const_iterator>;
1377 
1379 
1380 
1384  static allocator_type get_allocator()
1385  {
1386  return allocator_type();
1387  }
1388 
1412  static basic_json meta()
1413  {
1414  basic_json result;
1415 
1416  result["copyright"] = "(C) 2013-2017 Niels Lohmann";
1417  result["name"] = "JSON for Modern C++";
1418  result["url"] = "https://github.com/nlohmann/json";
1419  result["version"] =
1420  {
1421  {"string", "2.1.1"}, {"major", 2}, {"minor", 1}, {"patch", 1}
1422  };
1423 
1424 #ifdef _WIN32
1425  result["platform"] = "win32";
1426 #elif defined __linux__
1427  result["platform"] = "linux";
1428 #elif defined __APPLE__
1429  result["platform"] = "apple";
1430 #elif defined __unix__
1431  result["platform"] = "unix";
1432 #else
1433  result["platform"] = "unknown";
1434 #endif
1435 
1436 #if defined(__clang__)
1437  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "clang"}, {"version", __clang_version__}};
1438 #elif defined(__ICC) || defined(__INTEL_COMPILER)
1439  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "icc"}, {"version", __INTEL_COMPILER}};
1440 #elif defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
1441  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "gcc"}, {"version", std::to_string(__GNUC__) + "." + std::to_string(__GNUC_MINOR__) + "." + std::to_string(__GNUC_PATCHLEVEL__)}};
1442 #elif defined(__HP_cc) || defined(__HP_aCC)
1443  result["compiler"] = "hp"
1444 #elif defined(__IBMCPP__)
1445  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "ilecpp"}, {"version", __IBMCPP__}};
1446 #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
1447  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "msvc"}, {"version", _MSC_VER}};
1448 #elif defined(__PGI)
1449  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "pgcpp"}, {"version", __PGI}};
1450 #elif defined(__SUNPRO_CC)
1451  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "sunpro"}, {"version", __SUNPRO_CC}};
1452 #else
1453  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "unknown"}, {"version", "unknown"}};
1454 #endif
1455 
1456 #ifdef __cplusplus
1457  result["compiler"]["c++"] = std::to_string(__cplusplus);
1458 #else
1459  result["compiler"]["c++"] = "unknown";
1460 #endif
1461  return result;
1462  }
1463 
1464 
1466  // JSON value data types //
1468 
1473 
1557  using object_t = ObjectType<StringType,
1558  basic_json,
1559  std::less<StringType>,
1560  AllocatorType<std::pair<const StringType,
1561  basic_json>>>;
1562 
1607  using array_t = ArrayType<basic_json, AllocatorType<basic_json>>;
1608 
1660  using string_t = StringType;
1661 
1686  using boolean_t = BooleanType;
1687 
1758  using number_integer_t = NumberIntegerType;
1759 
1829  using number_unsigned_t = NumberUnsignedType;
1830 
1897  using number_float_t = NumberFloatType;
1898 
1900 
1901  private:
1902 
1904  template<typename T, typename... Args>
1905  static T* create(Args&& ... args)
1906  {
1907  AllocatorType<T> alloc;
1908  auto deleter = [&](T * object)
1909  {
1910  alloc.deallocate(object, 1);
1911  };
1912  std::unique_ptr<T, decltype(deleter)> object(alloc.allocate(1), deleter);
1913  alloc.construct(object.get(), std::forward<Args>(args)...);
1914  assert(object != nullptr);
1915  return object.release();
1916  }
1917 
1919  // JSON value storage //
1921 
1946  union json_value
1947  {
1949  object_t* object;
1951  array_t* array;
1953  string_t* string;
1955  boolean_t boolean;
1957  number_integer_t number_integer;
1959  number_unsigned_t number_unsigned;
1961  number_float_t number_float;
1962 
1964  json_value() = default;
1966  json_value(boolean_t v) noexcept : boolean(v) {}
1968  json_value(number_integer_t v) noexcept : number_integer(v) {}
1970  json_value(number_unsigned_t v) noexcept : number_unsigned(v) {}
1972  json_value(number_float_t v) noexcept : number_float(v) {}
1974  json_value(value_t t)
1975  {
1976  switch (t)
1977  {
1978  case value_t::object:
1979  {
1980  object = create<object_t>();
1981  break;
1982  }
1983 
1984  case value_t::array:
1985  {
1986  array = create<array_t>();
1987  break;
1988  }
1989 
1990  case value_t::string:
1991  {
1992  string = create<string_t>("");
1993  break;
1994  }
1995 
1996  case value_t::boolean:
1997  {
1998  boolean = boolean_t(false);
1999  break;
2000  }
2001 
2002  case value_t::number_integer:
2003  {
2004  number_integer = number_integer_t(0);
2005  break;
2006  }
2007 
2008  case value_t::number_unsigned:
2009  {
2010  number_unsigned = number_unsigned_t(0);
2011  break;
2012  }
2013 
2014  case value_t::number_float:
2015  {
2016  number_float = number_float_t(0.0);
2017  break;
2018  }
2019 
2020  case value_t::null:
2021  {
2022  break;
2023  }
2024 
2025  default:
2026  {
2027  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(t == value_t::null))
2028  {
2029  JSON_THROW(other_error::create(500, "961c151d2e87f2686a955a9be24d316f1362bf21 2.1.1")); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
2030  }
2031  break;
2032  }
2033  }
2034  }
2035 
2037  json_value(const string_t& value)
2038  {
2039  string = create<string_t>(value);
2040  }
2041 
2043  json_value(const object_t& value)
2044  {
2045  object = create<object_t>(value);
2046  }
2047 
2049  json_value(const array_t& value)
2050  {
2051  array = create<array_t>(value);
2052  }
2053  };
2054 
2064  void assert_invariant() const
2065  {
2066  assert(m_type != value_t::object or m_value.object != nullptr);
2067  assert(m_type != value_t::array or m_value.array != nullptr);
2068  assert(m_type != value_t::string or m_value.string != nullptr);
2069  }
2070 
2071  public:
2073  // JSON parser callback //
2075 
2086  enum class parse_event_t : uint8_t
2087  {
2089  object_start,
2091  object_end,
2093  array_start,
2095  array_end,
2097  key,
2099  value
2100  };
2101 
2154  using parser_callback_t = std::function<bool(int depth,
2155  parse_event_t event,
2156  basic_json& parsed)>;
2157 
2158 
2160  // constructors //
2162 
2167 
2192  basic_json(const value_t value_type)
2193  : m_type(value_type), m_value(value_type)
2194  {
2195  assert_invariant();
2196  }
2197 
2216  basic_json(std::nullptr_t = nullptr) noexcept
2217  : basic_json(value_t::null)
2218  {
2219  assert_invariant();
2220  }
2221 
2275  template<typename CompatibleType, typename U = detail::uncvref_t<CompatibleType>,
2276  detail::enable_if_t<not std::is_base_of<std::istream, U>::value and
2277  not std::is_same<U, basic_json_t>::value and
2278  not detail::is_basic_json_nested_type<
2279  basic_json_t, U>::value and
2280  detail::has_to_json<basic_json, U>::value,
2281  int> = 0>
2282  basic_json(CompatibleType && val) noexcept(noexcept(JSONSerializer<U>::to_json(
2283  std::declval<basic_json_t&>(), std::forward<CompatibleType>(val))))
2284  {
2285  JSONSerializer<U>::to_json(*this, std::forward<CompatibleType>(val));
2286  assert_invariant();
2287  }
2288 
2360  basic_json(std::initializer_list<basic_json> init,
2361  bool type_deduction = true,
2362  value_t manual_type = value_t::array)
2363  {
2364  // check if each element is an array with two elements whose first
2365  // element is a string
2366  bool is_an_object = std::all_of(init.begin(), init.end(),
2367  [](const basic_json & element)
2368  {
2369  return element.is_array() and element.size() == 2 and element[0].is_string();
2370  });
2371 
2372  // adjust type if type deduction is not wanted
2373  if (not type_deduction)
2374  {
2375  // if array is wanted, do not create an object though possible
2376  if (manual_type == value_t::array)
2377  {
2378  is_an_object = false;
2379  }
2380 
2381  // if object is wanted but impossible, throw an exception
2382  if (manual_type == value_t::object and not is_an_object)
2383  {
2384  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(301, "cannot create object from initializer list"));
2385  }
2386  }
2387 
2388  if (is_an_object)
2389  {
2390  // the initializer list is a list of pairs -> create object
2391  m_type = value_t::object;
2392  m_value = value_t::object;
2393 
2394  std::for_each(init.begin(), init.end(), [this](const basic_json & element)
2395  {
2396  m_value.object->emplace(*(element[0].m_value.string), element[1]);
2397  });
2398  }
2399  else
2400  {
2401  // the initializer list describes an array -> create array
2402  m_type = value_t::array;
2403  m_value.array = create<array_t>(init);
2404  }
2405 
2406  assert_invariant();
2407  }
2408 
2443  static basic_json array(std::initializer_list<basic_json> init =
2444  std::initializer_list<basic_json>())
2445  {
2446  return basic_json(init, false, value_t::array);
2447  }
2448 
2484  static basic_json object(std::initializer_list<basic_json> init =
2485  std::initializer_list<basic_json>())
2486  {
2487  return basic_json(init, false, value_t::object);
2488  }
2489 
2508  basic_json(size_type cnt, const basic_json& val)
2509  : m_type(value_t::array)
2510  {
2511  m_value.array = create<array_t>(cnt, val);
2512  assert_invariant();
2513  }
2514 
2557  template<class InputIT, typename std::enable_if<
2558  std::is_same<InputIT, typename basic_json_t::iterator>::value or
2559  std::is_same<InputIT, typename basic_json_t::const_iterator>::value, int>::type = 0>
2560  basic_json(InputIT first, InputIT last)
2561  {
2562  assert(first.m_object != nullptr);
2563  assert(last.m_object != nullptr);
2564 
2565  // make sure iterator fits the current value
2566  if (first.m_object != last.m_object)
2567  {
2568  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(201, "iterators are not compatible"));
2569  }
2570 
2571  // copy type from first iterator
2572  m_type = first.m_object->m_type;
2573 
2574  // check if iterator range is complete for primitive values
2575  switch (m_type)
2576  {
2577  case value_t::boolean:
2578  case value_t::number_float:
2579  case value_t::number_integer:
2580  case value_t::number_unsigned:
2581  case value_t::string:
2582  {
2583  if (not first.m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin() or not last.m_it.primitive_iterator.is_end())
2584  {
2585  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(204, "iterators out of range"));
2586  }
2587  break;
2588  }
2589 
2590  default:
2591  {
2592  break;
2593  }
2594  }
2595 
2596  switch (m_type)
2597  {
2598  case value_t::number_integer:
2599  {
2600  m_value.number_integer = first.m_object->m_value.number_integer;
2601  break;
2602  }
2603 
2604  case value_t::number_unsigned:
2605  {
2606  m_value.number_unsigned = first.m_object->m_value.number_unsigned;
2607  break;
2608  }
2609 
2610  case value_t::number_float:
2611  {
2612  m_value.number_float = first.m_object->m_value.number_float;
2613  break;
2614  }
2615 
2616  case value_t::boolean:
2617  {
2618  m_value.boolean = first.m_object->m_value.boolean;
2619  break;
2620  }
2621 
2622  case value_t::string:
2623  {
2624  m_value = *first.m_object->m_value.string;
2625  break;
2626  }
2627 
2628  case value_t::object:
2629  {
2630  m_value.object = create<object_t>(first.m_it.object_iterator,
2631  last.m_it.object_iterator);
2632  break;
2633  }
2634 
2635  case value_t::array:
2636  {
2637  m_value.array = create<array_t>(first.m_it.array_iterator,
2638  last.m_it.array_iterator);
2639  break;
2640  }
2641 
2642  default:
2643  {
2644  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(206, "cannot construct with iterators from " +
2645  first.m_object->type_name()));
2646  }
2647  }
2648 
2649  assert_invariant();
2650  }
2651 
2652 
2654  // other constructors and destructor //
2656 
2677  basic_json(const basic_json& other)
2678  : m_type(other.m_type)
2679  {
2680  // check of passed value is valid
2681  other.assert_invariant();
2682 
2683  switch (m_type)
2684  {
2685  case value_t::object:
2686  {
2687  m_value = *other.m_value.object;
2688  break;
2689  }
2690 
2691  case value_t::array:
2692  {
2693  m_value = *other.m_value.array;
2694  break;
2695  }
2696 
2697  case value_t::string:
2698  {
2699  m_value = *other.m_value.string;
2700  break;
2701  }
2702 
2703  case value_t::boolean:
2704  {
2705  m_value = other.m_value.boolean;
2706  break;
2707  }
2708 
2709  case value_t::number_integer:
2710  {
2711  m_value = other.m_value.number_integer;
2712  break;
2713  }
2714 
2715  case value_t::number_unsigned:
2716  {
2717  m_value = other.m_value.number_unsigned;
2718  break;
2719  }
2720 
2721  case value_t::number_float:
2722  {
2723  m_value = other.m_value.number_float;
2724  break;
2725  }
2726 
2727  default:
2728  {
2729  break;
2730  }
2731  }
2732 
2733  assert_invariant();
2734  }
2735 
2754  basic_json(basic_json&& other) noexcept
2755  : m_type(std::move(other.m_type)),
2756  m_value(std::move(other.m_value))
2757  {
2758  // check that passed value is valid
2759  other.assert_invariant();
2760 
2761  // invalidate payload
2762  other.m_type = value_t::null;
2763  other.m_value = {};
2764 
2765  assert_invariant();
2766  }
2767 
2791  reference& operator=(basic_json other) noexcept (
2792  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<value_t>::value and
2793  std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<value_t>::value and
2794  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<json_value>::value and
2795  std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<json_value>::value
2796  )
2797  {
2798  // check that passed value is valid
2799  other.assert_invariant();
2800 
2801  using std::swap;
2802  swap(m_type, other.m_type);
2803  swap(m_value, other.m_value);
2804 
2805  assert_invariant();
2806  return *this;
2807  }
2808 
2824  ~basic_json()
2825  {
2826  assert_invariant();
2827 
2828  switch (m_type)
2829  {
2830  case value_t::object:
2831  {
2832  AllocatorType<object_t> alloc;
2833  alloc.destroy(m_value.object);
2834  alloc.deallocate(m_value.object, 1);
2835  break;
2836  }
2837 
2838  case value_t::array:
2839  {
2840  AllocatorType<array_t> alloc;
2841  alloc.destroy(m_value.array);
2842  alloc.deallocate(m_value.array, 1);
2843  break;
2844  }
2845 
2846  case value_t::string:
2847  {
2848  AllocatorType<string_t> alloc;
2849  alloc.destroy(m_value.string);
2850  alloc.deallocate(m_value.string, 1);
2851  break;
2852  }
2853 
2854  default:
2855  {
2856  // all other types need no specific destructor
2857  break;
2858  }
2859  }
2860  }
2861 
2863 
2864  public:
2866  // object inspection //
2868 
2872 
2898  string_t dump(const int indent = -1, const char indent_char = ' ') const
2899  {
2900  string_t result;
2901  serializer s(output_adapter<char>::create(result), indent_char);
2902 
2903  if (indent >= 0)
2904  {
2905  s.dump(*this, true, static_cast<unsigned int>(indent));
2906  }
2907  else
2908  {
2909  s.dump(*this, false, 0);
2910  }
2911 
2912  return result;
2913  }
2914 
2933  constexpr value_t type() const noexcept
2934  {
2935  return m_type;
2936  }
2937 
2963  constexpr bool is_primitive() const noexcept
2964  {
2965  return is_null() or is_string() or is_boolean() or is_number();
2966  }
2967 
2990  constexpr bool is_structured() const noexcept
2991  {
2992  return is_array() or is_object();
2993  }
2994 
3012  constexpr bool is_null() const noexcept
3013  {
3014  return m_type == value_t::null;
3015  }
3016 
3034  constexpr bool is_boolean() const noexcept
3035  {
3036  return m_type == value_t::boolean;
3037  }
3038 
3064  constexpr bool is_number() const noexcept
3065  {
3066  return is_number_integer() or is_number_float();
3067  }
3068 
3093  constexpr bool is_number_integer() const noexcept
3094  {
3095  return m_type == value_t::number_integer or m_type == value_t::number_unsigned;
3096  }
3097 
3121  constexpr bool is_number_unsigned() const noexcept
3122  {
3123  return m_type == value_t::number_unsigned;
3124  }
3125 
3149  constexpr bool is_number_float() const noexcept
3150  {
3151  return m_type == value_t::number_float;
3152  }
3153 
3171  constexpr bool is_object() const noexcept
3172  {
3173  return m_type == value_t::object;
3174  }
3175 
3193  constexpr bool is_array() const noexcept
3194  {
3195  return m_type == value_t::array;
3196  }
3197 
3215  constexpr bool is_string() const noexcept
3216  {
3217  return m_type == value_t::string;
3218  }
3219 
3242  constexpr bool is_discarded() const noexcept
3243  {
3244  return m_type == value_t::discarded;
3245  }
3246 
3265  constexpr operator value_t() const noexcept
3266  {
3267  return m_type;
3268  }
3269 
3271 
3272  private:
3274  // value access //
3276 
3278  boolean_t get_impl(boolean_t* /*unused*/) const
3279  {
3280  if (is_boolean())
3281  {
3282  return m_value.boolean;
3283  }
3284 
3285  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be boolean, but is " + type_name()));
3286  }
3287 
3289  object_t* get_impl_ptr(object_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
3290  {
3291  return is_object() ? m_value.object : nullptr;
3292  }
3293 
3295  constexpr const object_t* get_impl_ptr(const object_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
3296  {
3297  return is_object() ? m_value.object : nullptr;
3298  }
3299 
3301  array_t* get_impl_ptr(array_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
3302  {
3303  return is_array() ? m_value.array : nullptr;
3304  }
3305 
3307  constexpr const array_t* get_impl_ptr(const array_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
3308  {
3309  return is_array() ? m_value.array : nullptr;
3310  }
3311 
3313  string_t* get_impl_ptr(string_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
3314  {
3315  return is_string() ? m_value.string : nullptr;
3316  }
3317 
3319  constexpr const string_t* get_impl_ptr(const string_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
3320  {
3321  return is_string() ? m_value.string : nullptr;
3322  }
3323 
3325  boolean_t* get_impl_ptr(boolean_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
3326  {
3327  return is_boolean() ? &m_value.boolean : nullptr;
3328  }
3329 
3331  constexpr const boolean_t* get_impl_ptr(const boolean_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
3332  {
3333  return is_boolean() ? &m_value.boolean : nullptr;
3334  }
3335 
3337  number_integer_t* get_impl_ptr(number_integer_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
3338  {
3339  return is_number_integer() ? &m_value.number_integer : nullptr;
3340  }
3341 
3343  constexpr const number_integer_t* get_impl_ptr(const number_integer_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
3344  {
3345  return is_number_integer() ? &m_value.number_integer : nullptr;
3346  }
3347 
3349  number_unsigned_t* get_impl_ptr(number_unsigned_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
3350  {
3351  return is_number_unsigned() ? &m_value.number_unsigned : nullptr;
3352  }
3353 
3355  constexpr const number_unsigned_t* get_impl_ptr(const number_unsigned_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
3356  {
3357  return is_number_unsigned() ? &m_value.number_unsigned : nullptr;
3358  }
3359 
3361  number_float_t* get_impl_ptr(number_float_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
3362  {
3363  return is_number_float() ? &m_value.number_float : nullptr;
3364  }
3365 
3367  constexpr const number_float_t* get_impl_ptr(const number_float_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
3368  {
3369  return is_number_float() ? &m_value.number_float : nullptr;
3370  }
3371 
3383  template<typename ReferenceType, typename ThisType>
3384  static ReferenceType get_ref_impl(ThisType& obj)
3385  {
3386  // helper type
3387  using PointerType = typename std::add_pointer<ReferenceType>::type;
3388 
3389  // delegate the call to get_ptr<>()
3390  auto ptr = obj.template get_ptr<PointerType>();
3391 
3392  if (ptr != nullptr)
3393  {
3394  return *ptr;
3395  }
3396 
3397  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(303, "incompatible ReferenceType for get_ref, actual type is " + obj.type_name()));
3398  }
3399 
3400  public:
3404 
3419  template <
3420  typename BasicJsonType,
3421  detail::enable_if_t<std::is_same<typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type,
3422  basic_json_t>::value,
3423  int> = 0 >
3424  basic_json get() const
3425  {
3426  return *this;
3427  }
3428 
3468  template <
3469  typename ValueTypeCV,
3470  typename ValueType = detail::uncvref_t<ValueTypeCV>,
3471  detail::enable_if_t <
3472  not std::is_same<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value and
3473  detail::has_from_json<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value and
3474  not detail::has_non_default_from_json<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value,
3475  int > = 0 >
3476  ValueType get() const noexcept(noexcept(
3477  JSONSerializer<ValueType>::from_json(std::declval<const basic_json_t&>(), std::declval<ValueType&>())))
3478  {
3479  // we cannot static_assert on ValueTypeCV being non-const, because
3480  // there is support for get<const basic_json_t>(), which is why we
3481  // still need the uncvref
3482  static_assert(not std::is_reference<ValueTypeCV>::value,
3483  "get() cannot be used with reference types, you might want to use get_ref()");
3484  static_assert(std::is_default_constructible<ValueType>::value,
3485  "types must be DefaultConstructible when used with get()");
3486 
3487  ValueType ret;
3488  JSONSerializer<ValueType>::from_json(*this, ret);
3489  return ret;
3490  }
3491 
3523  template <
3524  typename ValueTypeCV,
3525  typename ValueType = detail::uncvref_t<ValueTypeCV>,
3526  detail::enable_if_t<not std::is_same<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value and
3527  detail::has_non_default_from_json<basic_json_t,
3528  ValueType>::value, int> = 0 >
3529  ValueType get() const noexcept(noexcept(
3530  JSONSerializer<ValueTypeCV>::from_json(std::declval<const basic_json_t&>())))
3531  {
3532  static_assert(not std::is_reference<ValueTypeCV>::value,
3533  "get() cannot be used with reference types, you might want to use get_ref()");
3534  return JSONSerializer<ValueTypeCV>::from_json(*this);
3535  }
3536 
3564  template<typename PointerType, typename std::enable_if<
3565  std::is_pointer<PointerType>::value, int>::type = 0>
3566  PointerType get() noexcept
3567  {
3568  // delegate the call to get_ptr
3569  return get_ptr<PointerType>();
3570  }
3571 
3576  template<typename PointerType, typename std::enable_if<
3577  std::is_pointer<PointerType>::value, int>::type = 0>
3578  constexpr const PointerType get() const noexcept
3579  {
3580  // delegate the call to get_ptr
3581  return get_ptr<PointerType>();
3582  }
3583 
3610  template<typename PointerType, typename std::enable_if<
3611  std::is_pointer<PointerType>::value, int>::type = 0>
3612  PointerType get_ptr() noexcept
3613  {
3614  // get the type of the PointerType (remove pointer and const)
3615  using pointee_t = typename std::remove_const<typename
3616  std::remove_pointer<typename
3617  std::remove_const<PointerType>::type>::type>::type;
3618  // make sure the type matches the allowed types
3619  static_assert(
3620  std::is_same<object_t, pointee_t>::value
3621  or std::is_same<array_t, pointee_t>::value
3622  or std::is_same<string_t, pointee_t>::value
3623  or std::is_same<boolean_t, pointee_t>::value
3624  or std::is_same<number_integer_t, pointee_t>::value
3625  or std::is_same<number_unsigned_t, pointee_t>::value
3626  or std::is_same<number_float_t, pointee_t>::value
3627  , "incompatible pointer type");
3628 
3629  // delegate the call to get_impl_ptr<>()
3630  return get_impl_ptr(static_cast<PointerType>(nullptr));
3631  }
3632 
3637  template<typename PointerType, typename std::enable_if<
3638  std::is_pointer<PointerType>::value and
3639  std::is_const<typename std::remove_pointer<PointerType>::type>::value, int>::type = 0>
3640  constexpr const PointerType get_ptr() const noexcept
3641  {
3642  // get the type of the PointerType (remove pointer and const)
3643  using pointee_t = typename std::remove_const<typename
3644  std::remove_pointer<typename
3645  std::remove_const<PointerType>::type>::type>::type;
3646  // make sure the type matches the allowed types
3647  static_assert(
3648  std::is_same<object_t, pointee_t>::value
3649  or std::is_same<array_t, pointee_t>::value
3650  or std::is_same<string_t, pointee_t>::value
3651  or std::is_same<boolean_t, pointee_t>::value
3652  or std::is_same<number_integer_t, pointee_t>::value
3653  or std::is_same<number_unsigned_t, pointee_t>::value
3654  or std::is_same<number_float_t, pointee_t>::value
3655  , "incompatible pointer type");
3656 
3657  // delegate the call to get_impl_ptr<>() const
3658  return get_impl_ptr(static_cast<const PointerType>(nullptr));
3659  }
3660 
3687  template<typename ReferenceType, typename std::enable_if<
3688  std::is_reference<ReferenceType>::value, int>::type = 0>
3689  ReferenceType get_ref()
3690  {
3691  // delegate call to get_ref_impl
3692  return get_ref_impl<ReferenceType>(*this);
3693  }
3694 
3699  template<typename ReferenceType, typename std::enable_if<
3700  std::is_reference<ReferenceType>::value and
3701  std::is_const<typename std::remove_reference<ReferenceType>::type>::value, int>::type = 0>
3702  ReferenceType get_ref() const
3703  {
3704  // delegate call to get_ref_impl
3705  return get_ref_impl<ReferenceType>(*this);
3706  }
3707 
3737  template < typename ValueType, typename std::enable_if <
3738  not std::is_pointer<ValueType>::value and
3739  not std::is_same<ValueType, typename string_t::value_type>::value
3740 #ifndef _MSC_VER // fix for issue #167 operator<< ambiguity under VS2015
3741  and not std::is_same<ValueType, std::initializer_list<typename string_t::value_type>>::value
3742 #endif
3743 #if (defined(__cplusplus) && __cplusplus >= 201703L) || (defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER >1900 && defined(_HAS_CXX17) && _HAS_CXX17 == 1) // fix for issue #464
3744  and not std::is_same<ValueType, typename std::string_view>::value
3745 #endif
3746  , int >::type = 0 >
3747  operator ValueType() const
3748  {
3749  // delegate the call to get<>() const
3750  return get<ValueType>();
3751  }
3752 
3754 
3755 
3757  // element access //
3759 
3763 
3790  reference at(size_type idx)
3791  {
3792  // at only works for arrays
3793  if (is_array())
3794  {
3795  JSON_TRY
3796  {
3797  return m_value.array->at(idx);
3798  }
3799  JSON_CATCH (std::out_of_range&)
3800  {
3801  // create better exception explanation
3802  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(401, "array index " + std::to_string(idx) + " is out of range"));
3803  }
3804  }
3805  else
3806  {
3807  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(304, "cannot use at() with " + type_name()));
3808  }
3809  }
3810 
3837  const_reference at(size_type idx) const
3838  {
3839  // at only works for arrays
3840  if (is_array())
3841  {
3842  JSON_TRY
3843  {
3844  return m_value.array->at(idx);
3845  }
3846  JSON_CATCH (std::out_of_range&)
3847  {
3848  // create better exception explanation
3849  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(401, "array index " + std::to_string(idx) + " is out of range"));
3850  }
3851  }
3852  else
3853  {
3854  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(304, "cannot use at() with " + type_name()));
3855  }
3856  }
3857 
3888  reference at(const typename object_t::key_type& key)
3889  {
3890  // at only works for objects
3891  if (is_object())
3892  {
3893  JSON_TRY
3894  {
3895  return m_value.object->at(key);
3896  }
3897  JSON_CATCH (std::out_of_range&)
3898  {
3899  // create better exception explanation
3900  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(403, "key '" + key + "' not found"));
3901  }
3902  }
3903  else
3904  {
3905  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(304, "cannot use at() with " + type_name()));
3906  }
3907  }
3908 
3939  const_reference at(const typename object_t::key_type& key) const
3940  {
3941  // at only works for objects
3942  if (is_object())
3943  {
3944  JSON_TRY
3945  {
3946  return m_value.object->at(key);
3947  }
3948  JSON_CATCH (std::out_of_range&)
3949  {
3950  // create better exception explanation
3951  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(403, "key '" + key + "' not found"));
3952  }
3953  }
3954  else
3955  {
3956  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(304, "cannot use at() with " + type_name()));
3957  }
3958  }
3959 
3985  reference operator[](size_type idx)
3986  {
3987  // implicitly convert null value to an empty array
3988  if (is_null())
3989  {
3990  m_type = value_t::array;
3991  m_value.array = create<array_t>();
3992  assert_invariant();
3993  }
3994 
3995  // operator[] only works for arrays
3996  if (is_array())
3997  {
3998  // fill up array with null values if given idx is outside range
3999  if (idx >= m_value.array->size())
4000  {
4001  m_value.array->insert(m_value.array->end(),
4002  idx - m_value.array->size() + 1,
4003  basic_json());
4004  }
4005 
4006  return m_value.array->operator[](idx);
4007  }
4008 
4009  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with " + type_name()));
4010  }
4011 
4031  const_reference operator[](size_type idx) const
4032  {
4033  // const operator[] only works for arrays
4034  if (is_array())
4035  {
4036  return m_value.array->operator[](idx);
4037  }
4038 
4039  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with " + type_name()));
4040  }
4041 
4069  reference operator[](const typename object_t::key_type& key)
4070  {
4071  // implicitly convert null value to an empty object
4072  if (is_null())
4073  {
4074  m_type = value_t::object;
4075  m_value.object = create<object_t>();
4076  assert_invariant();
4077  }
4078 
4079  // operator[] only works for objects
4080  if (is_object())
4081  {
4082  return m_value.object->operator[](key);
4083  }
4084 
4085  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with " + type_name()));
4086  }
4087 
4118  const_reference operator[](const typename object_t::key_type& key) const
4119  {
4120  // const operator[] only works for objects
4121  if (is_object())
4122  {
4123  assert(m_value.object->find(key) != m_value.object->end());
4124  return m_value.object->find(key)->second;
4125  }
4126 
4127  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with " + type_name()));
4128  }
4129 
4157  template<typename T, std::size_t n>
4158  reference operator[](T * (&key)[n])
4159  {
4160  return operator[](static_cast<const T>(key));
4161  }
4162 
4192  template<typename T, std::size_t n>
4193  const_reference operator[](T * (&key)[n]) const
4194  {
4195  return operator[](static_cast<const T>(key));
4196  }
4197 
4225  template<typename T>
4226  reference operator[](T* key)
4227  {
4228  // implicitly convert null to object
4229  if (is_null())
4230  {
4231  m_type = value_t::object;
4232  m_value = value_t::object;
4233  assert_invariant();
4234  }
4235 
4236  // at only works for objects
4237  if (is_object())
4238  {
4239  return m_value.object->operator[](key);
4240  }
4241 
4242  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with " + type_name()));
4243  }
4244 
4275  template<typename T>
4276  const_reference operator[](T* key) const
4277  {
4278  // at only works for objects
4279  if (is_object())
4280  {
4281  assert(m_value.object->find(key) != m_value.object->end());
4282  return m_value.object->find(key)->second;
4283  }
4284 
4285  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with " + type_name()));
4286  }
4287 
4336  template<class ValueType, typename std::enable_if<
4337  std::is_convertible<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value, int>::type = 0>
4338  ValueType value(const typename object_t::key_type& key, ValueType default_value) const
4339  {
4340  // at only works for objects
4341  if (is_object())
4342  {
4343  // if key is found, return value and given default value otherwise
4344  const auto it = find(key);
4345  if (it != end())
4346  {
4347  return *it;
4348  }
4349 
4350  return default_value;
4351  }
4352  else
4353  {
4354  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(306, "cannot use value() with " + type_name()));
4355  }
4356  }
4357 
4362  string_t value(const typename object_t::key_type& key, const char* default_value) const
4363  {
4364  return value(key, string_t(default_value));
4365  }
4366 
4408  template<class ValueType, typename std::enable_if<
4409  std::is_convertible<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value, int>::type = 0>
4410  ValueType value(const json_pointer& ptr, ValueType default_value) const
4411  {
4412  // at only works for objects
4413  if (is_object())
4414  {
4415  // if pointer resolves a value, return it or use default value
4416  JSON_TRY
4417  {
4418  return ptr.get_checked(this);
4419  }
4420  JSON_CATCH (out_of_range&)
4421  {
4422  return default_value;
4423  }
4424  }
4425 
4426  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(306, "cannot use value() with " + type_name()));
4427  }
4428 
4433  string_t value(const json_pointer& ptr, const char* default_value) const
4434  {
4435  return value(ptr, string_t(default_value));
4436  }
4437 
4463  reference front()
4464  {
4465  return *begin();
4466  }
4467 
4471  const_reference front() const
4472  {
4473  return *cbegin();
4474  }
4475 
4507  reference back()
4508  {
4509  auto tmp = end();
4510  --tmp;
4511  return *tmp;
4512  }
4513 
4517  const_reference back() const
4518  {
4519  auto tmp = cend();
4520  --tmp;
4521  return *tmp;
4522  }
4523 
4570  template<class IteratorType, typename std::enable_if<
4571  std::is_same<IteratorType, typename basic_json_t::iterator>::value or
4572  std::is_same<IteratorType, typename basic_json_t::const_iterator>::value, int>::type
4573  = 0>
4574  IteratorType erase(IteratorType pos)
4575  {
4576  // make sure iterator fits the current value
4577  if (this != pos.m_object)
4578  {
4579  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterator does not fit current value"));
4580  }
4581 
4582  IteratorType result = end();
4583 
4584  switch (m_type)
4585  {
4586  case value_t::boolean:
4587  case value_t::number_float:
4588  case value_t::number_integer:
4589  case value_t::number_unsigned:
4590  case value_t::string:
4591  {
4592  if (not pos.m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin())
4593  {
4594  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(205, "iterator out of range"));
4595  }
4596 
4597  if (is_string())
4598  {
4599  AllocatorType<string_t> alloc;
4600  alloc.destroy(m_value.string);
4601  alloc.deallocate(m_value.string, 1);
4602  m_value.string = nullptr;
4603  }
4604 
4605  m_type = value_t::null;
4606  assert_invariant();
4607  break;
4608  }
4609 
4610  case value_t::object:
4611  {
4612  result.m_it.object_iterator = m_value.object->erase(pos.m_it.object_iterator);
4613  break;
4614  }
4615 
4616  case value_t::array:
4617  {
4618  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->erase(pos.m_it.array_iterator);
4619  break;
4620  }
4621 
4622  default:
4623  {
4624  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(307, "cannot use erase() with " + type_name()));
4625  }
4626  }
4627 
4628  return result;
4629  }
4630 
4677  template<class IteratorType, typename std::enable_if<
4678  std::is_same<IteratorType, typename basic_json_t::iterator>::value or
4679  std::is_same<IteratorType, typename basic_json_t::const_iterator>::value, int>::type
4680  = 0>
4681  IteratorType erase(IteratorType first, IteratorType last)
4682  {
4683  // make sure iterator fits the current value
4684  if (this != first.m_object or this != last.m_object)
4685  {
4686  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(203, "iterators do not fit current value"));
4687  }
4688 
4689  IteratorType result = end();
4690 
4691  switch (m_type)
4692  {
4693  case value_t::boolean:
4694  case value_t::number_float:
4695  case value_t::number_integer:
4696  case value_t::number_unsigned:
4697  case value_t::string:
4698  {
4699  if (not first.m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin() or not last.m_it.primitive_iterator.is_end())
4700  {
4701  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(204, "iterators out of range"));
4702  }
4703 
4704  if (is_string())
4705  {
4706  AllocatorType<string_t> alloc;
4707  alloc.destroy(m_value.string);
4708  alloc.deallocate(m_value.string, 1);
4709  m_value.string = nullptr;
4710  }
4711 
4712  m_type = value_t::null;
4713  assert_invariant();
4714  break;
4715  }
4716 
4717  case value_t::object:
4718  {
4719  result.m_it.object_iterator = m_value.object->erase(first.m_it.object_iterator,
4720  last.m_it.object_iterator);
4721  break;
4722  }
4723 
4724  case value_t::array:
4725  {
4726  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->erase(first.m_it.array_iterator,
4727  last.m_it.array_iterator);
4728  break;
4729  }
4730 
4731  default:
4732  {
4733  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(307, "cannot use erase() with " + type_name()));
4734  }
4735  }
4736 
4737  return result;
4738  }
4739 
4769  size_type erase(const typename object_t::key_type& key)
4770  {
4771  // this erase only works for objects
4772  if (is_object())
4773  {
4774  return m_value.object->erase(key);
4775  }
4776 
4777  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(307, "cannot use erase() with " + type_name()));
4778  }
4779 
4804  void erase(const size_type idx)
4805  {
4806  // this erase only works for arrays
4807  if (is_array())
4808  {
4809  if (idx >= size())
4810  {
4811  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(401, "array index " + std::to_string(idx) + " is out of range"));
4812  }
4813 
4814  m_value.array->erase(m_value.array->begin() + static_cast<difference_type>(idx));
4815  }
4816  else
4817  {
4818  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(307, "cannot use erase() with " + type_name()));
4819  }
4820  }
4821 
4823 
4824 
4826  // lookup //
4828 
4831 
4854  iterator find(typename object_t::key_type key)
4855  {
4856  auto result = end();
4857 
4858  if (is_object())
4859  {
4860  result.m_it.object_iterator = m_value.object->find(key);
4861  }
4862 
4863  return result;
4864  }
4865 
4870  const_iterator find(typename object_t::key_type key) const
4871  {
4872  auto result = cend();
4873 
4874  if (is_object())
4875  {
4876  result.m_it.object_iterator = m_value.object->find(key);
4877  }
4878 
4879  return result;
4880  }
4881 
4903  size_type count(typename object_t::key_type key) const
4904  {
4905  // return 0 for all nonobject types
4906  return is_object() ? m_value.object->count(key) : 0;
4907  }

4913  // iterators //
4915 
4918 
4943  iterator begin() noexcept
4944  {
4945  iterator result(this);
4946  result.set_begin();
4947  return result;
4948  }
4949 
4953  const_iterator begin() const noexcept
4954  {
4955  return cbegin();
4956  }
4957 
4983  const_iterator cbegin() const noexcept
4984  {
4985  const_iterator result(this);
4986  result.set_begin();
4987  return result;
4988  }
4989 
5014  iterator end() noexcept
5015  {
5016  iterator result(this);
5017  result.set_end();
5018  return result;
5019  }
5020 
5024  const_iterator end() const noexcept
5025  {
5026  return cend();
5027  }
5028 
5054  const_iterator cend() const noexcept
5055  {
5056  const_iterator result(this);
5057  result.set_end();
5058  return result;
5059  }
5060 
5084  reverse_iterator rbegin() noexcept
5085  {
5086  return reverse_iterator(end());
5087  }
5088 
5092  const_reverse_iterator rbegin() const noexcept
5093  {
5094  return crbegin();
5095  }
5096 
5121  reverse_iterator rend() noexcept
5122  {
5123  return reverse_iterator(begin());
5124  }
5125 
5129  const_reverse_iterator rend() const noexcept
5130  {
5131  return crend();
5132  }
5133 
5158  const_reverse_iterator crbegin() const noexcept
5159  {
5160  return const_reverse_iterator(cend());
5161  }
5162 
5187  const_reverse_iterator crend() const noexcept
5188  {
5189  return const_reverse_iterator(cbegin());
5190  }
5191 
5192  private:
5193  // forward declaration
5194  template<typename IteratorType> class iteration_proxy;
5195 
5196  public:
5210  static iteration_proxy<iterator> iterator_wrapper(reference cont)
5211  {
5212  return iteration_proxy<iterator>(cont);
5213  }
5214 
5218  static iteration_proxy<const_iterator> iterator_wrapper(const_reference cont)
5219  {
5220  return iteration_proxy<const_iterator>(cont);
5221  }
5222 
5224 
5225 
5227  // capacity //
5229 
5232 
5270  bool empty() const noexcept
5271  {
5272  switch (m_type)
5273  {
5274  case value_t::null:
5275  {
5276  // null values are empty
5277  return true;
5278  }
5279 
5280  case value_t::array:
5281  {
5282  // delegate call to array_t::empty()
5283  return m_value.array->empty();
5284  }
5285 
5286  case value_t::object:
5287  {
5288  // delegate call to object_t::empty()
5289  return m_value.object->empty();
5290  }
5291 
5292  default:
5293  {
5294  // all other types are nonempty
5295  return false;
5296  }
5297  }
5298  }
5299 
5338  size_type size() const noexcept
5339  {
5340  switch (m_type)
5341  {
5342  case value_t::null:
5343  {
5344  // null values are empty
5345  return 0;
5346  }
5347 
5348  case value_t::array:
5349  {
5350  // delegate call to array_t::size()
5351  return m_value.array->size();
5352  }
5353 
5354  case value_t::object:
5355  {
5356  // delegate call to object_t::size()
5357  return m_value.object->size();
5358  }
5359 
5360  default:
5361  {
5362  // all other types have size 1
5363  return 1;
5364  }
5365  }
5366  }
5367 
5404  size_type max_size() const noexcept
5405  {
5406  switch (m_type)
5407  {
5408  case value_t::array:
5409  {
5410  // delegate call to array_t::max_size()
5411  return m_value.array->max_size();
5412  }
5413 
5414  case value_t::object:
5415  {
5416  // delegate call to object_t::max_size()
5417  return m_value.object->max_size();
5418  }
5419 
5420  default:
5421  {
5422  // all other types have max_size() == size()
5423  return size();
5424  }
5425  }
5426  }
5427 
5429 
5430 
5432  // modifiers //
5434 
5437 
5460  void clear() noexcept
5461  {
5462  switch (m_type)
5463  {
5464  case value_t::number_integer:
5465  {
5466  m_value.number_integer = 0;
5467  break;
5468  }
5469 
5470  case value_t::number_unsigned:
5471  {
5472  m_value.number_unsigned = 0;
5473  break;
5474  }
5475 
5476  case value_t::number_float:
5477  {
5478  m_value.number_float = 0.0;
5479  break;
5480  }
5481 
5482  case value_t::boolean:
5483  {
5484  m_value.boolean = false;
5485  break;
5486  }
5487 
5488  case value_t::string:
5489  {
5490  m_value.string->clear();
5491  break;
5492  }
5493 
5494  case value_t::array:
5495  {
5496  m_value.array->clear();
5497  break;
5498  }
5499 
5500  case value_t::object:
5501  {
5502  m_value.object->clear();
5503  break;
5504  }
5505 
5506  default:
5507  {
5508  break;
5509  }
5510  }
5511  }
5512 
5533  void push_back(basic_json&& val)
5534  {
5535  // push_back only works for null objects or arrays
5536  if (not(is_null() or is_array()))
5537  {
5538  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(308, "cannot use push_back() with " + type_name()));
5539  }
5540 
5541  // transform null object into an array
5542  if (is_null())
5543  {
5544  m_type = value_t::array;
5545  m_value = value_t::array;
5546  assert_invariant();
5547  }
5548 
5549  // add element to array (move semantics)
5550  m_value.array->push_back(std::move(val));
5551  // invalidate object
5552  val.m_type = value_t::null;
5553  }
5554 
5559  reference operator+=(basic_json&& val)
5560  {
5561  push_back(std::move(val));
5562  return *this;
5563  }
5564 
5569  void push_back(const basic_json& val)
5570  {
5571  // push_back only works for null objects or arrays
5572  if (not(is_null() or is_array()))
5573  {
5574  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(308, "cannot use push_back() with " + type_name()));
5575  }
5576 
5577  // transform null object into an array
5578  if (is_null())
5579  {
5580  m_type = value_t::array;
5581  m_value = value_t::array;
5582  assert_invariant();
5583  }
5584 
5585  // add element to array
5586  m_value.array->push_back(val);
5587  }
5588 
5593  reference operator+=(const basic_json& val)
5594  {
5595  push_back(val);
5596  return *this;
5597  }
5598 
5619  void push_back(const typename object_t::value_type& val)
5620  {
5621  // push_back only works for null objects or objects
5622  if (not(is_null() or is_object()))
5623  {
5624  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(308, "cannot use push_back() with " + type_name()));
5625  }
5626 
5627  // transform null object into an object
5628  if (is_null())
5629  {
5630  m_type = value_t::object;
5631  m_value = value_t::object;
5632  assert_invariant();
5633  }
5634 
5635  // add element to array
5636  m_value.object->insert(val);
5637  }
5638 
5643  reference operator+=(const typename object_t::value_type& val)
5644  {
5645  push_back(val);
5646  return *this;
5647  }
5648 
5674  void push_back(std::initializer_list<basic_json> init)
5675  {
5676  if (is_object() and init.size() == 2 and init.begin()->is_string())
5677  {
5678  const string_t key = *init.begin();
5679  push_back(typename object_t::value_type(key, *(init.begin() + 1)));
5680  }
5681  else
5682  {
5683  push_back(basic_json(init));
5684  }
5685  }
5686 
5691  reference operator+=(std::initializer_list<basic_json> init)
5692  {
5693  push_back(init);
5694  return *this;
5695  }
5696 
5718  template<class... Args>
5719  void emplace_back(Args&& ... args)
5720  {
5721  // emplace_back only works for null objects or arrays
5722  if (not(is_null() or is_array()))
5723  {
5724  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(311, "cannot use emplace_back() with " + type_name()));
5725  }
5726 
5727  // transform null object into an array
5728  if (is_null())
5729  {
5730  m_type = value_t::array;
5731  m_value = value_t::array;
5732  assert_invariant();
5733  }
5734 
5735  // add element to array (perfect forwarding)
5736  m_value.array->emplace_back(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
5737  }
5738 
5766  template<class... Args>
5767  std::pair<iterator, bool> emplace(Args&& ... args)
5768  {
5769  // emplace only works for null objects or arrays
5770  if (not(is_null() or is_object()))
5771  {
5772  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(311, "cannot use emplace() with " + type_name()));
5773  }
5774 
5775  // transform null object into an object
5776  if (is_null())
5777  {
5778  m_type = value_t::object;
5779  m_value = value_t::object;
5780  assert_invariant();
5781  }
5782 
5783  // add element to array (perfect forwarding)
5784  auto res = m_value.object->emplace(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
5785  // create result iterator and set iterator to the result of emplace
5786  auto it = begin();
5787  it.m_it.object_iterator = res.first;
5788 
5789  // return pair of iterator and boolean
5790  return {it, res.second};
5791  }
5792 
5815  iterator insert(const_iterator pos, const basic_json& val)
5816  {
5817  // insert only works for arrays
5818  if (is_array())
5819  {
5820  // check if iterator pos fits to this JSON value
5821  if (pos.m_object != this)
5822  {
