5823  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterator does not fit current value"));
5824  }
5825 
5826  // insert to array and return iterator
5827  iterator result(this);
5828  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->insert(pos.m_it.array_iterator, val);
5829  return result;
5830  }
5831 
5832  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(309, "cannot use insert() with " + type_name()));
5833  }
5834 
5839  iterator insert(const_iterator pos, basic_json&& val)
5840  {
5841  return insert(pos, val);
5842  }
5843 
5868  iterator insert(const_iterator pos, size_type cnt, const basic_json& val)
5869  {
5870  // insert only works for arrays
5871  if (is_array())
5872  {
5873  // check if iterator pos fits to this JSON value
5874  if (pos.m_object != this)
5875  {
5876  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterator does not fit current value"));
5877  }
5878 
5879  // insert to array and return iterator
5880  iterator result(this);
5881  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->insert(pos.m_it.array_iterator, cnt, val);
5882  return result;
5883  }
5884 
5885  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(309, "cannot use insert() with " + type_name()));
5886  }
5887 
5918  iterator insert(const_iterator pos, const_iterator first, const_iterator last)
5919  {
5920  // insert only works for arrays
5921  if (not is_array())
5922  {
5923  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(309, "cannot use insert() with " + type_name()));
5924  }
5925 
5926  // check if iterator pos fits to this JSON value
5927  if (pos.m_object != this)
5928  {
5929  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterator does not fit current value"));
5930  }
5931 
5932  // check if range iterators belong to the same JSON object
5933  if (first.m_object != last.m_object)
5934  {
5935  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(210, "iterators do not fit"));
5936  }
5937 
5938  if (first.m_object == this or last.m_object == this)
5939  {
5940  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(211, "passed iterators may not belong to container"));
5941  }
5942 
5943  // insert to array and return iterator
5944  iterator result(this);
5945  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->insert(
5946  pos.m_it.array_iterator,
5947  first.m_it.array_iterator,
5948  last.m_it.array_iterator);
5949  return result;
5950  }
5951 
5976  iterator insert(const_iterator pos, std::initializer_list<basic_json> ilist)
5977  {
5978  // insert only works for arrays
5979  if (not is_array())
5980  {
5981  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(309, "cannot use insert() with " + type_name()));
5982  }
5983 
5984  // check if iterator pos fits to this JSON value
5985  if (pos.m_object != this)
5986  {
5987  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterator does not fit current value"));
5988  }
5989 
5990  // insert to array and return iterator
5991  iterator result(this);
5992  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->insert(pos.m_it.array_iterator, ilist);
5993  return result;
5994  }
5995 
6019  void insert(const_iterator first, const_iterator last)
6020  {
6021  // insert only works for objects
6022  if (not is_object())
6023  {
6024  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(309, "cannot use insert() with " + type_name()));
6025  }
6026 
6027  // check if range iterators belong to the same JSON object
6028  if (first.m_object != last.m_object)
6029  {
6030  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(210, "iterators do not fit"));
6031  }
6032 
6033  // passed iterators must belong to objects
6034  if (not first.m_object->is_object() or not first.m_object->is_object())
6035  {
6036  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterators first and last must point to objects"));
6037  }
6038 
6039  m_value.object->insert(first.m_it.object_iterator, last.m_it.object_iterator);
6040  }
6041 
6059  void swap(reference other) noexcept (
6060  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<value_t>::value and
6061  std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<value_t>::value and
6062  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<json_value>::value and
6063  std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<json_value>::value
6064  )
6065  {
6066  std::swap(m_type, other.m_type);
6067  std::swap(m_value, other.m_value);
6068  assert_invariant();
6069  }
6070 
6091  void swap(array_t& other)
6092  {
6093  // swap only works for arrays
6094  if (is_array())
6095  {
6096  std::swap(*(m_value.array), other);
6097  }
6098  else
6099  {
6100  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(310, "cannot use swap() with " + type_name()));
6101  }
6102  }
6103 
6124  void swap(object_t& other)
6125  {
6126  // swap only works for objects
6127  if (is_object())
6128  {
6129  std::swap(*(m_value.object), other);
6130  }
6131  else
6132  {
6133  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(310, "cannot use swap() with " + type_name()));
6134  }
6135  }
6136 
6157  void swap(string_t& other)
6158  {
6159  // swap only works for strings
6160  if (is_string())
6161  {
6162  std::swap(*(m_value.string), other);
6163  }
6164  else
6165  {
6166  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(310, "cannot use swap() with " + type_name()));
6167  }
6168  }
6169 
6171 
6172  public:
6174  // lexicographical comparison operators //
6176 
6179 
6207  friend bool operator==(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
6208  {
6209  const auto lhs_type = lhs.type();
6210  const auto rhs_type = rhs.type();
6211 
6212  if (lhs_type == rhs_type)
6213  {
6214  switch (lhs_type)
6215  {
6216  case value_t::array:
6217  {
6218  return *lhs.m_value.array == *rhs.m_value.array;
6219  }
6220  case value_t::object:
6221  {
6222  return *lhs.m_value.object == *rhs.m_value.object;
6223  }
6224  case value_t::null:
6225  {
6226  return true;
6227  }
6228  case value_t::string:
6229  {
6230  return *lhs.m_value.string == *rhs.m_value.string;
6231  }
6232  case value_t::boolean:
6233  {
6234  return lhs.m_value.boolean == rhs.m_value.boolean;
6235  }
6236  case value_t::number_integer:
6237  {
6238  return lhs.m_value.number_integer == rhs.m_value.number_integer;
6239  }
6240  case value_t::number_unsigned:
6241  {
6242  return lhs.m_value.number_unsigned == rhs.m_value.number_unsigned;
6243  }
6244  case value_t::number_float:
6245  {
6246  return lhs.m_value.number_float == rhs.m_value.number_float;
6247  }
6248  default:
6249  {
6250  return false;
6251  }
6252  }
6253  }
6254  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_integer and rhs_type == value_t::number_float)
6255  {
6256  return static_cast<number_float_t>(lhs.m_value.number_integer) == rhs.m_value.number_float;
6257  }
6258  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_float and rhs_type == value_t::number_integer)
6259  {
6260  return lhs.m_value.number_float == static_cast<number_float_t>(rhs.m_value.number_integer);
6261  }
6262  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned and rhs_type == value_t::number_float)
6263  {
6264  return static_cast<number_float_t>(lhs.m_value.number_unsigned) == rhs.m_value.number_float;
6265  }
6266  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_float and rhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned)
6267  {
6268  return lhs.m_value.number_float == static_cast<number_float_t>(rhs.m_value.number_unsigned);
6269  }
6270  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned and rhs_type == value_t::number_integer)
6271  {
6272  return static_cast<number_integer_t>(lhs.m_value.number_unsigned) == rhs.m_value.number_integer;
6273  }
6274  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_integer and rhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned)
6275  {
6276  return lhs.m_value.number_integer == static_cast<number_integer_t>(rhs.m_value.number_unsigned);
6277  }
6278 
6279  return false;
6280  }
6281 
6286  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
6287  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
6288  friend bool operator==(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept
6289  {
6290  return (lhs == basic_json(rhs));
6291  }
6292 
6297  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
6298  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
6299  friend bool operator==(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
6300  {
6301  return (basic_json(lhs) == rhs);
6302  }
6303 
6320  friend bool operator!=(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
6321  {
6322  return not (lhs == rhs);
6323  }
6324 
6329  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
6330  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
6331  friend bool operator!=(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept
6332  {
6333  return (lhs != basic_json(rhs));
6334  }
6335 
6340  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
6341  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
6342  friend bool operator!=(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
6343  {
6344  return (basic_json(lhs) != rhs);
6345  }
6346 
6371  friend bool operator<(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
6372  {
6373  const auto lhs_type = lhs.type();
6374  const auto rhs_type = rhs.type();
6375 
6376  if (lhs_type == rhs_type)
6377  {
6378  switch (lhs_type)
6379  {
6380  case value_t::array:
6381  {
6382  return *lhs.m_value.array < *rhs.m_value.array;
6383  }
6384  case value_t::object:
6385  {
6386  return *lhs.m_value.object < *rhs.m_value.object;
6387  }
6388  case value_t::null:
6389  {
6390  return false;
6391  }
6392  case value_t::string:
6393  {
6394  return *lhs.m_value.string < *rhs.m_value.string;
6395  }
6396  case value_t::boolean:
6397  {
6398  return lhs.m_value.boolean < rhs.m_value.boolean;
6399  }
6400  case value_t::number_integer:
6401  {
6402  return lhs.m_value.number_integer < rhs.m_value.number_integer;
6403  }
6404  case value_t::number_unsigned:
6405  {
6406  return lhs.m_value.number_unsigned < rhs.m_value.number_unsigned;
6407  }
6408  case value_t::number_float:
6409  {
6410  return lhs.m_value.number_float < rhs.m_value.number_float;
6411  }
6412  default:
6413  {
6414  return false;
6415  }
6416  }
6417  }
6418  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_integer and rhs_type == value_t::number_float)
6419  {
6420  return static_cast<number_float_t>(lhs.m_value.number_integer) < rhs.m_value.number_float;
6421  }
6422  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_float and rhs_type == value_t::number_integer)
6423  {
6424  return lhs.m_value.number_float < static_cast<number_float_t>(rhs.m_value.number_integer);
6425  }
6426  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned and rhs_type == value_t::number_float)
6427  {
6428  return static_cast<number_float_t>(lhs.m_value.number_unsigned) < rhs.m_value.number_float;
6429  }
6430  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_float and rhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned)
6431  {
6432  return lhs.m_value.number_float < static_cast<number_float_t>(rhs.m_value.number_unsigned);
6433  }
6434  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_integer and rhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned)
6435  {
6436  return lhs.m_value.number_integer < static_cast<number_integer_t>(rhs.m_value.number_unsigned);
6437  }
6438  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned and rhs_type == value_t::number_integer)
6439  {
6440  return static_cast<number_integer_t>(lhs.m_value.number_unsigned) < rhs.m_value.number_integer;
6441  }
6442 
6443  // We only reach this line if we cannot compare values. In that case,
6444  // we compare types. Note we have to call the operator explicitly,
6445  // because MSVC has problems otherwise.
6446  return operator<(lhs_type, rhs_type);
6447  }
6448 
6453  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
6454  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
6455  friend bool operator<(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept
6456  {
6457  return (lhs < basic_json(rhs));
6458  }
6459 
6464  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
6465  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
6466  friend bool operator<(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
6467  {
6468  return (basic_json(lhs) < rhs);
6469  }
6470 
6488  friend bool operator<=(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
6489  {
6490  return not (rhs < lhs);
6491  }
6492 
6497  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
6498  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
6499  friend bool operator<=(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept
6500  {
6501  return (lhs <= basic_json(rhs));
6502  }
6503 
6508  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
6509  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
6510  friend bool operator<=(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
6511  {
6512  return (basic_json(lhs) <= rhs);
6513  }
6514 
6532  friend bool operator>(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
6533  {
6534  return not (lhs <= rhs);
6535  }
6536 
6541  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
6542  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
6543  friend bool operator>(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept
6544  {
6545  return (lhs > basic_json(rhs));
6546  }
6547 
6552  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
6553  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
6554  friend bool operator>(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
6555  {
6556  return (basic_json(lhs) > rhs);
6557  }
6558 
6576  friend bool operator>=(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
6577  {
6578  return not (lhs < rhs);
6579  }
6580 
6585  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
6586  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
6587  friend bool operator>=(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept
6588  {
6589  return (lhs >= basic_json(rhs));
6590  }
6591 
6596  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
6597  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
6598  friend bool operator>=(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
6599  {
6600  return (basic_json(lhs) >= rhs);
6601  }
6602 
6604 
6605  private:
6607  // output adapters //
6609 
6611  template<typename CharType>
6612  class output_adapter
6613  {
6614  public:
6615  virtual void write_character(CharType c) = 0;
6616  virtual void write_characters(const CharType* s, size_t length) = 0;
6617  virtual ~output_adapter() {}
6618 
6619  static std::shared_ptr<output_adapter<CharType>> create(std::vector<CharType>& vec)
6620  {
6621  return std::shared_ptr<output_adapter>(new output_vector_adapter<CharType>(vec));
6622  }
6623 
6624  static std::shared_ptr<output_adapter<CharType>> create(std::ostream& s)
6625  {
6626  return std::shared_ptr<output_adapter>(new output_stream_adapter<CharType>(s));
6627  }
6628 
6629  static std::shared_ptr<output_adapter<CharType>> create(std::string& s)
6630  {
6631  return std::shared_ptr<output_adapter>(new output_string_adapter<CharType>(s));
6632  }
6633  };
6634 
6636  template<typename CharType>
6637  using output_adapter_t = std::shared_ptr<output_adapter<CharType>>;
6638 
6640  template<typename CharType>
6641  class output_vector_adapter : public output_adapter<CharType>
6642  {
6643  public:
6644  output_vector_adapter(std::vector<CharType>& vec)
6645  : v(vec)
6646  {}
6647 
6648  void write_character(CharType c) override
6649  {
6650  v.push_back(c);
6651  }
6652 
6653  void write_characters(const CharType* s, size_t length) override
6654  {
6655  std::copy(s, s + length, std::back_inserter(v));
6656  }
6657 
6658  private:
6659  std::vector<CharType>& v;
6660  };
6661 
6663  template<typename CharType>
6664  class output_stream_adapter : public output_adapter<CharType>
6665  {
6666  public:
6667  output_stream_adapter(std::basic_ostream<CharType>& s)
6668  : stream(s)
6669  {}
6670 
6671  void write_character(CharType c) override
6672  {
6673  stream.put(c);
6674  }
6675 
6676  void write_characters(const CharType* s, size_t length) override
6677  {
6678  stream.write(s, static_cast<std::streamsize>(length));
6679  }
6680 
6681  private:
6682  std::basic_ostream<CharType>& stream;
6683  };
6684 
6686  template<typename CharType>
6687  class output_string_adapter : public output_adapter<CharType>
6688  {
6689  public:
6690  output_string_adapter(std::string& s)
6691  : str(s)
6692  {}
6693 
6694  void write_character(CharType c) override
6695  {
6696  str.push_back(c);
6697  }
6698 
6699  void write_characters(const CharType* s, size_t length) override
6700  {
6701  str.append(s, length);
6702  }
6703 
6704  private:
6705  std::basic_string<CharType>& str;
6706  };
6707 
6708 
6710  // serialization //
6712 
6715 
6716  private:
6720  class serializer
6721  {
6722  private:
6723  serializer(const serializer&) = delete;
6724  serializer& operator=(const serializer&) = delete;
6725 
6726  public:
6731  serializer(output_adapter_t<char> s, const char ichar)
6732  : o(s), loc(std::localeconv()),
6733  thousands_sep(!loc->thousands_sep ? '\0' : loc->thousands_sep[0]),
6734  decimal_point(!loc->decimal_point ? '\0' : loc->decimal_point[0]),
6735  indent_char(ichar), indent_string(512, indent_char)
6736  {}
6737 
6755  void dump(const basic_json& val,
6756  const bool pretty_print,
6757  const unsigned int indent_step,
6758  const unsigned int current_indent = 0)
6759  {
6760  switch (val.m_type)
6761  {
6762  case value_t::object:
6763  {
6764  if (val.m_value.object->empty())
6765  {
6766  o->write_characters("{}", 2);
6767  return;
6768  }
6769 
6770  if (pretty_print)
6771  {
6772  o->write_characters("{\n", 2);
6773 
6774  // variable to hold indentation for recursive calls
6775  const auto new_indent = current_indent + indent_step;
6776  if (indent_string.size() < new_indent)
6777  {
6778  indent_string.resize(new_indent, ' ');
6779  }
6780 
6781  // first n-1 elements
6782  auto i = val.m_value.object->cbegin();
6783  for (size_t cnt = 0; cnt < val.m_value.object->size() - 1; ++cnt, ++i)
6784  {
6785  o->write_characters(indent_string.c_str(), new_indent);
6786  o->write_character('\"');
6787  dump_escaped(i->first);
6788  o->write_characters("\": ", 3);
6789  dump(i->second, true, indent_step, new_indent);
6790  o->write_characters(",\n", 2);
6791  }
6792 
6793  // last element
6794  assert(i != val.m_value.object->cend());
6795  o->write_characters(indent_string.c_str(), new_indent);
6796  o->write_character('\"');
6797  dump_escaped(i->first);
6798  o->write_characters("\": ", 3);
6799  dump(i->second, true, indent_step, new_indent);
6800 
6801  o->write_character('\n');
6802  o->write_characters(indent_string.c_str(), current_indent);
6803  o->write_character('}');
6804  }
6805  else
6806  {
6807  o->write_character('{');
6808 
6809  // first n-1 elements
6810  auto i = val.m_value.object->cbegin();
6811  for (size_t cnt = 0; cnt < val.m_value.object->size() - 1; ++cnt, ++i)
6812  {
6813  o->write_character('\"');
6814  dump_escaped(i->first);
6815  o->write_characters("\":", 2);
6816  dump(i->second, false, indent_step, current_indent);
6817  o->write_character(',');
6818  }
6819 
6820  // last element
6821  assert(i != val.m_value.object->cend());
6822  o->write_character('\"');
6823  dump_escaped(i->first);
6824  o->write_characters("\":", 2);
6825  dump(i->second, false, indent_step, current_indent);
6826 
6827  o->write_character('}');
6828  }
6829 
6830  return;
6831  }
6832 
6833  case value_t::array:
6834  {
6835  if (val.m_value.array->empty())
6836  {
6837  o->write_characters("[]", 2);
6838  return;
6839  }
6840 
6841  if (pretty_print)
6842  {
6843  o->write_characters("[\n", 2);
6844 
6845  // variable to hold indentation for recursive calls
6846  const auto new_indent = current_indent + indent_step;
6847  if (indent_string.size() < new_indent)
6848  {
6849  indent_string.resize(new_indent, ' ');
6850  }
6851 
6852  // first n-1 elements
6853  for (auto i = val.m_value.array->cbegin(); i != val.m_value.array->cend() - 1; ++i)
6854  {
6855  o->write_characters(indent_string.c_str(), new_indent);
6856  dump(*i, true, indent_step, new_indent);
6857  o->write_characters(",\n", 2);
6858  }
6859 
6860  // last element
6861  assert(not val.m_value.array->empty());
6862  o->write_characters(indent_string.c_str(), new_indent);
6863  dump(val.m_value.array->back(), true, indent_step, new_indent);
6864 
6865  o->write_character('\n');
6866  o->write_characters(indent_string.c_str(), current_indent);
6867  o->write_character(']');
6868  }
6869  else
6870  {
6871  o->write_character('[');
6872 
6873  // first n-1 elements
6874  for (auto i = val.m_value.array->cbegin(); i != val.m_value.array->cend() - 1; ++i)
6875  {
6876  dump(*i, false, indent_step, current_indent);
6877  o->write_character(',');
6878  }
6879 
6880  // last element
6881  assert(not val.m_value.array->empty());
6882  dump(val.m_value.array->back(), false, indent_step, current_indent);
6883 
6884  o->write_character(']');
6885  }
6886 
6887  return;
6888  }
6889 
6890  case value_t::string:
6891  {
6892  o->write_character('\"');
6893  dump_escaped(*val.m_value.string);
6894  o->write_character('\"');
6895  return;
6896  }
6897 
6898  case value_t::boolean:
6899  {
6900  if (val.m_value.boolean)
6901  {
6902  o->write_characters("true", 4);
6903  }
6904  else
6905  {
6906  o->write_characters("false", 5);
6907  }
6908  return;
6909  }
6910 
6911  case value_t::number_integer:
6912  {
6913  dump_integer(val.m_value.number_integer);
6914  return;
6915  }
6916 
6917  case value_t::number_unsigned:
6918  {
6919  dump_integer(val.m_value.number_unsigned);
6920  return;
6921  }
6922 
6923  case value_t::number_float:
6924  {
6925  dump_float(val.m_value.number_float);
6926  return;
6927  }
6928 
6929  case value_t::discarded:
6930  {
6931  o->write_characters("<discarded>", 11);
6932  return;
6933  }
6934 
6935  case value_t::null:
6936  {
6937  o->write_characters("null", 4);
6938  return;
6939  }
6940  }
6941  }
6942 
6943  private:
6952  static std::size_t extra_space(const string_t& s) noexcept
6953  {
6954  return std::accumulate(s.begin(), s.end(), size_t{},
6955  [](size_t res, typename string_t::value_type c)
6956  {
6957  switch (c)
6958  {
6959  case '"':
6960  case '\\':
6961  case '\b':
6962  case '\f':
6963  case '\n':
6964  case '\r':
6965  case '\t':
6966  {
6967  // from c (1 byte) to \x (2 bytes)
6968  return res + 1;
6969  }
6970 
6971  case 0x00:
6972  case 0x01:
6973  case 0x02:
6974  case 0x03:
6975  case 0x04:
6976  case 0x05:
6977  case 0x06:
6978  case 0x07:
6979  case 0x0b:
6980  case 0x0e:
6981  case 0x0f:
6982  case 0x10:
6983  case 0x11:
6984  case 0x12:
6985  case 0x13:
6986  case 0x14:
6987  case 0x15:
6988  case 0x16:
6989  case 0x17:
6990  case 0x18:
6991  case 0x19:
6992  case 0x1a:
6993  case 0x1b:
6994  case 0x1c:
6995  case 0x1d:
6996  case 0x1e:
6997  case 0x1f:
6998  {
6999  // from c (1 byte) to \uxxxx (6 bytes)
7000  return res + 5;
7001  }
7002 
7003  default:
7004  {
7005  return res;
7006  }
7007  }
7008  });
7009  }
7010 
7023  void dump_escaped(const string_t& s) const
7024  {
7025  const auto space = extra_space(s);
7026  if (space == 0)
7027  {
7028  o->write_characters(s.c_str(), s.size());
7029  return;
7030  }
7031 
7032  // create a result string of necessary size
7033  string_t result(s.size() + space, '\\');
7034  std::size_t pos = 0;
7035 
7036  for (const auto& c : s)
7037  {
7038  switch (c)
7039  {
7040  // quotation mark (0x22)
7041  case '"':
7042  {
7043  result[pos + 1] = '"';
7044  pos += 2;
7045  break;
7046  }
7047 
7048  // reverse solidus (0x5c)
7049  case '\\':
7050  {
7051  // nothing to change
7052  pos += 2;
7053  break;
7054  }
7055 
7056  // backspace (0x08)
7057  case '\b':
7058  {
7059  result[pos + 1] = 'b';
7060  pos += 2;
7061  break;
7062  }
7063 
7064  // formfeed (0x0c)
7065  case '\f':
7066  {
7067  result[pos + 1] = 'f';
7068  pos += 2;
7069  break;
7070  }
7071 
7072  // newline (0x0a)
7073  case '\n':
7074  {
7075  result[pos + 1] = 'n';
7076  pos += 2;
7077  break;
7078  }
7079 
7080  // carriage return (0x0d)
7081  case '\r':
7082  {
7083  result[pos + 1] = 'r';
7084  pos += 2;
7085  break;
7086  }
7087 
7088  // horizontal tab (0x09)
7089  case '\t':
7090  {
7091  result[pos + 1] = 't';
7092  pos += 2;
7093  break;
7094  }
7095 
7096  case 0x00:
7097  case 0x01:
7098  case 0x02:
7099  case 0x03:
7100  case 0x04:
7101  case 0x05:
7102  case 0x06:
7103  case 0x07:
7104  case 0x0b:
7105  case 0x0e:
7106  case 0x0f:
7107  case 0x10:
7108  case 0x11:
7109  case 0x12:
7110  case 0x13:
7111  case 0x14:
7112  case 0x15:
7113  case 0x16:
7114  case 0x17:
7115  case 0x18:
7116  case 0x19:
7117  case 0x1a:
7118  case 0x1b:
7119  case 0x1c:
7120  case 0x1d:
7121  case 0x1e:
7122  case 0x1f:
7123  {
7124  // convert a number 0..15 to its hex representation
7125  // (0..f)
7126  static const char hexify[16] =
7127  {
7128  '0', '1', '2', '3', '4', '5', '6', '7',
7129  '8', '9', 'a', 'b', 'c', 'd', 'e', 'f'
7130  };
7131 
7132  // print character c as \uxxxx
7133  for (const char m :
7134  { 'u', '0', '0', hexify[c >> 4], hexify[c & 0x0f]
7135  })
7136  {
7137  result[++pos] = m;
7138  }
7139 
7140  ++pos;
7141  break;
7142  }
7143 
7144  default:
7145  {
7146  // all other characters are added as-is
7147  result[pos++] = c;
7148  break;
7149  }
7150  }
7151  }
7152 
7153  assert(pos == s.size() + space);
7154  o->write_characters(result.c_str(), result.size());
7155  }
7156 
7166  template<typename NumberType, detail::enable_if_t <
7167  std::is_same<NumberType, number_unsigned_t>::value or
7168  std::is_same<NumberType, number_integer_t>::value, int> = 0>
7169  void dump_integer(NumberType x)
7170  {
7171  // special case for "0"
7172  if (x == 0)
7173  {
7174  o->write_character('0');
7175  return;
7176  }
7177 
7178  const bool is_negative = x < 0;
7179  size_t i = 0;
7180 
7181  // spare 1 byte for '\0'
7182  while (x != 0 and i < number_buffer.size() - 1)
7183  {
7184  const auto digit = std::labs(static_cast<long>(x % 10));
7185  number_buffer[i++] = static_cast<char>('0' + digit);
7186  x /= 10;
7187  }
7188 
7189  // make sure the number has been processed completely
7190  assert(x == 0);
7191 
7192  if (is_negative)
7193  {
7194  // make sure there is capacity for the '-'
7195  assert(i < number_buffer.size() - 2);
7196  number_buffer[i++] = '-';
7197  }
7198 
7199  std::reverse(number_buffer.begin(), number_buffer.begin() + i);
7200  o->write_characters(number_buffer.data(), i);
7201  }
7202 
7211  void dump_float(number_float_t x)
7212  {
7213  // NaN / inf
7214  if (not std::isfinite(x) or std::isnan(x))
7215  {
7216  o->write_characters("null", 4);
7217  return;
7218  }
7219 
7220  // special case for 0.0 and -0.0
7221  if (x == 0)
7222  {
7223  if (std::signbit(x))
7224  {
7225  o->write_characters("-0.0", 4);
7226  }
7227  else
7228  {
7229  o->write_characters("0.0", 3);
7230  }
7231  return;
7232  }
7233 
7234  // get number of digits for a text -> float -> text round-trip
7235  static constexpr auto d = std::numeric_limits<number_float_t>::digits10;
7236 
7237  // the actual conversion
7238  std::ptrdiff_t len = snprintf(number_buffer.data(), number_buffer.size(),
7239  "%.*g", d, x);
7240 
7241  // negative value indicates an error
7242  assert(len > 0);
7243  // check if buffer was large enough
7244  assert(static_cast<size_t>(len) < number_buffer.size());
7245 
7246  // erase thousands separator
7247  if (thousands_sep != '\0')
7248  {
7249  const auto end = std::remove(number_buffer.begin(),
7250  number_buffer.begin() + len,
7251  thousands_sep);
7252  std::fill(end, number_buffer.end(), '\0');
7253  assert((end - number_buffer.begin()) <= len);
7254  len = (end - number_buffer.begin());
7255  }
7256 
7257  // convert decimal point to '.'
7258  if (decimal_point != '\0' and decimal_point != '.')
7259  {
7260  for (auto& c : number_buffer)
7261  {
7262  if (c == decimal_point)
7263  {
7264  c = '.';
7265  break;
7266  }
7267  }
7268  }
7269 
7270  o->write_characters(number_buffer.data(), static_cast<size_t>(len));
7271 
7272  // determine if need to append ".0"
7273  const bool value_is_int_like = std::none_of(number_buffer.begin(),
7274  number_buffer.begin() + len + 1,
7275  [](char c)
7276  {
7277  return c == '.' or c == 'e';
7278  });
7279 
7280  if (value_is_int_like)
7281  {
7282  o->write_characters(".0", 2);
7283  }
7284  }
7285 
7286  private:
7288  output_adapter_t<char> o = nullptr;
7289 
7291  std::array<char, 64> number_buffer{{}};
7292 
7294  const std::lconv* loc = nullptr;
7296  const char thousands_sep = '\0';
7298  const char decimal_point = '\0';
7299 
7301  const char indent_char;
7302 
7304  string_t indent_string;
7305  };
7306 
7307  public:
7336  friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& o, const basic_json& j)
7337  {
7338  // read width member and use it as indentation parameter if nonzero
7339  const bool pretty_print = (o.width() > 0);
7340  const auto indentation = (pretty_print ? o.width() : 0);
7341 
7342  // reset width to 0 for subsequent calls to this stream
7343  o.width(0);
7344 
7345  // do the actual serialization
7346  serializer s(output_adapter<char>::create(o), o.fill());
7347  s.dump(j, pretty_print, static_cast<unsigned int>(indentation));
7348  return o;
7349  }
7350 
7358  JSON_DEPRECATED
7359  friend std::ostream& operator>>(const basic_json& j, std::ostream& o)
7360  {
7361  return o << j;
7362  }
7363 
7365 
7366 
7368  // deserialization //
7370 
7373 
7406  template<class T, std::size_t N>
7407  static basic_json parse(T (&array)[N],
7408  const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr)
7409  {
7410  // delegate the call to the iterator-range parse overload
7411  return parse(std::begin(array), std::end(array), cb);
7412  }
7413 
7445  template<typename CharT, typename std::enable_if<
7446  std::is_pointer<CharT>::value and
7447  std::is_integral<typename std::remove_pointer<CharT>::type>::value and
7448  sizeof(typename std::remove_pointer<CharT>::type) == 1, int>::type = 0>
7449  static basic_json parse(const CharT s,
7450  const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr)
7451  {
7452  return parser(input_adapter::create(s), cb).parse(true);
7453  }
7454 
7484  static basic_json parse(std::istream& i,
7485  const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr)
7486  {
7487  return parser(input_adapter::create(i), cb).parse(true);
7488  }
7489 
7493  static basic_json parse(std::istream&& i,
7494  const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr)
7495  {
7496  return parser(input_adapter::create(i), cb).parse(true);
7497  }
7498 
7544  template<class IteratorType, typename std::enable_if<
7545  std::is_base_of<
7546  std::random_access_iterator_tag,
7547  typename std::iterator_traits<IteratorType>::iterator_category>::value, int>::type = 0>
7548  static basic_json parse(IteratorType first, IteratorType last,
7549  const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr)
7550  {
7551  return parser(input_adapter::create(first, last), cb).parse(true);
7552  }
7553 
7598  template<class ContiguousContainer, typename std::enable_if<
7599  not std::is_pointer<ContiguousContainer>::value and
7600  std::is_base_of<
7601  std::random_access_iterator_tag,
7602  typename std::iterator_traits<decltype(std::begin(std::declval<ContiguousContainer const>()))>::iterator_category>::value
7603  , int>::type = 0>
7604  static basic_json parse(const ContiguousContainer& c,
7605  const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr)
7606  {
7607  // delegate the call to the iterator-range parse overload
7608  return parse(std::begin(c), std::end(c), cb);
7609  }
7610 
7618  JSON_DEPRECATED
7619  friend std::istream& operator<<(basic_json& j, std::istream& i)
7620  {
7621  j = parser(input_adapter::create(i)).parse(false);
7622  return i;
7623  }
7624 
7651  friend std::istream& operator>>(std::istream& i, basic_json& j)
7652  {
7653  j = parser(input_adapter::create(i)).parse(false);
7654  return i;
7655  }
7656 
7658 
7660  // convenience functions //
7662 
7678  std::string type_name() const
7679  {
7680  {
7681  switch (m_type)
7682  {
7683  case value_t::null:
7684  return "null";
7685  case value_t::object:
7686  return "object";
7687  case value_t::array:
7688  return "array";
7689  case value_t::string:
7690  return "string";
7691  case value_t::boolean:
7692  return "boolean";
7693  case value_t::discarded:
7694  return "discarded";
7695  default:
7696  return "number";
7697  }
7698  }
7699  }
7700 
7701 
7702  private:
7704  // member variables //
7706 
7708  value_t m_type = value_t::null;
7709 
7711  json_value m_value = {};
7712 
7713 
7714  private:
7716  // iterators //
7718 
7728  class primitive_iterator_t
7729  {
7730  public:
7731 
7732  difference_type get_value() const noexcept
7733  {
7734  return m_it;
7735  }
7737  void set_begin() noexcept
7738  {
7739  m_it = begin_value;
7740  }
7741 
7743  void set_end() noexcept
7744  {
7745  m_it = end_value;
7746  }
7747 
7749  constexpr bool is_begin() const noexcept
7750  {
7751  return (m_it == begin_value);
7752  }
7753 
7755  constexpr bool is_end() const noexcept
7756  {
7757  return (m_it == end_value);
7758  }
7759 
7760  friend constexpr bool operator==(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
7761  {
7762  return lhs.m_it == rhs.m_it;
7763  }
7764 
7765  friend constexpr bool operator!=(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
7766  {
7767  return !(lhs == rhs);
7768  }
7769 
7770  friend constexpr bool operator<(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
7771  {
7772  return lhs.m_it < rhs.m_it;
7773  }
7774 
7775  friend constexpr bool operator<=(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
7776  {
7777  return lhs.m_it <= rhs.m_it;
7778  }
7779 
7780  friend constexpr bool operator>(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
7781  {
7782  return lhs.m_it > rhs.m_it;
7783  }
7784 
7785  friend constexpr bool operator>=(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
7786  {
7787  return lhs.m_it >= rhs.m_it;
7788  }
7789 
7790  primitive_iterator_t operator+(difference_type i)
7791  {
7792  auto result = *this;
7793  result += i;
7794  return result;
7795  }
7796 
7797  friend constexpr difference_type operator-(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
7798  {
7799  return lhs.m_it - rhs.m_it;
7800  }
7801 
7802  friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, primitive_iterator_t it)
7803  {
7804  return os << it.m_it;
7805  }
7806 
7807  primitive_iterator_t& operator++()
7808  {
7809  ++m_it;
7810  return *this;
7811  }
7812 
7813  primitive_iterator_t operator++(int)
7814  {
7815  auto result = *this;
7816  m_it++;
7817  return result;
7818  }
7819 
7820  primitive_iterator_t& operator--()
7821  {
7822  --m_it;
7823  return *this;
7824  }
7825 
7826  primitive_iterator_t operator--(int)
7827  {
7828  auto result = *this;
7829  m_it--;
7830  return result;
7831  }
7832 
7833  primitive_iterator_t& operator+=(difference_type n)
7834  {
7835  m_it += n;
7836  return *this;
7837  }
7838 
7839  primitive_iterator_t& operator-=(difference_type n)
7840  {
7841  m_it -= n;
7842  return *this;
7843  }
7844 
7845  private:
7846  static constexpr difference_type begin_value = 0;
7847  static constexpr difference_type end_value = begin_value + 1;
7848 
7850  difference_type m_it = std::numeric_limits<std::ptrdiff_t>::denorm_min();
7851  };
7852 
7860  struct internal_iterator
7861  {
7863  typename object_t::iterator object_iterator;
7865  typename array_t::iterator array_iterator;
7867  primitive_iterator_t primitive_iterator;
7868 
7870  internal_iterator() noexcept
7871  : object_iterator(), array_iterator(), primitive_iterator()
7872  {}
7873  };
7874 
7876  template<typename IteratorType>
7877  class iteration_proxy
7878  {
7879  private:
7881  class iteration_proxy_internal
7882  {
7883  private:
7885  IteratorType anchor;
7887  size_t array_index = 0;
7888 
7889  public:
7890  explicit iteration_proxy_internal(IteratorType it) noexcept
7891  : anchor(it)
7892  {}
7893 
7895  iteration_proxy_internal& operator*()
7896  {
7897  return *this;
7898  }
7899 
7901  iteration_proxy_internal& operator++()
7902  {
7903  ++anchor;
7904  ++array_index;
7905 
7906  return *this;
7907  }
7908 
7910  bool operator!= (const iteration_proxy_internal& o) const
7911  {
7912  return anchor != o.anchor;
7913  }
7914 
7916  typename basic_json::string_t key() const
7917  {
7918  assert(anchor.m_object != nullptr);
7919 
7920  switch (anchor.m_object->type())
7921  {
7922  // use integer array index as key
7923  case value_t::array:
7924  {
7925  return std::to_string(array_index);
7926  }
7927 
7928  // use key from the object
7929  case value_t::object:
7930  {
7931  return anchor.key();
7932  }
7933 
7934  // use an empty key for all primitive types
7935  default:
7936  {
7937  return "";
7938  }
7939  }
7940  }
7941 
7943  typename IteratorType::reference value() const
7944  {
7945  return anchor.value();
7946  }
7947  };
7948 
7950  typename IteratorType::reference container;
7951 
7952  public:
7954  explicit iteration_proxy(typename IteratorType::reference cont)
7955  : container(cont)
7956  {}
7957 
7959  iteration_proxy_internal begin() noexcept
7960  {
7961  return iteration_proxy_internal(container.begin());
7962  }
7963 
7965  iteration_proxy_internal end() noexcept
7966  {
7967  return iteration_proxy_internal(container.end());
7968  }
7969  };
7970 
7971  public:
7991  template<typename U>
7992  class iter_impl : public std::iterator<std::random_access_iterator_tag, U>
7993  {
7995  friend class basic_json;
7996 
7997  // make sure U is basic_json or const basic_json
7998  static_assert(std::is_same<U, basic_json>::value
7999  or std::is_same<U, const basic_json>::value,
8000  "iter_impl only accepts (const) basic_json");
8001 
8002  public:
8004  using value_type = typename basic_json::value_type;
8006  using difference_type = typename basic_json::difference_type;
8008  using pointer = typename std::conditional<std::is_const<U>::value,
8009  typename basic_json::const_pointer,
8010  typename basic_json::pointer>::type;
8012  using reference = typename std::conditional<std::is_const<U>::value,
8013  typename basic_json::const_reference,
8014  typename basic_json::reference>::type;
8016  using iterator_category = std::bidirectional_iterator_tag;
8017 
8019  iter_impl() = default;
8020 
8027  explicit iter_impl(pointer object) noexcept
8028  : m_object(object)
8029  {
8030  assert(m_object != nullptr);
8031 
8032  switch (m_object->m_type)
8033  {
8034  case basic_json::value_t::object:
8035  {
8036  m_it.object_iterator = typename object_t::iterator();
8037  break;
8038  }
8039 
8040  case basic_json::value_t::array:
8041  {
8042  m_it.array_iterator = typename array_t::iterator();
8043  break;
8044  }
8045 
8046  default:
8047  {
8048  m_it.primitive_iterator = primitive_iterator_t();
8049  break;
8050  }
8051  }
8052  }
8053 
8054  /*
8055  Use operator `const_iterator` instead of `const_iterator(const iterator&
8056  other) noexcept` to avoid two class definitions for @ref iterator and
8057  @ref const_iterator.
8058 
8059  This function is only called if this class is an @ref iterator. If this
8060  class is a @ref const_iterator this function is not called.
8061  */
8062  operator const_iterator() const
8063  {
8064  const_iterator ret;
8065 
8066  if (m_object)
8067  {
8068  ret.m_object = m_object;
8069  ret.m_it = m_it;
8070  }
8071 
8072  return ret;
8073  }
8074 
8080  iter_impl(const iter_impl& other) noexcept
8081  : m_object(other.m_object), m_it(other.m_it)
8082  {}
8083 
8089  iter_impl& operator=(iter_impl other) noexcept(
8090  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<pointer>::value and
8091  std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<pointer>::value and
8092  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<internal_iterator>::value and
8093  std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<internal_iterator>::value
8094  )
8095  {
8096  std::swap(m_object, other.m_object);
8097  std::swap(m_it, other.m_it);
8098  return *this;
8099  }
8100 
8101  private:
8106  void set_begin() noexcept
8107  {
8108  assert(m_object != nullptr);
8109 
8110  switch (m_object->m_type)
8111  {
8112  case basic_json::value_t::object:
8113  {
8114  m_it.object_iterator = m_object->m_value.object->begin();
8115  break;
8116  }
8117 
8118  case basic_json::value_t::array:
8119  {
8120  m_it.array_iterator = m_object->m_value.array->begin();
8121  break;
8122  }
8123 
8124  case basic_json::value_t::null:
8125  {
8126  // set to end so begin()==end() is true: null is empty
8127  m_it.primitive_iterator.set_end();
8128  break;
8129  }
8130 
8131  default:
8132  {
8133  m_it.primitive_iterator.set_begin();
8134  break;
8135  }
8136  }
8137  }
8138 
8143  void set_end() noexcept
8144  {
8145  assert(m_object != nullptr);
8146 
8147  switch (m_object->m_type)
8148  {
8149  case basic_json::value_t::object:
8150  {
8151  m_it.object_iterator = m_object->m_value.object->end();
8152  break;
8153  }
8154 
8155  case basic_json::value_t::array:
8156  {
8157  m_it.array_iterator = m_object->m_value.array->end();
8158  break;
8159  }
8160 
8161  default:
8162  {
8163  m_it.primitive_iterator.set_end();
8164  break;
8165  }
8166  }
8167  }
8168 
8169  public:
8174  reference operator*() const
8175  {
8176  assert(m_object != nullptr);
8177 
8178  switch (m_object->m_type)
8179  {
8180  case basic_json::value_t::object:
8181  {
8182  assert(m_it.object_iterator != m_object->m_value.object->end());
8183  return m_it.object_iterator->second;
8184  }
8185 
8186  case basic_json::value_t::array:
8187  {
8188  assert(m_it.array_iterator != m_object->m_value.array->end());
8189  return *m_it.array_iterator;
8190  }
8191 
8192  case basic_json::value_t::null:
8193  {
8194  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));
8195  }
8196 
8197  default:
8198  {
8199  if (m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin())
8200  {
8201  return *m_object;
8202  }
8203 
8204  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));
8205  }
8206  }
8207  }
8208 
8213  pointer operator->() const
8214  {
8215  assert(m_object != nullptr);
8216 
8217  switch (m_object->m_type)
8218  {
8219  case basic_json::value_t::object:
8220  {
8221  assert(m_it.object_iterator != m_object->m_value.object->end());
8222  return &(m_it.object_iterator->second);
8223  }
8224 
8225  case basic_json::value_t::array:
8226  {
8227  assert(m_it.array_iterator != m_object->m_value.array->end());
8228  return &*m_it.array_iterator;
8229  }
8230 
8231  default:
8232  {
8233  if (m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin())
8234  {
8235  return m_object;
8236  }
8237 
8238  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));
8239  }
8240  }
8241  }
8242 
8247  iter_impl operator++(int)
8248  {
8249  auto result = *this;
8250  ++(*this);
8251  return result;
8252  }
8253 
8258  iter_impl& operator++()
8259  {
8260  assert(m_object != nullptr);
8261 
8262  switch (m_object->m_type)
8263  {
8264  case basic_json::value_t::object:
8265  {
8266  std::advance(m_it.object_iterator, 1);
8267  break;
8268  }
8269 
8270  case basic_json::value_t::array:
8271  {
8272  std::advance(m_it.array_iterator, 1);
8273  break;
8274  }
8275 
8276  default:
8277  {
8278  ++m_it.primitive_iterator;
8279  break;
8280  }
8281  }
8282 
8283  return *this;
8284  }
8285 
8290  iter_impl operator--(int)
8291  {
8292  auto result = *this;
8293  --(*this);
8294  return result;
8295  }
8296 
8301  iter_impl& operator--()
8302  {
8303  assert(m_object != nullptr);
8304 
8305  switch (m_object->m_type)
8306  {
8307  case basic_json::value_t::object:
8308  {
8309  std::advance(m_it.object_iterator, -1);
8310  break;
8311  }
8312 
8313  case basic_json::value_t::array:
8314  {
8315  std::advance(m_it.array_iterator, -1);
8316  break;
8317  }
8318 
8319  default:
8320  {
8321  --m_it.primitive_iterator;
8322  break;
8323  }
8324  }
8325 
8326  return *this;
8327  }
8328 
8333  bool operator==(const iter_impl& other) const
8334  {
8335  // if objects are not the same, the comparison is undefined
8336  if (m_object != other.m_object)
8337  {
8338  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(212, "cannot compare iterators of different containers"));
8339  }
8340 
8341  assert(m_object != nullptr);
8342 
8343  switch (m_object->m_type)
8344  {
8345  case basic_json::value_t::object:
8346  {
8347  return (m_it.object_iterator == other.m_it.object_iterator);
8348  }
8349 
8350  case basic_json::value_t::array:
8351  {
8352  return (m_it.array_iterator == other.m_it.array_iterator);
8353  }
8354 
8355  default:
8356  {
8357  return (m_it.primitive_iterator == other.m_it.primitive_iterator);
8358  }
8359  }
8360  }
8361 
8366  bool operator!=(const iter_impl& other) const
8367  {
8368  return not operator==(other);
8369  }
8370 
8375  bool operator<(const iter_impl& other) const
8376  {
8377  // if objects are not the same, the comparison is undefined
8378  if (m_object != other.m_object)
8379  {
8380  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(212, "cannot compare iterators of different containers"));
8381  }
8382 
8383  assert(m_object != nullptr);
8384 
8385  switch (m_object->m_type)
8386  {
8387  case basic_json::value_t::object:
8388  {
8389  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(213, "cannot compare order of object iterators"));
8390  }
8391 
8392  case basic_json::value_t::array:
8393  {
8394  return (m_it.array_iterator < other.m_it.array_iterator);
8395  }
8396 
8397  default:
8398  {
8399  return (m_it.primitive_iterator < other.m_it.primitive_iterator);
8400  }
8401  }
8402  }
8403 
8408  bool operator<=(const iter_impl& other) const
8409  {
8410  return not other.operator < (*this);
8411  }
8412 
8417  bool operator>(const iter_impl& other) const
8418  {
8419  return not operator<=(other);
8420  }
8421 
8426  bool operator>=(const iter_impl& other) const
8427  {
8428  return not operator<(other);
8429  }
8430 
8435  iter_impl& operator+=(difference_type i)
8436  {
8437  assert(m_object != nullptr);
8438 
8439  switch (m_object->m_type)
8440  {
8441  case basic_json::value_t::object:
8442  {
8443  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(209, "cannot use offsets with object iterators"));
8444  }
8445 
8446  case basic_json::value_t::array:
8447  {
8448  std::advance(m_it.array_iterator, i);
8449  break;
8450  }
8451 
8452  default:
8453  {
8454  m_it.primitive_iterator += i;
8455  break;
8456  }
8457  }
8458 
8459  return *this;
8460  }
8461 
8466  iter_impl& operator-=(difference_type i)
8467  {
8468  return operator+=(-i);
8469  }
8470 
8475  iter_impl operator+(difference_type i)
8476  {
8477  auto result = *this;
8478  result += i;
8479  return result;
8480  }
8481 
8486  iter_impl operator-(difference_type i)
8487  {
8488  auto result = *this;
8489  result -= i;
8490  return result;
8491  }
8492 
8497  difference_type operator-(const iter_impl& other) const
8498  {
8499  assert(m_object != nullptr);
8500 
8501  switch (m_object->m_type)
8502  {
8503  case basic_json::value_t::object:
8504  {
8505  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(209, "cannot use offsets with object iterators"));
8506  }
8507 
8508  case basic_json::value_t::array:
8509  {
8510  return m_it.array_iterator - other.m_it.array_iterator;
8511  }
8512 
8513  default:
8514  {
8515  return m_it.primitive_iterator - other.m_it.primitive_iterator;
8516  }
8517  }
8518  }
8519 
8524  reference operator[](difference_type n) const
8525  {
8526  assert(m_object != nullptr);
8527 
8528  switch (m_object->m_type)
8529  {
8530  case basic_json::value_t::object:
8531  {
8532  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(208, "cannot use operator[] for object iterators"));
8533  }
8534 
8535  case basic_json::value_t::array:
8536  {
8537  return *std::next(m_it.array_iterator, n);
8538  }
8539 
8540  case basic_json::value_t::null:
8541  {
8542  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));
8543  }
8544 
8545  default:
8546  {
8547  if (m_it.primitive_iterator.get_value() == -n)
8548  {
8549  return *m_object;
8550  }
8551 
8552  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));
8553  }
8554  }
8555  }
8556 
8561  typename object_t::key_type key() const
8562  {
8563  assert(m_object != nullptr);
8564 
8565  if (m_object->is_object())
8566  {
8567  return m_it.object_iterator->first;
8568  }
8569 
8570  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(207, "cannot use key() for non-object iterators"));
8571  }
8572 
8577  reference value() const
8578  {
8579  return operator*();
8580  }
8581 
8582  private:
8584  pointer m_object = nullptr;
8586  internal_iterator m_it = internal_iterator();
8587  };
8588 
8606  template<typename Base>
8607  class json_reverse_iterator : public std::reverse_iterator<Base>
8608  {
8609  public:
8611  using base_iterator = std::reverse_iterator<Base>;
8613  using reference = typename Base::reference;
8614 
8616  json_reverse_iterator(const typename base_iterator::iterator_type& it) noexcept
8617  : base_iterator(it)
8618  {}
8619 
8621  json_reverse_iterator(const base_iterator& it) noexcept
8622  : base_iterator(it)
8623  {}
8624 
8626  json_reverse_iterator operator++(int)
8627  {
8628  return base_iterator::operator++(1);
8629  }
8630 
8632  json_reverse_iterator& operator++()
8633  {
8634  base_iterator::operator++();
8635  return *this;
8636  }
8637 
8639  json_reverse_iterator operator--(int)
8640  {
8641  return base_iterator::operator--(1);
8642  }
8643 
8645  json_reverse_iterator& operator--()
8646  {
8647  base_iterator::operator--();
8648  return *this;
8649  }
8650 
8652  json_reverse_iterator& operator+=(difference_type i)
8653  {
8654  base_iterator::operator+=(i);
8655  return *this;
8656  }
8657 
8659  json_reverse_iterator operator+(difference_type i) const
8660  {
8661  auto result = *this;
8662  result += i;
8663  return result;
8664  }
8665 
8667  json_reverse_iterator operator-(difference_type i) const
8668  {
8669  auto result = *this;
8670  result -= i;
8671  return result;
8672  }
8673 
8675  difference_type operator-(const json_reverse_iterator& other) const
8676  {
8677  return this->base() - other.base();
8678  }
8679 
8681  reference operator[](difference_type n) const
8682  {
8683  return *(this->operator+(n));
8684  }
8685 
8687  typename object_t::key_type key() const
8688  {
8689  auto it = --this->base();
8690  return it.key();
8691  }
8692 
8694  reference value() const
8695  {
8696  auto it = --this->base();
8697  return it.operator * ();
8698  }
8699  };
8700 
8701 
8702  private:
8704  // input adapters //
8706 
8708  class input_adapter
8709  {
8710  public:
8711  virtual int get_character() = 0;
8712  virtual std::string read(size_t offset, size_t length) = 0;
8713  virtual ~input_adapter() {}
8714 
8715  // native support
8716 
8718  static std::shared_ptr<input_adapter> create(std::istream& i, const size_t buffer_size = 16384)
8719  {
8720  return std::shared_ptr<input_adapter>(new cached_input_stream_adapter(i, buffer_size));
8721  }
8722 
8724  static std::shared_ptr<input_adapter> create(std::istream&& i, const size_t buffer_size = 16384)
8725  {
8726  return std::shared_ptr<input_adapter>(new cached_input_stream_adapter(i, buffer_size));
8727  }
8728 
8730  static std::shared_ptr<input_adapter> create(const char* b, size_t l)
8731  {
8732  return std::shared_ptr<input_adapter>(new input_buffer_adapter(b, l));
8733  }
8734 
8735  // derived support
8736 
8738  template<typename CharT, typename std::enable_if<
8739  std::is_pointer<CharT>::value and
8740  std::is_integral<typename std::remove_pointer<CharT>::type>::value and
8741  sizeof(typename std::remove_pointer<CharT>::type) == 1, int>::type = 0>
8742  static std::shared_ptr<input_adapter> create(CharT b)
8743  {
8744  return create(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(b),
8745  std::strlen(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(b)));
8746  }
8747 
8749  template<class IteratorType, typename std::enable_if<
8750  std::is_same<typename std::iterator_traits<IteratorType>::iterator_category, std::random_access_iterator_tag>::value
8751  , int>::type
8752  = 0>
8753  static std::shared_ptr<input_adapter> create(IteratorType first, IteratorType last)
8754  {
8755  // assertion to check that the iterator range is indeed contiguous,
8756  // see http://stackoverflow.com/a/35008842/266378 for more discussion
8757  assert(std::accumulate(first, last, std::pair<bool, int>(true, 0),
8758  [&first](std::pair<bool, int> res, decltype(*first) val)
8759  {
8760  res.first &= (val == *(std::next(std::addressof(*first), res.second++)));
8761  return res;
8762  }).first);
8763 
8764  // assertion to check that each element is 1 byte long
8765  static_assert(sizeof(typename std::iterator_traits<IteratorType>::value_type) == 1,
8766  "each element in the iterator range must have the size of 1 byte");
8767 
8768  return create(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(&(*first)),
8769  static_cast<size_t>(std::distance(first, last)));
8770  }
8771 
8773  template<class T, std::size_t N>
8774  static std::shared_ptr<input_adapter> create(T (&array)[N])
8775  {
8776  // delegate the call to the iterator-range overload
8777  return create(std::begin(array), std::end(array));
8778  }
8779 
8781  template<class ContiguousContainer, typename std::enable_if<
8782  not std::is_pointer<ContiguousContainer>::value and
8783  std::is_base_of<
8784  std::random_access_iterator_tag,
8785  typename std::iterator_traits<decltype(std::begin(std::declval<ContiguousContainer const>()))>::iterator_category>::value
8786  , int>::type = 0>
8787  static std::shared_ptr<input_adapter> create(const ContiguousContainer& c)
8788  {
8789  // delegate the call to the iterator-range overload
8790  return create(std::begin(c), std::end(c));
8791  }
8792  };
8793 
8795  using input_adapter_t = std::shared_ptr<input_adapter>;
8796 
8798  class cached_input_stream_adapter : public input_adapter
8799  {
8800  public:
8801  cached_input_stream_adapter(std::istream& i, const size_t buffer_size)
8802  : is(i), start_position(is.tellg()), buffer(buffer_size, '\0')
8803  {
8804  // immediately abort if stream is erroneous
8805  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(i.fail()))
8806  {
8807  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(111, 0, "bad input stream"));
8808  }
8809 
8810  // initial fill
8811  is.read(buffer.data(), static_cast<std::streamsize>(buffer.size()));
8812  // store number of bytes in the buffer
8813  fill_size = static_cast<size_t>(is.gcount());
8814 
8815  // skip byte-order mark
8816  if (fill_size >= 3 and buffer[0] == '\xEF' and buffer[1] == '\xBB' and buffer[2] == '\xBF')
8817  {
8818  buffer_pos += 3;
8819  processed_chars += 3;
8820  }
8821  }
8822 
8823  ~cached_input_stream_adapter() override
8824  {
8825  // clear stream flags
8826  is.clear();
8827  // We initially read a lot of characters into the buffer, and we
8828  // may not have processed all of them. Therefore, we need to
8829  // "rewind" the stream after the last processed char.
8830  is.seekg(start_position + static_cast<std::streamoff>(processed_chars));
8831  // clear stream flags
8832  is.clear();
8833  }
8834 
8835  int get_character() override
8836  {
8837  // check if refilling is necessary and possible
8838  if (buffer_pos == fill_size and not eof)
8839  {
8840  // refill
8841  is.read(buffer.data(), static_cast<std::streamsize>(buffer.size()));
8842  // store number of bytes in the buffer
8843  fill_size = static_cast<size_t>(is.gcount());
8844 
8845  // the buffer is ready
8846  buffer_pos = 0;
8847 
8848  // remember that filling did not yield new input
8849  if (fill_size == 0)
8850  {
8851  eof = true;
8852  return std::char_traits<char>::eof();
8853  }
8854  }
8855 
8856  ++processed_chars;
8857  return buffer[buffer_pos++] & 0xFF;;
8858  }
8859 
8860  std::string read(size_t offset, size_t length) override
8861  {
8862  // create buffer
8863  std::string result(length, '\0');
8864 
8865  // save stream position
8866  auto current_pos = is.tellg();
8867  // save stream flags
8868  auto flags = is.rdstate();
8869 
8870  // clear stream flags
8871  is.clear();
8872  // set stream position
8873  is.seekg(static_cast<std::streamoff>(offset));
8874  // read bytes
8875  is.read(&result[0], static_cast<std::streamsize>(length));
8876 
8877  // reset stream position
8878  is.seekg(current_pos);
8879  // reset stream flags
8880  is.setstate(flags);
8881 
8882  return result;
8883  }
8884 
8885  private:
8887  std::istream& is;
8888 
8890  size_t processed_chars = 0;
8892  size_t buffer_pos = 0;
8893 
8895  bool eof = false;
8897  size_t fill_size = 0;
8898 
8900  const std::streampos start_position;
8901 
8903  std::vector<char> buffer;
8904  };
8905 
8907  class input_buffer_adapter : public input_adapter
8908  {
8909  public:
8910  input_buffer_adapter(const char* b, size_t l)
8911  : input_adapter(), cursor(b), limit(b + l), start(b)
8912  {}
8913 
8914  // delete because of pointer members
8915  input_buffer_adapter(const input_buffer_adapter&) = delete;
8916  input_buffer_adapter& operator=(input_buffer_adapter&) = delete;
8917 
8918  int get_character() override
8919  {
8920  if (JSON_LIKELY(cursor < limit))
8921  {
8922  return *(cursor++) & 0xFF;
8923  }
8924  else
8925  {
8926  return std::char_traits<char>::eof();
8927  }
8928  }
8929 
8930  std::string read(size_t offset, size_t length) override
8931  {
8932  // avoid reading too many characters
8933  const size_t max_length = static_cast<size_t>(limit - start);
8934  return std::string(start + offset, std::min(length, max_length - offset));
8935  }
8936 
8937  private:
8939  const char* cursor;
8941  const char* limit;
8943  const char* start;
8944  };
8945 
8947  // binary serialization/deserialization //
8949 
8952 
8953  private:
8957  class binary_reader
8958  {
8959  public:
8965  explicit binary_reader(input_adapter_t adapter)
8966  : ia(adapter), is_little_endian(little_endianess())
8967  {
8968  assert(ia);
8969  }
8970 
8983  basic_json parse_cbor(const bool get_char = true)
8984  {
8985  switch (get_char ? get() : current)
8986  {
8987  // EOF
8988  case std::char_traits<char>::eof():
8989  {
8990  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(110, chars_read, "unexpected end of input"));
8991  }
8992 
8993  // Integer 0x00..0x17 (0..23)
8994  case 0x00:
8995  case 0x01:
8996  case 0x02:
8997  case 0x03:
8998  case 0x04:
8999  case 0x05:
9000  case 0x06:
9001  case 0x07:
9002  case 0x08:
9003  case 0x09:
9004  case 0x0a:
9005  case 0x0b:
9006  case 0x0c:
9007  case 0x0d:
9008  case 0x0e:
9009  case 0x0f:
9010  case 0x10:
9011  case 0x11:
9012  case 0x12:
9013  case 0x13:
9014  case 0x14:
9015  case 0x15:
9016  case 0x16:
9017  case 0x17:
9018  {
9019  return static_cast<number_unsigned_t>(current);
9020  }
9021 
9022  case 0x18: // Unsigned integer (one-byte uint8_t follows)
9023  {
9024  return get_number<uint8_t>();
9025  }
9026 
9027  case 0x19: // Unsigned integer (two-byte uint16_t follows)
9028  {
9029  return get_number<uint16_t>();
9030  }
9031 
9032  case 0x1a: // Unsigned integer (four-byte uint32_t follows)
9033  {
9034  return get_number<uint32_t>();
9035  }
9036 
9037  case 0x1b: // Unsigned integer (eight-byte uint64_t follows)
9038  {
9039  return get_number<uint64_t>();
9040  }
9041 
9042  // Negative integer -1-0x00..-1-0x17 (-1..-24)
9043  case 0x20:
9044  case 0x21:
9045  case 0x22:
9046  case 0x23:
9047  case 0x24:
9048  case 0x25:
9049  case 0x26:
9050  case 0x27:
9051  case 0x28:
9052  case 0x29:
9053  case 0x2a:
9054  case 0x2b:
9055  case 0x2c:
9056  case 0x2d:
9057  case 0x2e:
9058  case 0x2f:
9059  case 0x30:
9060  case 0x31:
9061  case 0x32:
9062  case 0x33:
9063  case 0x34:
9064  case 0x35:
9065  case 0x36:
9066  case 0x37:
9067  {
9068  return static_cast<int8_t>(0x20 - 1 - current);
9069  }
9070 
9071  case 0x38: // Negative integer (one-byte uint8_t follows)
9072  {
9073  // must be uint8_t !
9074  return static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1) - get_number<uint8_t>();
9075  }
9076 
9077  case 0x39: // Negative integer -1-n (two-byte uint16_t follows)
9078  {
9079  return static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1) - get_number<uint16_t>();
9080  }
9081 
9082  case 0x3a: // Negative integer -1-n (four-byte uint32_t follows)
9083  {
9084  return static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1) - get_number<uint32_t>();
9085  }
9086 
9087  case 0x3b: // Negative integer -1-n (eight-byte uint64_t follows)
9088  {
9089  return static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1) - static_cast<number_integer_t>(get_number<uint64_t>());
9090  }
9091 
9092  // UTF-8 string (0x00..0x17 bytes follow)
9093  case 0x60:
9094  case 0x61:
9095  case 0x62:
9096  case 0x63:
9097  case 0x64:
9098  case 0x65:
9099  case 0x66:
9100  case 0x67:
9101  case 0x68:
9102  case 0x69:
9103  case 0x6a:
9104  case 0x6b:
9105  case 0x6c:
9106  case 0x6d:
9107  case 0x6e:
9108  case 0x6f:
9109  case 0x70:
9110  case 0x71:
9111  case 0x72:
9112  case 0x73:
9113  case 0x74:
9114  case 0x75:
9115  case 0x76:
9116  case 0x77:
9117  case 0x78: // UTF-8 string (one-byte uint8_t for n follows)
9118  case 0x79: // UTF-8 string (two-byte uint16_t for n follow)
9119  case 0x7a: // UTF-8 string (four-byte uint32_t for n follow)
9120  case 0x7b: // UTF-8 string (eight-byte uint64_t for n follow)
9121  case 0x7f: // UTF-8 string (indefinite length)
9122  {
9123  return get_cbor_string();
9124  }
9125 
9126  // array (0x00..0x17 data items follow)
9127  case 0x80:
9128  case 0x81:
9129  case 0x82:
9130  case 0x83:
9131  case 0x84:
9132  case 0x85:
9133  case 0x86:
9134  case 0x87:
9135  case 0x88:
9136  case 0x89:
9137  case 0x8a:
9138  case 0x8b:
9139  case 0x8c:
9140  case 0x8d:
9141  case 0x8e:
9142  case 0x8f:
9143  case 0x90:
9144  case 0x91:
9145  case 0x92:
9146  case 0x93:
9147  case 0x94:
9148  case 0x95:
9149  case 0x96:
9150  case 0x97:
9151  {
9152  basic_json result = value_t::array;
9153  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(current & 0x1f);
9154  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
9155  {
9156  result.push_back(parse_cbor());
9157  }
9158  return result;
9159  }
9160 
9161  case 0x98: // array (one-byte uint8_t for n follows)
9162  {
9163  basic_json result = value_t::array;
9164  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint8_t>());
9165  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
9166  {
9167  result.push_back(parse_cbor());
9168  }
9169  return result;
9170  }
9171 
9172  case 0x99: // array (two-byte uint16_t for n follow)
9173  {
9174  basic_json result = value_t::array;
9175  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint16_t>());
9176  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
9177  {
9178  result.push_back(parse_cbor());
9179  }
9180  return result;
9181  }
9182 
9183  case 0x9a: // array (four-byte uint32_t for n follow)
9184  {
9185  basic_json result = value_t::array;
9186  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint32_t>());
9187  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
9188  {
9189  result.push_back(parse_cbor());
9190  }
9191  return result;
9192  }
9193 
9194  case 0x9b: // array (eight-byte uint64_t for n follow)
9195  {
9196  basic_json result = value_t::array;
9197  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint64_t>());
9198  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
9199  {
9200  result.push_back(parse_cbor());
9201  }
9202  return result;
9203  }
9204 
9205  case 0x9f: // array (indefinite length)
9206  {
9207  basic_json result = value_t::array;
9208  while (get() != 0xff)
9209  {
9210  result.push_back(parse_cbor(false));
9211  }
9212  return result;
9213  }
9214 
9215  // map (0x00..0x17 pairs of data items follow)
9216  case 0xa0:
9217  case 0xa1:
9218  case 0xa2:
9219  case 0xa3:
9220  case 0xa4:
9221  case 0xa5:
9222  case 0xa6:
9223  case 0xa7:
9224  case 0xa8:
9225  case 0xa9:
9226  case 0xaa:
9227  case 0xab:
9228  case 0xac:
9229  case 0xad:
9230  case 0xae:
9231  case 0xaf:
9232  case 0xb0:
9233  case 0xb1:
9234  case 0xb2:
9235  case 0xb3:
9236  case 0xb4:
9237  case 0xb5:
9238  case 0xb6:
9239  case 0xb7:
9240  {
9241  basic_json result = value_t::object;
9242  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(current & 0x1f);
9243  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
9244  {
9245  get();
9246  auto key = get_cbor_string();
9247  result[key] = parse_cbor();
9248  }
9249  return result;
9250  }
9251 
9252  case 0xb8: // map (one-byte uint8_t for n follows)
9253  {
9254  basic_json result = value_t::object;
9255  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint8_t>());
9256  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
9257  {
9258  get();
9259  auto key = get_cbor_string();
9260  result[key] = parse_cbor();
9261  }
9262  return result;
9263  }
9264 
9265  case 0xb9: // map (two-byte uint16_t for n follow)
9266  {
9267  basic_json result = value_t::object;
9268  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint16_t>());
9269  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
9270  {
9271  get();
9272  auto key = get_cbor_string();
9273  result[key] = parse_cbor();
9274  }
9275  return result;
9276  }
9277 
9278  case 0xba: // map (four-byte uint32_t for n follow)
9279  {
9280  basic_json result = value_t::object;
9281  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint32_t>());
9282  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
9283  {
9284  get();
9285  auto key = get_cbor_string();
9286  result[key] = parse_cbor();
9287  }
9288  return result;
9289  }
9290 
9291  case 0xbb: // map (eight-byte uint64_t for n follow)
9292  {
9293  basic_json result = value_t::object;
9294  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint64_t>());
9295  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
9296  {
9297  get();
9298  auto key = get_cbor_string();
9299  result[key] = parse_cbor();
9300  }
9301  return result;
9302  }
9303 
9304  case 0xbf: // map (indefinite length)
9305  {
9306  basic_json result = value_t::object;
9307  while (get() != 0xff)
9308  {
9309  auto key = get_cbor_string();
9310  result[key] = parse_cbor();
9311  }
9312  return result;
9313  }
9314 
9315  case 0xf4: // false
9316  {
9317  return false;
9318  }
9319 
9320  case 0xf5: // true
9321  {
9322  return true;
9323  }
9324 
9325  case 0xf6: // null
9326  {
9327  return value_t::null;
9328  }
9329 
9330  case 0xf9: // Half-Precision Float (two-byte IEEE 754)
9331  {
9332  const int byte1 = get();
9333  check_eof();
9334  const int byte2 = get();
9335  check_eof();
9336 
9337  // code from RFC 7049, Appendix D, Figure 3:
9338  // As half-precision floating-point numbers were only added
9339  // to IEEE 754 in 2008, today's programming platforms often
9340  // still only have limited support for them. It is very
9341  // easy to include at least decoding support for them even
9342  // without such support. An example of a small decoder for
9343  // half-precision floating-point numbers in the C language
9344  // is shown in Fig. 3.
9345  const int half = (byte1 << 8) + byte2;
9346  const int exp = (half >> 10) & 0x1f;
9347  const int mant = half & 0x3ff;
9348  double val;
9349  if (exp == 0)
9350  {
9351  val = std::ldexp(mant, -24);
9352  }
9353  else if (exp != 31)
9354  {
9355  val = std::ldexp(mant + 1024, exp - 25);
9356  }
9357  else
9358  {
9359  val = mant == 0
9360  ? std::numeric_limits<double>::infinity()
9361  : std::numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN();
9362  }
9363  return (half & 0x8000) != 0 ? -val : val;
9364  }
9365 
9366  case 0xfa: // Single-Precision Float (four-byte IEEE 754)
9367  {
9368  return get_number<float>();
9369  }
9370 
9371  case 0xfb: // Double-Precision Float (eight-byte IEEE 754)
9372  {
9373  return get_number<double>();
9374  }
9375 
9376  default: // anything else (0xFF is handled inside the other types)
9377  {
9378  std::stringstream ss;
9379  ss << std::setw(2) << std::setfill('0') << std::hex << current;
9380  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(112, chars_read, "error reading CBOR; last byte: 0x" + ss.str()));
9381  }
9382  }
9383  }
9384 
9393  basic_json parse_msgpack()
9394  {
9395  switch (get())
9396  {
9397  // EOF
9398  case std::char_traits<char>::eof():
9399  {
9400  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(110, chars_read, "unexpected end of input"));
9401  }
9402 
9403  // positive fixint
9404  case 0x00:
9405  case 0x01:
9406  case 0x02:
9407  case 0x03:
9408  case 0x04:
9409  case 0x05:
9410  case 0x06:
9411  case 0x07:
9412  case 0x08:
9413  case 0x09:
9414  case 0x0a:
9415  case 0x0b:
9416  case 0x0c:
9417  case 0x0d:
9418  case 0x0e:
9419  case 0x0f:
9420  case 0x10:
9421  case 0x11:
9422  case 0x12:
9423  case 0x13:
9424  case 0x14:
9425  case 0x15:
9426  case 0x16:
9427  case 0x17:
9428  case 0x18:
9429  case 0x19:
9430  case 0x1a:
9431  case 0x1b:
9432  case 0x1c:
9433  case 0x1d:
9434  case 0x1e:
9435  case 0x1f:
9436  case 0x20:
9437  case 0x21:
9438  case 0x22:
9439  case 0x23:
9440  case 0x24:
9441  case 0x25:
9442  case 0x26:
9443  case 0x27:
9444  case 0x28:
9445  case 0x29:
9446  case 0x2a:
9447  case 0x2b:
9448  case 0x2c:
9449  case 0x2d:
9450  case 0x2e:
9451  case 0x2f:
9452  case 0x30:
9453  case 0x31:
9454  case 0x32:
9455  case 0x33:
9456  case 0x34:
9457  case 0x35:
9458  case 0x36:
9459  case 0x37:
9460  case 0x38:
9461  case 0x39:
9462  case 0x3a:
9463  case 0x3b:
9464  case 0x3c:
9465  case 0x3d:
9466  case 0x3e:
9467  case 0x3f:
9468  case 0x40:
9469  case 0x41:
9470  case 0x42:
9471  case 0x43:
9472  case 0x44:
9473  case 0x45:
9474  case 0x46:
9475  case 0x47:
9476  case 0x48:
9477  case 0x49:
9478  case 0x4a:
9479  case 0x4b:
9480  case 0x4c:
9481  case 0x4d:
9482  case 0x4e:
9483  case 0x4f:
9484  case 0x50:
9485  case 0x51:
9486  case 0x52:
9487  case 0x53:
9488  case 0x54:
9489  case 0x55:
9490  case 0x56:
9491  case 0x57:
9492  case 0x58:
9493  case 0x59:
9494  case 0x5a:
9495  case 0x5b:
9496  case 0x5c:
9497  case 0x5d:
9498  case 0x5e:
9499  case 0x5f:
9500  case 0x60:
9501  case 0x61:
9502  case 0x62:
9503  case 0x63:
9504  case 0x64:
9505  case 0x65:
9506  case 0x66:
9507  case 0x67:
9508  case 0x68:
9509  case 0x69:
9510  case 0x6a:
9511  case 0x6b:
9512  case 0x6c:
9513  case 0x6d:
9514  case 0x6e:
9515  case 0x6f:
9516  case 0x70:
9517  case 0x71:
9518  case 0x72:
9519  case 0x73:
9520  case 0x74:
9521  case 0x75:
9522  case 0x76:
9523  case 0x77:
9524  case 0x78:
9525  case 0x79:
9526  case 0x7a:
9527  case 0x7b:
9528  case 0x7c:
9529  case 0x7d:
9530  case 0x7e:
9531  case 0x7f:
9532  {
9533  return static_cast<number_unsigned_t>(current);
9534  }
9535 
9536  // fixmap
9537  case 0x80:
9538  case 0x81:
9539  case 0x82:
9540  case 0x83:
9541  case 0x84:
9542  case 0x85:
9543  case 0x86:
9544  case 0x87:
9545  case 0x88:
9546  case 0x89:
9547  case 0x8a:
9548  case 0x8b:
9549  case 0x8c:
9550  case 0x8d:
9551  case 0x8e:
9552  case 0x8f:
9553  {
9554  basic_json result = value_t::object;
9555  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(current & 0x0f);
9556  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
9557  {
9558  get();
9559  auto key = get_msgpack_string();
9560  result[key] = parse_msgpack();
9561  }
9562  return result;
9563  }
9564 
9565  // fixarray
9566  case 0x90:
9567  case 0x91:
9568  case 0x92:
9569  case 0x93:
9570  case 0x94:
9571  case 0x95:
9572  case 0x96:
9573  case 0x97:
9574  case 0x98:
9575  case 0x99:
9576  case 0x9a:
9577  case 0x9b:
9578  case 0x9c:
9579  case 0x9d:
9580  case 0x9e:
9581  case 0x9f:
9582  {
9583  basic_json result = value_t::array;
9584  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(current & 0x0f);
9585  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
9586  {
9587  result.push_back(parse_msgpack());
9588  }
9589  return result;
9590  }
9591 
9592  // fixstr
9593  case 0xa0:
9594  case 0xa1:
9595  case 0xa2:
9596  case 0xa3:
9597  case 0xa4:
9598  case 0xa5:
9599  case 0xa6:
9600  case 0xa7:
9601  case 0xa8:
9602  case 0xa9:
9603  case 0xaa:
9604  case 0xab:
9605  case 0xac:
9606  case 0xad:
9607  case 0xae:
9608  case 0xaf:
9609  case 0xb0:
9610  case 0xb1:
9611  case 0xb2:
9612  case 0xb3:
9613  case 0xb4:
9614  case 0xb5:
9615  case 0xb6:
9616  case 0xb7:
9617  case 0xb8:
9618  case 0xb9:
9619  case 0xba:
9620  case 0xbb:
9621  case 0xbc:
9622  case 0xbd:
9623  case 0xbe:
9624  case 0xbf:
9625  {
9626  return get_msgpack_string();
9627  }
9628 
9629  case 0xc0: // nil
9630  {
9631  return value_t::null;
9632  }
9633 
9634  case 0xc2: // false
9635  {
9636  return false;
9637  }
9638 
9639  case 0xc3: // true
9640  {
9641  return true;
9642  }
9643 
9644  case 0xca: // float 32
9645  {
9646  return get_number<float>();
9647  }
9648 
9649  case 0xcb: // float 64
9650  {
9651  return get_number<double>();
9652  }
9653 
9654  case 0xcc: // uint 8
9655  {
9656  return get_number<uint8_t>();
9657  }
9658 
9659  case 0xcd: // uint 16
9660  {
9661  return get_number<uint16_t>();
9662  }
9663 
9664  case 0xce: // uint 32
9665  {
9666  return get_number<uint32_t>();
9667  }
9668 
9669  case 0xcf: // uint 64
9670  {
9671  return get_number<uint64_t>();
9672  }
9673 
9674  case 0xd0: // int 8
9675  {
9676  return get_number<int8_t>();
9677  }
9678 
9679  case 0xd1: // int 16
9680  {
9681  return get_number<int16_t>();
9682  }
9683 
9684  case 0xd2: // int 32
9685  {
9686  return get_number<int32_t>();
9687  }
9688 
9689  case 0xd3: // int 64
9690  {
9691  return get_number<int64_t>();
9692  }
9693 
9694  case 0xd9: // str 8
9695  case 0xda: // str 16
9696  case 0xdb: // str 32
9697  {
9698  return get_msgpack_string();
9699  }
9700 
9701  case 0xdc: // array 16
9702  {
9703  basic_json result = value_t::array;
9704  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint16_t>());
9705  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
9706  {
9707  result.push_back(parse_msgpack());
9708  }
9709  return result;
9710  }
9711 
9712  case 0xdd: // array 32
9713  {
9714  basic_json result = value_t::array;
9715  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint32_t>());
9716  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
9717  {
9718  result.push_back(parse_msgpack());
9719  }
9720  return result;
9721  }
9722 
9723  case 0xde: // map 16
9724  {
9725  basic_json result = value_t::object;
9726  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint16_t>());
9727  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
9728  {
9729  get();
9730  auto key = get_msgpack_string();
9731  result[key] = parse_msgpack();
9732  }
9733  return result;
9734  }
9735 
9736  case 0xdf: // map 32
9737  {
9738  basic_json result = value_t::object;
9739  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint32_t>());
9740  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
9741  {
9742  get();
9743  auto key = get_msgpack_string();
9744  result[key] = parse_msgpack();
9745  }
9746  return result;
9747  }
9748 
9749  // positive fixint
9750  case 0xe0:
9751  case 0xe1:
9752  case 0xe2:
9753  case 0xe3:
9754  case 0xe4:
9755  case 0xe5:
9756  case 0xe6:
9757  case 0xe7:
9758  case 0xe8:
9759  case 0xe9:
9760  case 0xea:
9761  case 0xeb:
9762  case 0xec:
9763  case 0xed:
9764  case 0xee:
9765  case 0xef:
9766  case 0xf0:
9767  case 0xf1:
9768  case 0xf2:
9769  case 0xf3:
9770  case 0xf4:
9771  case 0xf5:
9772  case 0xf6:
9773  case 0xf7:
9774  case 0xf8:
9775  case 0xf9:
9776  case 0xfa:
9777  case 0xfb:
9778  case 0xfc:
9779  case 0xfd:
9780  case 0xfe:
9781  case 0xff:
9782  {
9783  return static_cast<int8_t>(current);
9784  }
9785 
9786  default: // anything else
9787  {
9788  std::stringstream ss;
9789  ss << std::setw(2) << std::setfill('0') << std::hex << current;
9790  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(112, chars_read, "error reading MessagePack; last byte: 0x" + ss.str()));
9791  }
9792  }
9793  }
9794 
9802  static bool little_endianess() noexcept
9803  {
9804  int num = 1;
9805  return (*reinterpret_cast<char*>(&num) == 1);
9806  }
9807 
9808  private:
9818  int get()
9819  {
9820  ++chars_read;
9821  return (current = ia->get_character());
9822  }
9823 
9824  /*
9825  @brief read a number from the input
9826 
9827  @tparam T the type of the number
9828 
9829  @return number of type @a T
9830 
9831  @note This function needs to respect the system's endianess, because
9832  bytes in CBOR and MessagePack are stored in network order (big
9833  endian) and therefore need reordering on little endian systems.
9834 
9835  @throw parse_error.110 if input has less than `sizeof(T)` bytes
9836  */
9837  template<typename T>
9838  T get_number()
9839  {
9840  // step 1: read input into array with system's byte order
9841  std::array<uint8_t, sizeof(T)> vec;
9842  for (size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(T); ++i)
9843  {
9844  get();
9845  check_eof();
9846 
9847  // reverse byte order prior to conversion if necessary
9848  if (is_little_endian)
9849  {
9850  vec[sizeof(T) - i - 1] = static_cast<uint8_t>(current);
9851  }
9852  else
9853  {
9854  vec[i] = static_cast<uint8_t>(current);
9855  }
9856  }
9857 
9858  // step 2: convert array into number of type T and return
9859  T result;
9860  std::memcpy(&result, vec.data(), sizeof(T));
9861  return result;
9862  }
9863 
9873  std::string get_string(const size_t len)
9874  {
9875  std::string result;
9876  for (size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
9877  {
9878  get();
9879  check_eof();
9880  result.append(1, static_cast<char>(current));
9881  }
9882  return result;
9883  }
9884 
9897  std::string get_cbor_string()
9898  {
9899  check_eof();
9900 
9901  switch (current)
9902  {
9903  // UTF-8 string (0x00..0x17 bytes follow)
9904  case 0x60:
9905  case 0x61:
9906  case 0x62:
9907  case 0x63:
9908  case 0x64:
9909  case 0x65:
9910  case 0x66:
9911  case 0x67:
9912  case 0x68:
9913  case 0x69:
9914  case 0x6a:
9915  case 0x6b:
9916  case 0x6c:
9917  case 0x6d:
9918  case 0x6e:
9919  case 0x6f:
9920  case 0x70:
9921  case 0x71:
9922  case 0x72:
9923  case 0x73:
9924  case 0x74:
9925  case 0x75:
9926  case 0x76:
9927  case 0x77:
9928  {
9929  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(current & 0x1f);
9930  return get_string(len);
9931  }
9932 
9933  case 0x78: // UTF-8 string (one-byte uint8_t for n follows)
9934  {
9935  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint8_t>());
9936  return get_string(len);
9937  }
9938 
9939  case 0x79: // UTF-8 string (two-byte uint16_t for n follow)
9940  {
9941  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint16_t>());
9942  return get_string(len);
9943  }
9944 
9945  case 0x7a: // UTF-8 string (four-byte uint32_t for n follow)
9946  {
9947  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint32_t>());
9948  return get_string(len);
9949  }
9950 
9951  case 0x7b: // UTF-8 string (eight-byte uint64_t for n follow)
9952  {
9953  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint64_t>());
9954  return get_string(len);
9955  }
9956 
9957  case 0x7f: // UTF-8 string (indefinite length)
9958  {
9959  std::string result;
9960  while (get() != 0xff)
9961  {
9962  check_eof();
9963  result.append(1, static_cast<char>(current));
9964  }
9965  return result;
9966  }
9967 
9968  default:
9969  {
9970  std::stringstream ss;
9971  ss << std::setw(2) << std::setfill('0') << std::hex << current;
9972  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(113, chars_read, "expected a CBOR string; last byte: 0x" + ss.str()));
9973  }
9974  }
9975  }
9976 
9988  std::string get_msgpack_string()
9989  {
9990  check_eof();
9991 
9992  switch (current)
9993  {
9994  // fixstr
9995  case 0xa0:
9996  case 0xa1:
9997  case 0xa2:
9998  case 0xa3:
9999  case 0xa4:
10000  case 0xa5:
10001  case 0xa6:
10002  case 0xa7:
10003  case 0xa8:
10004  case 0xa9:
10005  case 0xaa:
10006  case 0xab:
10007  case 0xac:
10008  case 0xad:
10009  case 0xae:
10010  case 0xaf:
10011  case 0xb0:
10012  case 0xb1:
10013  case 0xb2:
10014  case 0xb3:
10015  case 0xb4:
10016  case 0xb5:
10017  case 0xb6:
10018  case 0xb7:
10019  case 0xb8:
10020  case 0xb9:
10021  case 0xba:
10022  case 0xbb:
10023  case 0xbc:
10024  case 0xbd:
10025  case 0xbe:
10026  case 0xbf:
10027  {
10028  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(current & 0x1f);
10029  return get_string(len);
10030  }
10031 
10032  case 0xd9: // str 8
10033  {
10034  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint8_t>());
10035  return get_string(len);
10036  }
10037 
10038  case 0xda: // str 16
10039  {
10040  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint16_t>());
10041  return get_string(len);
10042  }
10043 
10044  case 0xdb: // str 32
10045  {
10046  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint32_t>());
10047  return get_string(len);
10048  }
10049 
10050  default:
10051  {
10052  std::stringstream ss;
10053  ss << std::setw(2) << std::setfill('0') << std::hex << current;
10054  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(113, chars_read, "expected a MessagePack string; last byte: 0x" + ss.str()));
10055  }
10056  }
10057  }
10058
