10063  void check_eof() const
10064  {
10065  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(current == std::char_traits<char>::eof()))
10066  {
10067  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(110, chars_read, "unexpected end of input"));
10068  }
10069  }
10070 
10071  private:
10073  input_adapter_t ia = nullptr;
10074 
10076  int current = std::char_traits<char>::eof();
10077 
10079  size_t chars_read = 0;
10080 
10082  const bool is_little_endian = true;
10083  };
10084 
10088  class binary_writer
10089  {
10090  public:
10096  explicit binary_writer(output_adapter_t<uint8_t> adapter)
10097  : is_little_endian(binary_reader::little_endianess()), oa(adapter)
10098  {
10099  assert(oa);
10100  }
10101 
10105  void write_cbor(const basic_json& j)
10106  {
10107  switch (j.type())
10108  {
10109  case value_t::null:
10110  {
10111  oa->write_character(0xf6);
10112  break;
10113  }
10114 
10115  case value_t::boolean:
10116  {
10117  oa->write_character(j.m_value.boolean ? 0xf5 : 0xf4);
10118  break;
10119  }
10120 
10121  case value_t::number_integer:
10122  {
10123  if (j.m_value.number_integer >= 0)
10124  {
10125  // CBOR does not differentiate between positive signed
10126  // integers and unsigned integers. Therefore, we used the
10127  // code from the value_t::number_unsigned case here.
10128  if (j.m_value.number_integer <= 0x17)
10129  {
10130  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
10131  }
10132  else if (j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
10133  {
10134  oa->write_character(0x18);
10135  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
10136  }
10137  else if (j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
10138  {
10139  oa->write_character(0x19);
10140  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
10141  }
10142  else if (j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
10143  {
10144  oa->write_character(0x1a);
10145  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
10146  }
10147  else
10148  {
10149  oa->write_character(0x1b);
10150  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
10151  }
10152  }
10153  else
10154  {
10155  // The conversions below encode the sign in the first
10156  // byte, and the value is converted to a positive number.
10157  const auto positive_number = -1 - j.m_value.number_integer;
10158  if (j.m_value.number_integer >= -24)
10159  {
10160  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x20 + positive_number));
10161  }
10162  else if (positive_number <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
10163  {
10164  oa->write_character(0x38);
10165  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(positive_number));
10166  }
10167  else if (positive_number <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
10168  {
10169  oa->write_character(0x39);
10170  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(positive_number));
10171  }
10172  else if (positive_number <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
10173  {
10174  oa->write_character(0x3a);
10175  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(positive_number));
10176  }
10177  else
10178  {
10179  oa->write_character(0x3b);
10180  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(positive_number));
10181  }
10182  }
10183  break;
10184  }
10185 
10186  case value_t::number_unsigned:
10187  {
10188  if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= 0x17)
10189  {
10190  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
10191  }
10192  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
10193  {
10194  oa->write_character(0x18);
10195  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
10196  }
10197  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
10198  {
10199  oa->write_character(0x19);
10200  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
10201  }
10202  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
10203  {
10204  oa->write_character(0x1a);
10205  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
10206  }
10207  else
10208  {
10209  oa->write_character(0x1b);
10210  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
10211  }
10212  break;
10213  }
10214 
10215  case value_t::number_float:
10216  {
10217  // Double-Precision Float
10218  oa->write_character(0xfb);
10219  write_number(j.m_value.number_float);
10220  break;
10221  }
10222 
10223  case value_t::string:
10224  {
10225  // step 1: write control byte and the string length
10226  const auto N = j.m_value.string->size();
10227  if (N <= 0x17)
10228  {
10229  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x60 + N));
10230  }
10231  else if (N <= 0xff)
10232  {
10233  oa->write_character(0x78);
10234  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(N));
10235  }
10236  else if (N <= 0xffff)
10237  {
10238  oa->write_character(0x79);
10239  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
10240  }
10241  else if (N <= 0xffffffff)
10242  {
10243  oa->write_character(0x7a);
10244  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
10245  }
10246  // LCOV_EXCL_START
10247  else if (N <= 0xffffffffffffffff)
10248  {
10249  oa->write_character(0x7b);
10250  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(N));
10251  }
10252  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
10253 
10254  // step 2: write the string
10255  oa->write_characters(reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t*>(j.m_value.string->c_str()),
10256  j.m_value.string->size());
10257  break;
10258  }
10259 
10260  case value_t::array:
10261  {
10262  // step 1: write control byte and the array size
10263  const auto N = j.m_value.array->size();
10264  if (N <= 0x17)
10265  {
10266  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x80 + N));
10267  }
10268  else if (N <= 0xff)
10269  {
10270  oa->write_character(0x98);
10271  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(N));
10272  }
10273  else if (N <= 0xffff)
10274  {
10275  oa->write_character(0x99);
10276  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
10277  }
10278  else if (N <= 0xffffffff)
10279  {
10280  oa->write_character(0x9a);
10281  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
10282  }
10283  // LCOV_EXCL_START
10284  else if (N <= 0xffffffffffffffff)
10285  {
10286  oa->write_character(0x9b);
10287  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(N));
10288  }
10289  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
10290 
10291  // step 2: write each element
10292  for (const auto& el : *j.m_value.array)
10293  {
10294  write_cbor(el);
10295  }
10296  break;
10297  }
10298 
10299  case value_t::object:
10300  {
10301  // step 1: write control byte and the object size
10302  const auto N = j.m_value.object->size();
10303  if (N <= 0x17)
10304  {
10305  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0xa0 + N));
10306  }
10307  else if (N <= 0xff)
10308  {
10309  oa->write_character(0xb8);
10310  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(N));
10311  }
10312  else if (N <= 0xffff)
10313  {
10314  oa->write_character(0xb9);
10315  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
10316  }
10317  else if (N <= 0xffffffff)
10318  {
10319  oa->write_character(0xba);
10320  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
10321  }
10322  // LCOV_EXCL_START
10323  else if (N <= 0xffffffffffffffff)
10324  {
10325  oa->write_character(0xbb);
10326  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(N));
10327  }
10328  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
10329 
10330  // step 2: write each element
10331  for (const auto& el : *j.m_value.object)
10332  {
10333  write_cbor(el.first);
10334  write_cbor(el.second);
10335  }
10336  break;
10337  }
10338 
10339  default:
10340  {
10341  break;
10342  }
10343  }
10344  }
10345 
10349  void write_msgpack(const basic_json& j)
10350  {
10351  switch (j.type())
10352  {
10353  case value_t::null:
10354  {
10355  // nil
10356  oa->write_character(0xc0);
10357  break;
10358  }
10359 
10360  case value_t::boolean:
10361  {
10362  // true and false
10363  oa->write_character(j.m_value.boolean ? 0xc3 : 0xc2);
10364  break;
10365  }
10366 
10367  case value_t::number_integer:
10368  {
10369  if (j.m_value.number_integer >= 0)
10370  {
10371  // MessagePack does not differentiate between positive
10372  // signed integers and unsigned integers. Therefore, we
10373  // used the code from the value_t::number_unsigned case
10374  // here.
10375  if (j.m_value.number_unsigned < 128)
10376  {
10377  // positive fixnum
10378  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
10379  }
10380  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
10381  {
10382  // uint 8
10383  oa->write_character(0xcc);
10384  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
10385  }
10386  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
10387  {
10388  // uint 16
10389  oa->write_character(0xcd);
10390  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
10391  }
10392  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
10393  {
10394  // uint 32
10395  oa->write_character(0xce);
10396  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
10397  }
10398  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint64_t>::max)())
10399  {
10400  // uint 64
10401  oa->write_character(0xcf);
10402  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
10403  }
10404  }
10405  else
10406  {
10407  if (j.m_value.number_integer >= -32)
10408  {
10409  // negative fixnum
10410  write_number(static_cast<int8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
10411  }
10412  else if (j.m_value.number_integer >= (std::numeric_limits<int8_t>::min)() and j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<int8_t>::max)())
10413  {
10414  // int 8
10415  oa->write_character(0xd0);
10416  write_number(static_cast<int8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
10417  }
10418  else if (j.m_value.number_integer >= (std::numeric_limits<int16_t>::min)() and j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<int16_t>::max)())
10419  {
10420  // int 16
10421  oa->write_character(0xd1);
10422  write_number(static_cast<int16_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
10423  }
10424  else if (j.m_value.number_integer >= (std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::min)() and j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::max)())
10425  {
10426  // int 32
10427  oa->write_character(0xd2);
10428  write_number(static_cast<int32_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
10429  }
10430  else if (j.m_value.number_integer >= (std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::min)() and j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::max)())
10431  {
10432  // int 64
10433  oa->write_character(0xd3);
10434  write_number(static_cast<int64_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
10435  }
10436  }
10437  break;
10438  }
10439 
10440  case value_t::number_unsigned:
10441  {
10442  if (j.m_value.number_unsigned < 128)
10443  {
10444  // positive fixnum
10445  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
10446  }
10447  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
10448  {
10449  // uint 8
10450  oa->write_character(0xcc);
10451  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
10452  }
10453  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
10454  {
10455  // uint 16
10456  oa->write_character(0xcd);
10457  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
10458  }
10459  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
10460  {
10461  // uint 32
10462  oa->write_character(0xce);
10463  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
10464  }
10465  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint64_t>::max)())
10466  {
10467  // uint 64
10468  oa->write_character(0xcf);
10469  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
10470  }
10471  break;
10472  }
10473 
10474  case value_t::number_float:
10475  {
10476  // float 64
10477  oa->write_character(0xcb);
10478  write_number(j.m_value.number_float);
10479  break;
10480  }
10481 
10482  case value_t::string:
10483  {
10484  // step 1: write control byte and the string length
10485  const auto N = j.m_value.string->size();
10486  if (N <= 31)
10487  {
10488  // fixstr
10489  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0xa0 | N));
10490  }
10491  else if (N <= 255)
10492  {
10493  // str 8
10494  oa->write_character(0xd9);
10495  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(N));
10496  }
10497  else if (N <= 65535)
10498  {
10499  // str 16
10500  oa->write_character(0xda);
10501  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
10502  }
10503  else if (N <= 4294967295)
10504  {
10505  // str 32
10506  oa->write_character(0xdb);
10507  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
10508  }
10509 
10510  // step 2: write the string
10511  oa->write_characters(reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t*>(j.m_value.string->c_str()),
10512  j.m_value.string->size());
10513  break;
10514  }
10515 
10516  case value_t::array:
10517  {
10518  // step 1: write control byte and the array size
10519  const auto N = j.m_value.array->size();
10520  if (N <= 15)
10521  {
10522  // fixarray
10523  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x90 | N));
10524  }
10525  else if (N <= 0xffff)
10526  {
10527  // array 16
10528  oa->write_character(0xdc);
10529  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
10530  }
10531  else if (N <= 0xffffffff)
10532  {
10533  // array 32
10534  oa->write_character(0xdd);
10535  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
10536  }
10537 
10538  // step 2: write each element
10539  for (const auto& el : *j.m_value.array)
10540  {
10541  write_msgpack(el);
10542  }
10543  break;
10544  }
10545 
10546  case value_t::object:
10547  {
10548  // step 1: write control byte and the object size
10549  const auto N = j.m_value.object->size();
10550  if (N <= 15)
10551  {
10552  // fixmap
10553  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x80 | (N & 0xf)));
10554  }
10555  else if (N <= 65535)
10556  {
10557  // map 16
10558  oa->write_character(0xde);
10559  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
10560  }
10561  else if (N <= 4294967295)
10562  {
10563  // map 32
10564  oa->write_character(0xdf);
10565  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
10566  }
10567 
10568  // step 2: write each element
10569  for (const auto& el : *j.m_value.object)
10570  {
10571  write_msgpack(el.first);
10572  write_msgpack(el.second);
10573  }
10574  break;
10575  }
10576 
10577  default:
10578  {
10579  break;
10580  }
10581  }
10582  }
10583 
10584  private:
10585  /*
10586  @brief write a number to output input
10587 
10588  @param[in] n number of type @a T
10589  @tparam T the type of the number
10590 
10591  @note This function needs to respect the system's endianess, because
10592  bytes in CBOR and MessagePack are stored in network order (big
10593  endian) and therefore need reordering on little endian systems.
10594  */
10595  template<typename T>
10596  void write_number(T n)
10597  {
10598  // step 1: write number to array of length T
10599  std::array<uint8_t, sizeof(T)> vec;
10600  std::memcpy(vec.data(), &n, sizeof(T));
10601 
10602  // step 2: write array to output (with possible reordering)
10603  for (size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(T); ++i)
10604  {
10605  // reverse byte order prior to conversion if necessary
10606  if (is_little_endian)
10607  {
10608  oa->write_character(vec[sizeof(T) - i - 1]);
10609  }
10610  else
10611  {
10612  oa->write_character(vec[i]);
10613  }
10614  }
10615  }
10616 
10617  private:
10619  const bool is_little_endian = true;
10620 
10622  output_adapter_t<uint8_t> oa = nullptr;
10623  };
10624 
10625  public:
10708  static std::vector<uint8_t> to_cbor(const basic_json& j)
10709  {
10710  std::vector<uint8_t> result;
10711  binary_writer bw(output_adapter<uint8_t>::create(result));
10712  bw.write_cbor(j);
10713  return result;
10714  }
10715 
10790  static std::vector<uint8_t> to_msgpack(const basic_json& j)
10791  {
10792  std::vector<uint8_t> result;
10793  binary_writer bw(output_adapter<uint8_t>::create(result));
10794  bw.write_msgpack(j);
10795  return result;
10796  }
10797 
10885  static basic_json from_cbor(const std::vector<uint8_t>& v,
10886  const size_t start_index = 0)
10887  {
10888  binary_reader br(input_adapter::create(v.begin() + static_cast<difference_type>(start_index), v.end()));
10889  return br.parse_cbor();
10890  }
10891 
10892 
10960  static basic_json from_msgpack(const std::vector<uint8_t>& v,
10961  const size_t start_index = 0)
10962  {
10963  binary_reader br(input_adapter::create(v.begin() + static_cast<difference_type>(start_index), v.end()));
10964  return br.parse_msgpack();
10965  }
10966 
10968 
10970  // lexer and parser //
10972 
10973  private:
10979  class lexer
10980  {
10981  public:
10983  enum class token_type
10984  {
10985  uninitialized,
10986  literal_true,
10987  literal_false,
10988  literal_null,
10989  value_string,
10990  value_unsigned,
10991  value_integer,
10992  value_float,
10993  begin_array,
10994  begin_object,
10995  end_array,
10996  end_object,
10997  name_separator,
10998  value_separator,
10999  parse_error,
11000  end_of_input
11001  };
11002 
11004  static const char* token_type_name(const token_type t) noexcept
11005  {
11006  switch (t)
11007  {
11008  case token_type::uninitialized:
11009  return "<uninitialized>";
11010  case token_type::literal_true:
11011  return "true literal";
11012  case token_type::literal_false:
11013  return "false literal";
11014  case token_type::literal_null:
11015  return "null literal";
11016  case token_type::value_string:
11017  return "string literal";
11018  case lexer::token_type::value_unsigned:
11019  case lexer::token_type::value_integer:
11020  case lexer::token_type::value_float:
11021  return "number literal";
11022  case token_type::begin_array:
11023  return "'['";
11024  case token_type::begin_object:
11025  return "'{'";
11026  case token_type::end_array:
11027  return "']'";
11028  case token_type::end_object:
11029  return "'}'";
11030  case token_type::name_separator:
11031  return "':'";
11032  case token_type::value_separator:
11033  return "','";
11034  case token_type::parse_error:
11035  return "<parse error>";
11036  case token_type::end_of_input:
11037  return "end of input";
11038  default:
11039  {
11040  // catch non-enum values
11041  return "unknown token"; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
11042  }
11043  }
11044  }
11045 
11046  explicit lexer(input_adapter_t adapter)
11047  : ia(adapter), decimal_point_char(get_decimal_point())
11048  {}
11049 
11050  private:
11052  // locales
11054 
11056  static char get_decimal_point() noexcept
11057  {
11058  const auto loc = localeconv();
11059  assert(loc != nullptr);
11060  return (loc->decimal_point == nullptr) ? '.' : loc->decimal_point[0];
11061  }
11062 
11064  // scan functions
11066 
11073  int get_codepoint()
11074  {
11075  // this function only makes sense after reading `\u`
11076  assert(current == 'u');
11077  int codepoint = 0;
11078 
11079  // byte 1: \uXxxx
11080  switch (get())
11081  {
11082  case '0':
11083  break;
11084  case '1':
11085  codepoint += 0x1000;
11086  break;
11087  case '2':
11088  codepoint += 0x2000;
11089  break;
11090  case '3':
11091  codepoint += 0x3000;
11092  break;
11093  case '4':
11094  codepoint += 0x4000;
11095  break;
11096  case '5':
11097  codepoint += 0x5000;
11098  break;
11099  case '6':
11100  codepoint += 0x6000;
11101  break;
11102  case '7':
11103  codepoint += 0x7000;
11104  break;
11105  case '8':
11106  codepoint += 0x8000;
11107  break;
11108  case '9':
11109  codepoint += 0x9000;
11110  break;
11111  case 'A':
11112  case 'a':
11113  codepoint += 0xa000;
11114  break;
11115  case 'B':
11116  case 'b':
11117  codepoint += 0xb000;
11118  break;
11119  case 'C':
11120  case 'c':
11121  codepoint += 0xc000;
11122  break;
11123  case 'D':
11124  case 'd':
11125  codepoint += 0xd000;
11126  break;
11127  case 'E':
11128  case 'e':
11129  codepoint += 0xe000;
11130  break;
11131  case 'F':
11132  case 'f':
11133  codepoint += 0xf000;
11134  break;
11135  default:
11136  return -1;
11137  }
11138 
11139  // byte 2: \uxXxx
11140  switch (get())
11141  {
11142  case '0':
11143  break;
11144  case '1':
11145  codepoint += 0x0100;
11146  break;
11147  case '2':
11148  codepoint += 0x0200;
11149  break;
11150  case '3':
11151  codepoint += 0x0300;
11152  break;
11153  case '4':
11154  codepoint += 0x0400;
11155  break;
11156  case '5':
11157  codepoint += 0x0500;
11158  break;
11159  case '6':
11160  codepoint += 0x0600;
11161  break;
11162  case '7':
11163  codepoint += 0x0700;
11164  break;
11165  case '8':
11166  codepoint += 0x0800;
11167  break;
11168  case '9':
11169  codepoint += 0x0900;
11170  break;
11171  case 'A':
11172  case 'a':
11173  codepoint += 0x0a00;
11174  break;
11175  case 'B':
11176  case 'b':
11177  codepoint += 0x0b00;
11178  break;
11179  case 'C':
11180  case 'c':
11181  codepoint += 0x0c00;
11182  break;
11183  case 'D':
11184  case 'd':
11185  codepoint += 0x0d00;
11186  break;
11187  case 'E':
11188  case 'e':
11189  codepoint += 0x0e00;
11190  break;
11191  case 'F':
11192  case 'f':
11193  codepoint += 0x0f00;
11194  break;
11195  default:
11196  return -1;
11197  }
11198 
11199  // byte 3: \uxxXx
11200  switch (get())
11201  {
11202  case '0':
11203  break;
11204  case '1':
11205  codepoint += 0x0010;
11206  break;
11207  case '2':
11208  codepoint += 0x0020;
11209  break;
11210  case '3':
11211  codepoint += 0x0030;
11212  break;
11213  case '4':
11214  codepoint += 0x0040;
11215  break;
11216  case '5':
11217  codepoint += 0x0050;
11218  break;
11219  case '6':
11220  codepoint += 0x0060;
11221  break;
11222  case '7':
11223  codepoint += 0x0070;
11224  break;
11225  case '8':
11226  codepoint += 0x0080;
11227  break;
11228  case '9':
11229  codepoint += 0x0090;
11230  break;
11231  case 'A':
11232  case 'a':
11233  codepoint += 0x00a0;
11234  break;
11235  case 'B':
11236  case 'b':
11237  codepoint += 0x00b0;
11238  break;
11239  case 'C':
11240  case 'c':
11241  codepoint += 0x00c0;
11242  break;
11243  case 'D':
11244  case 'd':
11245  codepoint += 0x00d0;
11246  break;
11247  case 'E':
11248  case 'e':
11249  codepoint += 0x00e0;
11250  break;
11251  case 'F':
11252  case 'f':
11253  codepoint += 0x00f0;
11254  break;
11255  default:
11256  return -1;
11257  }
11258 
11259  // byte 4: \uxxxX
11260  switch (get())
11261  {
11262  case '0':
11263  break;
11264  case '1':
11265  codepoint += 0x0001;
11266  break;
11267  case '2':
11268  codepoint += 0x0002;
11269  break;
11270  case '3':
11271  codepoint += 0x0003;
11272  break;
11273  case '4':
11274  codepoint += 0x0004;
11275  break;
11276  case '5':
11277  codepoint += 0x0005;
11278  break;
11279  case '6':
11280  codepoint += 0x0006;
11281  break;
11282  case '7':
11283  codepoint += 0x0007;
11284  break;
11285  case '8':
11286  codepoint += 0x0008;
11287  break;
11288  case '9':
11289  codepoint += 0x0009;
11290  break;
11291  case 'A':
11292  case 'a':
11293  codepoint += 0x000a;
11294  break;
11295  case 'B':
11296  case 'b':
11297  codepoint += 0x000b;
11298  break;
11299  case 'C':
11300  case 'c':
11301  codepoint += 0x000c;
11302  break;
11303  case 'D':
11304  case 'd':
11305  codepoint += 0x000d;
11306  break;
11307  case 'E':
11308  case 'e':
11309  codepoint += 0x000e;
11310  break;
11311  case 'F':
11312  case 'f':
11313  codepoint += 0x000f;
11314  break;
11315  default:
11316  return -1;
11317  }
11318 
11319  return codepoint;
11320  }
11321 
11326  static std::string codepoint_to_string(int codepoint)
11327  {
11328  std::stringstream ss;
11329  ss << "U+" << std::setw(4) << std::uppercase << std::setfill('0') << std::hex << codepoint;
11330  return ss.str();
11331  }
11332 
11347  token_type scan_string()
11348  {
11349  // reset yytext (ignore opening quote)
11350  reset();
11351 
11352  // we entered the function by reading an open quote
11353  assert(current == '\"');
11354 
11355  while (true)
11356  {
11357  // get next character
11358  get();
11359 
11360  switch (current)
11361  {
11362  // end of file while parsing string
11363  case std::char_traits<char>::eof():
11364  {
11365  error_message = "invalid string: missing closing quote";
11366  return token_type::parse_error;
11367  }
11368 
11369  // closing quote
11370  case '\"':
11371  {
11372  // terminate yytext
11373  add('\0');
11374  --yylen;
11375  return token_type::value_string;
11376  }
11377 
11378  // escapes
11379  case '\\':
11380  {
11381  switch (get())
11382  {
11383  // quotation mark
11384  case '\"':
11385  add('\"');
11386  break;
11387  // reverse solidus
11388  case '\\':
11389  add('\\');
11390  break;
11391  // solidus
11392  case '/':
11393  add('/');
11394  break;
11395  // backspace
11396  case 'b':
11397  add('\b');
11398  break;
11399  // form feed
11400  case 'f':
11401  add('\f');
11402  break;
11403  // line feed
11404  case 'n':
11405  add('\n');
11406  break;
11407  // carriage return
11408  case 'r':
11409  add('\r');
11410  break;
11411  // tab
11412  case 't':
11413  add('\t');
11414  break;
11415 
11416  // unicode escapes
11417  case 'u':
11418  {
11419  int codepoint;
11420  int codepoint1 = get_codepoint();
11421 
11422  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(codepoint1 == -1))
11423  {
11424  error_message = "invalid string: '\\u' must be followed by 4 hex digits";
11425  return token_type::parse_error;
11426  }
11427 
11428  // check if code point is a high surrogate
11429  if (0xD800 <= codepoint1 and codepoint1 <= 0xDBFF)
11430  {
11431  // expect next \uxxxx entry
11432  if (JSON_LIKELY(get() == '\\' and get() == 'u'))
11433  {
11434  const int codepoint2 = get_codepoint();
11435 
11436  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(codepoint2 == -1))
11437  {
11438  error_message = "invalid string: '\\u' must be followed by 4 hex digits";
11439  return token_type::parse_error;
11440  }
11441 
11442  // check if codepoint2 is a low surrogate
11443  if (JSON_LIKELY(0xDC00 <= codepoint2 and codepoint2 <= 0xDFFF))
11444  {
11445  codepoint =
11446  // high surrogate occupies the most significant 22 bits
11447  (codepoint1 << 10)
11448  // low surrogate occupies the least significant 15 bits
11449  + codepoint2
11450  // there is still the 0xD800, 0xDC00 and 0x10000 noise
11451  // in the result so we have to subtract with:
11452  // (0xD800 << 10) + DC00 - 0x10000 = 0x35FDC00
11453  - 0x35FDC00;
11454  }
11455  else
11456  {
11457  error_message = "invalid string: surrogate " + codepoint_to_string(codepoint1) + " must be followed by U+DC00..U+DFFF instead of " + codepoint_to_string(codepoint2);
11458  return token_type::parse_error;
11459  }
11460  }
11461  else
11462  {
11463  error_message = "invalid string: surrogate " + codepoint_to_string(codepoint1) + " must be followed by U+DC00..U+DFFF";
11464  return token_type::parse_error;
11465  }
11466  }
11467  else
11468  {
11469  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(0xDC00 <= codepoint1 and codepoint1 <= 0xDFFF))
11470  {
11471  error_message = "invalid string: surrogate " + codepoint_to_string(codepoint1) + " must follow U+D800..U+DBFF";
11472  return token_type::parse_error;
11473  }
11474 
11475  // only work with first code point
11476  codepoint = codepoint1;
11477  }
11478 
11479  // result of the above calculation yields a proper codepoint
11480  assert(0x00 <= codepoint and codepoint <= 0x10FFFF);
11481 
11482  // translate code point to bytes
11483  if (codepoint < 0x80)
11484  {
11485  // 1-byte characters: 0xxxxxxx (ASCII)
11486  add(codepoint);
11487  }
11488  else if (codepoint <= 0x7ff)
11489  {
11490  // 2-byte characters: 110xxxxx 10xxxxxx
11491  add(0xC0 | (codepoint >> 6));
11492  add(0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F));
11493  }
11494  else if (codepoint <= 0xffff)
11495  {
11496  // 3-byte characters: 1110xxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx
11497  add(0xE0 | (codepoint >> 12));
11498  add(0x80 | ((codepoint >> 6) & 0x3F));
11499  add(0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F));
11500  }
11501  else
11502  {
11503  // 4-byte characters: 11110xxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx
11504  add(0xF0 | (codepoint >> 18));
11505  add(0x80 | ((codepoint >> 12) & 0x3F));
11506  add(0x80 | ((codepoint >> 6) & 0x3F));
11507  add(0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F));
11508  }
11509 
11510  break;
11511  }
11512 
11513  // other characters after escape
11514  default:
11515  error_message = "invalid string: forbidden character after backslash";
11516  return token_type::parse_error;
11517  }
11518 
11519  break;
11520  }
11521 
11522  // invalid control characters
11523  case 0x00:
11524  case 0x01:
11525  case 0x02:
11526  case 0x03:
11527  case 0x04:
11528  case 0x05:
11529  case 0x06:
11530  case 0x07:
11531  case 0x08:
11532  case 0x09:
11533  case 0x0a:
11534  case 0x0b:
11535  case 0x0c:
11536  case 0x0d:
11537  case 0x0e:
11538  case 0x0f:
11539  case 0x10:
11540  case 0x11:
11541  case 0x12:
11542  case 0x13:
11543  case 0x14:
11544  case 0x15:
11545  case 0x16:
11546  case 0x17:
11547  case 0x18:
11548  case 0x19:
11549  case 0x1a:
11550  case 0x1b:
11551  case 0x1c:
11552  case 0x1d:
11553  case 0x1e:
11554  case 0x1f:
11555  {
11556  error_message = "invalid string: control character " + codepoint_to_string(current) + " must be escaped";
11557  return token_type::parse_error;
11558  }
11559 
11560  // U+0020..U+007F (except U+0022 (quote) and U+005C (backspace))
11561  case 0x20:
11562  case 0x21:
11563  case 0x23:
11564  case 0x24:
11565  case 0x25:
11566  case 0x26:
11567  case 0x27:
11568  case 0x28:
11569  case 0x29:
11570  case 0x2a:
11571  case 0x2b:
11572  case 0x2c:
11573  case 0x2d:
11574  case 0x2e:
11575  case 0x2f:
11576  case 0x30:
11577  case 0x31:
11578  case 0x32:
11579  case 0x33:
11580  case 0x34:
11581  case 0x35:
11582  case 0x36:
11583  case 0x37:
11584  case 0x38:
11585  case 0x39:
11586  case 0x3a:
11587  case 0x3b:
11588  case 0x3c:
11589  case 0x3d:
11590  case 0x3e:
11591  case 0x3f:
11592  case 0x40:
11593  case 0x41:
11594  case 0x42:
11595  case 0x43:
11596  case 0x44:
11597  case 0x45:
11598  case 0x46:
11599  case 0x47:
11600  case 0x48:
11601  case 0x49:
11602  case 0x4a:
11603  case 0x4b:
11604  case 0x4c:
11605  case 0x4d:
11606  case 0x4e:
11607  case 0x4f:
11608  case 0x50:
11609  case 0x51:
11610  case 0x52:
11611  case 0x53:
11612  case 0x54:
11613  case 0x55:
11614  case 0x56:
11615  case 0x57:
11616  case 0x58:
11617  case 0x59:
11618  case 0x5a:
11619  case 0x5b:
11620  case 0x5d:
11621  case 0x5e:
11622  case 0x5f:
11623  case 0x60:
11624  case 0x61:
11625  case 0x62:
11626  case 0x63:
11627  case 0x64:
11628  case 0x65:
11629  case 0x66:
11630  case 0x67:
11631  case 0x68:
11632  case 0x69:
11633  case 0x6a:
11634  case 0x6b:
11635  case 0x6c:
11636  case 0x6d:
11637  case 0x6e:
11638  case 0x6f:
11639  case 0x70:
11640  case 0x71:
11641  case 0x72:
11642  case 0x73:
11643  case 0x74:
11644  case 0x75:
11645  case 0x76:
11646  case 0x77:
11647  case 0x78:
11648  case 0x79:
11649  case 0x7a:
11650  case 0x7b:
11651  case 0x7c:
11652  case 0x7d:
11653  case 0x7e:
11654  case 0x7f:
11655  {
11656  add(current);
11657  break;
11658  }
11659 
11660  // U+0080..U+07FF: bytes C2..DF 80..BF
11661  case 0xc2:
11662  case 0xc3:
11663  case 0xc4:
11664  case 0xc5:
11665  case 0xc6:
11666  case 0xc7:
11667  case 0xc8:
11668  case 0xc9:
11669  case 0xca:
11670  case 0xcb:
11671  case 0xcc:
11672  case 0xcd:
11673  case 0xce:
11674  case 0xcf:
11675  case 0xd0:
11676  case 0xd1:
11677  case 0xd2:
11678  case 0xd3:
11679  case 0xd4:
11680  case 0xd5:
11681  case 0xd6:
11682  case 0xd7:
11683  case 0xd8:
11684  case 0xd9:
11685  case 0xda:
11686  case 0xdb:
11687  case 0xdc:
11688  case 0xdd:
11689  case 0xde:
11690  case 0xdf:
11691  {
11692  add(current);
11693  get();
11694  if (JSON_LIKELY(0x80 <= current and current <= 0xbf))
11695  {
11696  add(current);
11697  continue;
11698  }
11699 
11700  error_message = "invalid string: ill-formed UTF-8 byte";
11701  return token_type::parse_error;
11702  }
11703 
11704  // U+0800..U+0FFF: bytes E0 A0..BF 80..BF
11705  case 0xe0:
11706  {
11707  add(current);
11708  get();
11709  if (JSON_LIKELY(0xa0 <= current and current <= 0xbf))
11710  {
11711  add(current);
11712  get();
11713  if (JSON_LIKELY(0x80 <= current and current <= 0xbf))
11714  {
11715  add(current);
11716  continue;
11717  }
11718  }
11719 
11720  error_message = "invalid string: ill-formed UTF-8 byte";
11721  return token_type::parse_error;
11722  }
11723 
11724  // U+1000..U+CFFF: bytes E1..EC 80..BF 80..BF
11725  // U+E000..U+FFFF: bytes EE..EF 80..BF 80..BF
11726  case 0xe1:
11727  case 0xe2:
11728  case 0xe3:
11729  case 0xe4:
11730  case 0xe5:
11731  case 0xe6:
11732  case 0xe7:
11733  case 0xe8:
11734  case 0xe9:
11735  case 0xea:
11736  case 0xeb:
11737  case 0xec:
11738  case 0xee:
11739  case 0xef:
11740  {
11741  add(current);
11742  get();
11743  if (JSON_LIKELY(0x80 <= current and current <= 0xbf))
11744  {
11745  add(current);
11746  get();
11747  if (JSON_LIKELY(0x80 <= current and current <= 0xbf))
11748  {
11749  add(current);
11750  continue;
11751  }
11752  }
11753 
11754  error_message = "invalid string: ill-formed UTF-8 byte";
11755  return token_type::parse_error;
11756  }
11757 
11758  // U+D000..U+D7FF: bytes ED 80..9F 80..BF
11759  case 0xed:
11760  {
11761  add(current);
11762  get();
11763  if (JSON_LIKELY(0x80 <= current and current <= 0x9f))
11764  {
11765  add(current);
11766  get();
11767  if (JSON_LIKELY(0x80 <= current and current <= 0xbf))
11768  {
11769  add(current);
11770  continue;
11771  }
11772  }
11773 
11774  error_message = "invalid string: ill-formed UTF-8 byte";
11775  return token_type::parse_error;
11776  }
11777 
11778  // U+10000..U+3FFFF F0 90..BF 80..BF 80..BF
11779  case 0xf0:
11780  {
11781  add(current);
11782  get();
11783  if (JSON_LIKELY(0x90 <= current and current <= 0xbf))
11784  {
11785  add(current);
11786  get();
11787  if (JSON_LIKELY(0x80 <= current and current <= 0xbf))
11788  {
11789  add(current);
11790  get();
11791  if (JSON_LIKELY(0x80 <= current and current <= 0xbf))
11792  {
11793  add(current);
11794  continue;
11795  }
11796  }
11797  }
11798 
11799  error_message = "invalid string: ill-formed UTF-8 byte";
11800  return token_type::parse_error;
11801  }
11802 
11803  // U+40000..U+FFFFF F1..F3 80..BF 80..BF 80..BF
11804  case 0xf1:
11805  case 0xf2:
11806  case 0xf3:
11807  {
11808  add(current);
11809  get();
11810  if (JSON_LIKELY(0x80 <= current and current <= 0xbf))
11811  {
11812  add(current);
11813  get();
11814  if (JSON_LIKELY(0x80 <= current and current <= 0xbf))
11815  {
11816  add(current);
11817  get();
11818  if (JSON_LIKELY(0x80 <= current and current <= 0xbf))
11819  {
11820  add(current);
11821  continue;
11822  }
11823  }
11824  }
11825 
11826  error_message = "invalid string: ill-formed UTF-8 byte";
11827  return token_type::parse_error;
11828  }
11829 
11830  // U+100000..U+10FFFF F4 80..8F 80..BF 80..BF
11831  case 0xf4:
11832  {
11833  add(current);
11834  get();
11835  if (JSON_LIKELY(0x80 <= current and current <= 0x8f))
11836  {
11837  add(current);
11838  get();
11839  if (JSON_LIKELY(0x80 <= current and current <= 0xbf))
11840  {
11841  add(current);
11842  get();
11843  if (JSON_LIKELY(0x80 <= current and current <= 0xbf))
11844  {
11845  add(current);
11846  continue;
11847  }
11848  }
11849  }
11850 
11851  error_message = "invalid string: ill-formed UTF-8 byte";
11852  return token_type::parse_error;
11853  }
11854 
11855  // remaining bytes (80..C1 and F5..FF) are ill-formed
11856  default:
11857  {
11858  error_message = "invalid string: ill-formed UTF-8 byte";
11859  return token_type::parse_error;
11860  }
11861  }
11862  }
11863  }
11864 
11865  static void strtof(float& f, const char* str, char** endptr) noexcept
11866  {
11867  f = std::strtof(str, endptr);
11868  }
11869 
11870  static void strtof(double& f, const char* str, char** endptr) noexcept
11871  {
11872  f = std::strtod(str, endptr);
11873  }
11874 
11875  static void strtof(long double& f, const char* str, char** endptr) noexcept
11876  {
11877  f = std::strtold(str, endptr);
11878  }
11879 
11921  token_type scan_number() // lgtm [cpp/use-of-goto]
11922  {
11923  // reset yytext to store the number's bytes
11924  reset();
11925 
11926  // the type of the parsed number; initially set to unsigned; will be
11927  // changed if minus sign, decimal point or exponent is read
11928  token_type number_type = token_type::value_unsigned;
11929 
11930  // state (init): we just found out we need to scan a number
11931  switch (current)
11932  {
11933  case '-':
11934  {
11935  add(current);
11936  goto scan_number_minus;
11937  }
11938 
11939  case '0':
11940  {
11941  add(current);
11942  goto scan_number_zero;
11943  }
11944 
11945  case '1':
11946  case '2':
11947  case '3':
11948  case '4':
11949  case '5':
11950  case '6':
11951  case '7':
11952  case '8':
11953  case '9':
11954  {
11955  add(current);
11956  goto scan_number_any1;
11957  }
11958 
11959  default:
11960  {
11961  // all other characters are rejected outside scan_number()
11962  assert(false); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
11963  }
11964  }
11965 
11966 scan_number_minus:
11967  // state: we just parsed a leading minus sign
11968  number_type = token_type::value_integer;
11969  switch (get())
11970  {
11971  case '0':
11972  {
11973  add(current);
11974  goto scan_number_zero;
11975  }
11976 
11977  case '1':
11978  case '2':
11979  case '3':
11980  case '4':
11981  case '5':
11982  case '6':
11983  case '7':
11984  case '8':
11985  case '9':
11986  {
11987  add(current);
11988  goto scan_number_any1;
11989  }
11990 
11991  default:
11992  {
11993  error_message = "invalid number; expected digit after '-'";
11994  return token_type::parse_error;
11995  }
11996  }
11997 
11998 scan_number_zero:
11999  // state: we just parse a zero (maybe with a leading minus sign)
12000  switch (get())
12001  {
12002  case '.':
12003  {
12004  add(decimal_point_char);
12005  goto scan_number_decimal1;
12006  }
12007 
12008  case 'e':
12009  case 'E':
12010  {
12011  add(current);
12012  goto scan_number_exponent;
12013  }
12014 
12015  default:
12016  {
12017  goto scan_number_done;
12018  }
12019  }
12020 
12021 scan_number_any1:
12022  // state: we just parsed a number 0-9 (maybe with a leading minus sign)
12023  switch (get())
12024  {
12025  case '0':
12026  case '1':
12027  case '2':
12028  case '3':
12029  case '4':
12030  case '5':
12031  case '6':
12032  case '7':
12033  case '8':
12034  case '9':
12035  {
12036  add(current);
12037  goto scan_number_any1;
12038  }
12039 
12040  case '.':
12041  {
12042  add(decimal_point_char);
12043  goto scan_number_decimal1;
12044  }
12045 
12046  case 'e':
12047  case 'E':
12048  {
12049  add(current);
12050  goto scan_number_exponent;
12051  }
12052 
12053  default:
12054  {
12055  goto scan_number_done;
12056  }
12057  }
12058 
12059 scan_number_decimal1:
12060  // state: we just parsed a decimal point
12061  number_type = token_type::value_float;
12062  switch (get())
12063  {
12064  case '0':
12065  case '1':
12066  case '2':
12067  case '3':
12068  case '4':
12069  case '5':
12070  case '6':
12071  case '7':
12072  case '8':
12073  case '9':
12074  {
12075  add(current);
12076  goto scan_number_decimal2;
12077  }
12078 
12079  default:
12080  {
12081  error_message = "invalid number; expected digit after '.'";
12082  return token_type::parse_error;
12083  }
12084  }
12085 
12086 scan_number_decimal2:
12087  // we just parsed at least one number after a decimal point
12088  switch (get())
12089  {
12090  case '0':
12091  case '1':
12092  case '2':
12093  case '3':
12094  case '4':
12095  case '5':
12096  case '6':
12097  case '7':
12098  case '8':
12099  case '9':
12100  {
12101  add(current);
12102  goto scan_number_decimal2;
12103  }
12104 
12105  case 'e':
12106  case 'E':
12107  {
12108  add(current);
12109  goto scan_number_exponent;
12110  }
12111 
12112  default:
12113  {
12114  goto scan_number_done;
12115  }
12116  }
12117 
12118 scan_number_exponent:
12119  // we just parsed an exponent
12120  number_type = token_type::value_float;
12121  switch (get())
12122  {
12123  case '+':
12124  case '-':
12125  {
12126  add(current);
12127  goto scan_number_sign;
12128  }
12129 
12130  case '0':
12131  case '1':
12132  case '2':
12133  case '3':
12134  case '4':
12135  case '5':
12136  case '6':
12137  case '7':
12138  case '8':
12139  case '9':
12140  {
12141  add(current);
12142  goto scan_number_any2;
12143  }
12144 
12145  default:
12146  {
12147  error_message = "invalid number; expected '+', '-', or digit after exponent";
12148  return token_type::parse_error;
12149  }
12150  }
12151 
12152 scan_number_sign:
12153  // we just parsed an exponent sign
12154  switch (get())
12155  {
12156  case '0':
12157  case '1':
12158  case '2':
12159  case '3':
12160  case '4':
12161  case '5':
12162  case '6':
12163  case '7':
12164  case '8':
12165  case '9':
12166  {
12167  add(current);
12168  goto scan_number_any2;
12169  }
12170 
12171  default:
12172  {
12173  error_message = "invalid number; expected digit after exponent sign";
12174  return token_type::parse_error;
12175  }
12176  }
12177 
12178 scan_number_any2:
12179  // we just parsed a number after the exponent or exponent sign
12180  switch (get())
12181  {
12182  case '0':
12183  case '1':
12184  case '2':
12185  case '3':
12186  case '4':
12187  case '5':
12188  case '6':
12189  case '7':
12190  case '8':
12191  case '9':
12192  {
12193  add(current);
12194  goto scan_number_any2;
12195  }
12196 
12197  default:
12198  {
12199  goto scan_number_done;
12200  }
12201  }
12202 
12203 scan_number_done:
12204  // unget the character after the number (we only read it to know
12205  // that we are done scanning a number)
12206  --chars_read;
12207  next_unget = true;
12208 
12209  // terminate token
12210  add('\0');
12211  --yylen;
12212 
12213  // try to parse integers first and fall back to floats
12214  if (number_type == token_type::value_unsigned)
12215  {
12216  char* endptr = nullptr;
12217  errno = 0;
12218  const auto x = std::strtoull(yytext.data(), &endptr, 10);
12219 
12220  // we checked the number format before
12221  assert(endptr == yytext.data() + yylen);
12222 
12223  if (errno == 0)
12224  {
12225  value_unsigned = static_cast<number_unsigned_t>(x);
12226  if (value_unsigned == x)
12227  {
12228  return token_type::value_unsigned;
12229  }
12230  }
12231  }
12232  else if (number_type == token_type::value_integer)
12233  {
12234  char* endptr = nullptr;
12235  errno = 0;
12236  const auto x = std::strtoll(yytext.data(), &endptr, 10);
12237 
12238  // we checked the number format before
12239  assert(endptr == yytext.data() + yylen);
12240 
12241  if (errno == 0)
12242  {
12243  value_integer = static_cast<number_integer_t>(x);
12244  if (value_integer == x)
12245  {
12246  return token_type::value_integer;
12247  }
12248  }
12249  }
12250 
12251  // this code is reached if we parse a floating-point number or if
12252  // an integer conversion above failed
12253  strtof(value_float, yytext.data(), nullptr);
12254  return token_type::value_float;
12255  }
12256 
12257  token_type scan_true()
12258  {
12259  assert(current == 't');
12260  if (JSON_LIKELY((get() == 'r' and get() == 'u' and get() == 'e')))
12261  {
12262  return token_type::literal_true;
12263  }
12264 
12265  error_message = "invalid literal; expected 'true'";
12266  return token_type::parse_error;
12267  }
12268 
12269  token_type scan_false()
12270  {
12271  assert(current == 'f');
12272  if (JSON_LIKELY((get() == 'a' and get() == 'l' and get() == 's' and get() == 'e')))
12273  {
12274  return token_type::literal_false;
12275  }
12276 
12277  error_message = "invalid literal; expected 'false'";
12278  return token_type::parse_error;
12279  }
12280 
12281  token_type scan_null()
12282  {
12283  assert(current == 'n');
12284  if (JSON_LIKELY((get() == 'u' and get() == 'l' and get() == 'l')))
12285  {
12286  return token_type::literal_null;
12287  }
12288 
12289  error_message = "invalid literal; expected 'null'";
12290  return token_type::parse_error;
12291  }
12292 
12294  // input management
12296 
12298  void reset() noexcept
12299  {
12300  yylen = 0;
12301  start_pos = chars_read - 1;
12302  }
12303 
12305  int get()
12306  {
12307  ++chars_read;
12308  return next_unget
12309  ? (next_unget = false, current)
12310  : (current = ia->get_character());
12311  }
12312 
12314  void add(int c)
12315  {
12316  // resize yytext if necessary; this condition is deemed unlikely,
12317  // because we start with a 1024-byte buffer
12318  if (JSON_UNLIKELY((yylen + 1 > yytext.capacity())))
12319  {
12320  yytext.resize(2 * yytext.capacity(), '\0');
12321  }
12322  yytext[yylen++] = static_cast<char>(c);
12323  }
12324 
12325  public:
12327  // value getters
12329 
12331  constexpr number_integer_t get_number_integer() const noexcept
12332  {
12333  return value_integer;
12334  }
12335 
12337  constexpr number_unsigned_t get_number_unsigned() const noexcept
12338  {
12339  return value_unsigned;
12340  }
12341 
12343  constexpr number_float_t get_number_float() const noexcept
12344  {
12345  return value_float;
12346  }
12347 
12349  const std::string get_string()
12350  {
12351  // yytext cannot be returned as char*, because it may contain a
12352  // null byte (parsed as "\u0000")
12353  return std::string(yytext.data(), yylen);
12354  }
12355 
12357  // diagnostics
12359 
12361  constexpr size_t get_position() const noexcept
12362  {
12363  return chars_read;
12364  }
12365 
12367  std::string get_token_string() const
12368  {
12369  // get the raw byte sequence of the last token
12370  std::string s = ia->read(start_pos, chars_read - start_pos);
12371 
12372  // escape control characters
12373  std::string result;
12374  for (auto c : s)
12375  {
12376  if (c == '\0' or c == std::char_traits<char>::eof())
12377  {
12378  // ignore EOF
12379  continue;
12380  }
12381  else if ('\x00' <= c and c <= '\x1f')
12382  {
12383  // escape control characters
12384  result += "<" + codepoint_to_string(c) + ">";
12385  }
12386  else
12387  {
12388  // add character as is
12389  result.append(1, c);
12390  }
12391  }
12392 
12393  return result;
12394  }
12395 
12397  const std::string& get_error_message() const noexcept
12398  {
12399  return error_message;
12400  }
12401 
12403  // actual scanner
12405 
12406  token_type scan()
12407  {
12408  // read next character and ignore whitespace
12409  do
12410  {
12411  get();
12412  }
12413  while (current == ' ' or current == '\t' or current == '\n' or current == '\r');
12414 
12415  switch (current)
12416  {
12417  // structural characters
12418  case '[':
12419  return token_type::begin_array;
12420  case ']':
12421  return token_type::end_array;
12422  case '{':
12423  return token_type::begin_object;
12424  case '}':
12425  return token_type::end_object;
12426  case ':':
12427  return token_type::name_separator;
12428  case ',':
12429  return token_type::value_separator;
12430 
12431  // literals
12432  case 't':
12433  return scan_true();
12434  case 'f':
12435  return scan_false();
12436  case 'n':
12437  return scan_null();
12438 
12439  // string
12440  case '\"':
12441  return scan_string();
12442 
12443  // number
12444  case '-':
12445  case '0':
12446  case '1':
12447  case '2':
12448  case '3':
12449  case '4':
12450  case '5':
12451  case '6':
12452  case '7':
12453  case '8':
12454  case '9':
12455  return scan_number();
12456 
12457  // end of input (the null byte is needed when parsing from
12458  // string literals)
12459  case '\0':
12460  case std::char_traits<char>::eof():
12461  return token_type::end_of_input;
12462 
12463  // error
12464  default:
12465  error_message = "invalid literal";
12466  return token_type::parse_error;
12467  }
12468  }
12469 
12470  private:
12472  input_adapter_t ia = nullptr;
12473 
12475  int current = std::char_traits<char>::eof();
12476 
12478  bool next_unget = false;
12479 
12481  size_t chars_read = 0;
12483  size_t start_pos = 0;
12484 
12486  std::vector<char> yytext = std::vector<char>(1024, '\0');
12488  size_t yylen = 0;
12489 
12491  std::string error_message = "";
12492 
12493  // number values
12494  number_integer_t value_integer = 0;
12495  number_unsigned_t value_unsigned = 0;
12496  number_float_t value_float = 0;
12497 
12499  const char decimal_point_char = '.';
12500  };
12501 
12507  class parser
12508  {
12509  public:
12511  explicit parser(input_adapter_t adapter,
12512  const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr)
12513  : callback(cb), m_lexer(adapter)
12514  {}
12515 
12526  basic_json parse(const bool strict = true)
12527  {
12528  // read first token
12529  get_token();
12530 
12531  basic_json result = parse_internal(true);
12532  result.assert_invariant();
12533 
12534  if (strict)
12535  {
12536  get_token();
12537  expect(lexer::token_type::end_of_input);
12538  }
12539 
12540  // return parser result and replace it with null in case the
12541  // top-level value was discarded by the callback function
12542  return result.is_discarded() ? basic_json() : std::move(result);
12543  }
12544 
12551  bool accept(const bool strict = true)
12552  {
12553  // read first token
12554  get_token();
12555 
12556  if (not accept_internal())
12557  {
12558  return false;
12559  }
12560 
12561  if (strict and get_token() != lexer::token_type::end_of_input)
12562  {
12563  return false;
12564  }
12565 
12566  return true;
12567  }
12568 
12569  private:
12576  basic_json parse_internal(bool keep)
12577  {
12578  auto result = basic_json(value_t::discarded);
12579 
12580  switch (last_token)
12581  {
12582  case lexer::token_type::begin_object:
12583  {
12584  if (keep and (not callback
12585  or ((keep = callback(depth++, parse_event_t::object_start, result)) != 0)))
12586  {
12587  // explicitly set result to object to cope with {}
12588  result.m_type = value_t::object;
12589  result.m_value = value_t::object;
12590  }
12591 
12592  // read next token
12593  get_token();
12594 
12595  // closing } -> we are done
12596  if (last_token == lexer::token_type::end_object)
12597  {
12598  if (keep and callback and not callback(--depth, parse_event_t::object_end, result))
12599  {
12600  result = basic_json(value_t::discarded);
12601  }
12602  return result;
12603  }
12604 
12605  // parse values
12606  while (true)
12607  {
12608  // store key
12609  expect(lexer::token_type::value_string);
12610  const auto key = m_lexer.get_string();
12611 
12612  bool keep_tag = false;
12613  if (keep)
12614  {
12615  if (callback)
12616  {
12617  basic_json k(key);
12618  keep_tag = callback(depth, parse_event_t::key, k);
12619  }
12620  else
12621  {
12622  keep_tag = true;
12623  }
12624  }
12625 
12626  // parse separator (:)
12627  get_token();
12628  expect(lexer::token_type::name_separator);
12629 
12630  // parse and add value
12631  get_token();
12632  auto value = parse_internal(keep);
12633  if (keep and keep_tag and not value.is_discarded())
12634  {
12635  result[key] = std::move(value);
12636  }
12637 
12638  // comma -> next value
12639  get_token();
12640  if (last_token == lexer::token_type::value_separator)
12641  {
12642  get_token();
12643  continue;
12644  }
12645 
12646  // closing }
12647  expect(lexer::token_type::end_object);
12648  break;
12649  }
12650 
12651  if (keep and callback and not callback(--depth, parse_event_t::object_end, result))
12652  {
12653  result = basic_json(value_t::discarded);
12654  }
12655 
12656  return result;
12657  }
12658 
12659  case lexer::token_type::begin_array:
12660  {
12661  if (keep and (not callback
12662  or ((keep = callback(depth++, parse_event_t::array_start, result)) != 0)))
12663  {
12664  // explicitly set result to object to cope with []
12665  result.m_type = value_t::array;
12666  result.m_value = value_t::array;
12667  }
12668 
12669  // read next token
12670  get_token();
12671 
12672  // closing ] -> we are done
12673  if (last_token == lexer::token_type::end_array)
12674  {
12675  if (callback and not callback(--depth, parse_event_t::array_end, result))
12676  {
12677  result = basic_json(value_t::discarded);
12678  }
12679  return result;
12680  }
12681 
12682  // parse values
12683  while (true)
12684  {
12685  // parse value
12686  auto value = parse_internal(keep);
12687  if (keep and not value.is_discarded())
12688  {
12689  result.push_back(std::move(value));
12690  }
12691 
12692  // comma -> next value
12693  get_token();
12694  if (last_token == lexer::token_type::value_separator)
12695  {
12696  get_token();
12697  continue;
12698  }
12699 
12700  // closing ]
12701  expect(lexer::token_type::end_array);
12702  break;
12703  }
12704 
12705  if (keep and callback and not callback(--depth, parse_event_t::array_end, result))
12706  {
12707  result = basic_json(value_t::discarded);
12708  }
12709 
12710  return result;
12711  }
12712 
12713  case lexer::token_type::literal_null:
12714  {
12715  result.m_type = value_t::null;
12716  break;
12717  }
12718 
12719  case lexer::token_type::value_string:
12720  {
12721  result = basic_json(m_lexer.get_string());
12722  break;
12723  }
12724 
12725  case lexer::token_type::literal_true:
12726  {
12727  result.m_type = value_t::boolean;
12728  result.m_value = true;
12729  break;
12730  }
12731 
12732  case lexer::token_type::literal_false:
12733  {
12734  result.m_type = value_t::boolean;
12735  result.m_value = false;
12736  break;
12737  }
12738 
12739  case lexer::token_type::value_unsigned:
12740  {
12741  result.m_type = value_t::number_unsigned;
12742  result.m_value = m_lexer.get_number_unsigned();
12743  break;
12744  }
12745 
12746  case lexer::token_type::value_integer:
12747  {
12748  result.m_type = value_t::number_integer;
12749  result.m_value = m_lexer.get_number_integer();
12750  break;
12751  }
12752 
12753  case lexer::token_type::value_float:
12754  {
12755  result.m_type = value_t::number_float;
12756  result.m_value = m_lexer.get_number_float();
12757 
12758  // throw in case of infinity or NAN
12759  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not std::isfinite(result.m_value.number_float)))
12760  {
12761  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(406, "number overflow parsing '" + m_lexer.get_token_string() + "'"));
12762  }
12763 
12764  break;
12765  }
12766 
12767  default:
12768  {
12769  // the last token was unexpected
12770  unexpect(last_token);
12771  }
12772  }
12773 
12774  if (keep and callback and not callback(depth, parse_event_t::value, result))
12775  {
12776  result = basic_json(value_t::discarded);
12777  }
12778  return result;
12779  }
12780 
12792  bool accept_internal()
12793  {
12794  switch (last_token)
12795  {
12796  case lexer::token_type::begin_object:
12797  {
12798  // read next token
12799  get_token();
12800 
12801  // closing } -> we are done
12802  if (last_token == lexer::token_type::end_object)
12803  {
12804  return true;
12805  }
12806 
12807  // parse values
12808  while (true)
12809  {
12810  // parse key
12811  if (last_token != lexer::token_type::value_string)
12812  {
12813  return false;
12814  }
12815 
12816  // parse separator (:)
12817  get_token();
12818  if (last_token != lexer::token_type::name_separator)
12819  {
12820  return false;
12821  }
12822 
12823  // parse value
12824  get_token();
12825  if (not accept_internal())
12826  {
12827  return false;
12828  }
12829 
12830  // comma -> next value
12831  get_token();
12832  if (last_token == lexer::token_type::value_separator)
12833  {
12834  get_token();
12835  continue;
12836  }
12837 
12838  // closing }
12839  if (last_token != lexer::token_type::end_object)
12840  {
12841  return false;
12842  }
12843 
12844  return true;
12845  }
12846  }
12847 
12848  case lexer::token_type::begin_array:
12849  {
12850  // read next token
12851  get_token();
12852 
12853  // closing ] -> we are done
12854  if (last_token == lexer::token_type::end_array)
12855  {
12856  return true;
12857  }
12858 
12859  // parse values
12860  while (true)
12861  {
12862  // parse value
12863  if (not accept_internal())
12864  {
12865  return false;
12866  }
12867 
12868  // comma -> next value
12869  get_token();
12870  if (last_token == lexer::token_type::value_separator)
12871  {
12872  get_token();
12873  continue;
12874  }
12875 
12876  // closing ]
12877  if (last_token != lexer::token_type::end_array)
12878  {
12879  return false;
12880  }
12881 
12882  return true;
12883  }
12884  }
12885 
12886  case lexer::token_type::literal_false:
12887  case lexer::token_type::literal_null:
12888  case lexer::token_type::literal_true:
12889  case lexer::token_type::value_float:
12890  case lexer::token_type::value_integer:
12891  case lexer::token_type::value_string:
12892  case lexer::token_type::value_unsigned:
12893  {
12894  return true;
12895  }
12896 
12897  default:
12898  {
12899  // the last token was unexpected
12900  return false;
12901  }
12902  }
12903  }
12904 
12906  typename lexer::token_type get_token()
12907  {
12908  last_token = m_lexer.scan();
12909  return last_token;
12910  }
12911 
12915  void expect(typename lexer::token_type t) const
12916  {
12917  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(t != last_token))
12918  {
12919  std::string error_msg = "syntax error - ";
12920  if (last_token == lexer::token_type::parse_error)
12921  {
12922  error_msg += m_lexer.get_error_message() + "; last read: '" + m_lexer.get_token_string() + "'";
12923  }
12924  else
12925  {
12926  error_msg += "unexpected " + std::string(lexer::token_type_name(last_token));
12927  }
12928 
12929  error_msg += "; expected " + std::string(lexer::token_type_name(t));
12930  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(101, m_lexer.get_position(), error_msg));
12931  }
12932  }
12933 
12937  void unexpect(typename lexer::token_type t) const
12938  {
12939  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(t == last_token))
12940  {
12941  std::string error_msg = "syntax error - ";
12942  if (last_token == lexer::token_type::parse_error)
12943  {
12944  error_msg += m_lexer.get_error_message() + "; last read '" + m_lexer.get_token_string() + "'";
12945  }
12946  else
12947  {
12948  error_msg += "unexpected " + std::string(lexer::token_type_name(last_token));
12949  }
12950 
12951  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(101, m_lexer.get_position(), error_msg));
12952  }
12953  }
12954 
12955  private:
12957  int depth = 0;
12959  const parser_callback_t callback = nullptr;
12961  typename lexer::token_type last_token = lexer::token_type::uninitialized;
12963  lexer m_lexer;
12964  };
12965 
12966  public:
12978  class json_pointer
12979  {
12981  friend class basic_json;
12982 
12983  public:
13006  explicit json_pointer(const std::string& s = "")
13007  : reference_tokens(split(s))
13008  {}
13009 
13025  std::string to_string() const noexcept
13026  {
13027  return std::accumulate(reference_tokens.begin(),
13028  reference_tokens.end(), std::string{},
13029  [](const std::string & a, const std::string & b)
13030  {
13031  return a + "/" + escape(b);
13032  });
13033  }
13034 
13036  operator std::string() const
13037  {
13038  return to_string();
13039  }
13040 
13041  private:
13046  std::string pop_back()
13047  {
13048  if (is_root())
13049  {
13050  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(405, "JSON pointer has no parent"));
13051  }
13052 
13053  auto last = reference_tokens.back();
13054  reference_tokens.pop_back();
13055  return last;
13056  }
13057 
13059  bool is_root() const
13060  {
13061  return reference_tokens.empty();
13062  }
13063 
13064  json_pointer top() const
13065  {
13066  if (is_root())
13067  {
13068  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(405, "JSON pointer has no parent"));
13069  }
13070 
13071  json_pointer result = *this;
13072  result.reference_tokens = {reference_tokens[0]};
13073  return result;
13074  }
13075 
13084  reference get_and_create(reference j) const
13085  {
13086  pointer result = &j;
13087 
13088  // in case no reference tokens exist, return a reference to the
13089  // JSON value j which will be overwritten by a primitive value
13090  for (const auto& reference_token : reference_tokens)
13091  {
13092  switch (result->m_type)
13093  {
13094  case value_t::null:
13095  {
13096  if (reference_token == "0")
13097  {
13098  // start a new array if reference token is 0
13099  result = &result->operator[](0);
13100  }
13101  else
13102  {
13103  // start a new object otherwise
13104  result = &result->operator[](reference_token);
13105  }
13106  break;
13107  }
13108 
13109  case value_t::object:
13110  {
13111  // create an entry in the object
13112  result = &result->operator[](reference_token);
13113  break;
13114  }
13115 
13116  case value_t::array:
13117  {
13118  // create an entry in the array
13119  JSON_TRY
13120  {
13121  result = &result->operator[](static_cast<size_type>(std::stoi(reference_token)));
13122  }
13123  JSON_CATCH (std::invalid_argument&)
13124  {
13125  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(109, 0, "array index '" + reference_token + "' is not a number"));
13126  }
13127  break;
13128  }
13129 
13130  /*
13131  The following code is only reached if there exists a
13132  reference token _and_ the current value is primitive. In
13133  this case, we have an error situation, because primitive
13134  values may only occur as single value; that is, with an
13135  empty list of reference tokens.
13136  */
13137  default:
13138  {
13139  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(313, "invalid value to unflatten"));
13140  }
13141  }
13142  }
13143 
13144  return *result;
13145  }
13146 
13166  reference get_unchecked(pointer ptr) const
13167  {
13168  for (const auto& reference_token : reference_tokens)
13169  {
13170  // convert null values to arrays or objects before continuing
13171  if (ptr->m_type == value_t::null)
13172  {
13173  // check if reference token is a number
13174  const bool nums = std::all_of(reference_token.begin(),
13175  reference_token.end(),
13176  [](const char x)
13177  {
13178  return (x >= '0' and x <= '9');
13179  });
13180 
13181  // change value to array for numbers or "-" or to object
13182  // otherwise
13183  if (nums or reference_token == "-")
13184  {
13185  *ptr = value_t::array;
13186  }
13187  else
13188  {
13189  *ptr = value_t::object;
13190  }
13191  }
13192 
13193  switch (ptr->m_type)
13194  {
13195  case value_t::object:
13196  {
13197  // use unchecked object access
13198  ptr = &ptr->operator[](reference_token);
13199  break;
13200  }
13201 
13202  case value_t::array:
13203  {
13204  // error condition (cf. RFC 6901, Sect. 4)
13205  if (reference_token.size() > 1 and reference_token[0] == '0')
13206  {
13207  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(106, 0, "array index '" + reference_token + "' must not begin with '0'"));
13208  }
13209 
13210  if (reference_token == "-")
13211  {
13212  // explicitly treat "-" as index beyond the end
13213  ptr = &ptr->operator[](ptr->m_value.array->size());
13214  }
13215  else
13216  {
13217  // convert array index to number; unchecked access
13218  JSON_TRY
13219  {
13220  ptr = &ptr->operator[](static_cast<size_type>(std::stoi(reference_token)));
13221  }
13222  JSON_CATCH (std::invalid_argument&)
13223  {
13224  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(109, 0, "array index '" + reference_token + "' is not a number"));
13225  }
13226  }
13227  break;
13228  }
13229 
13230  default:
13231  {
13232  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(404, "unresolved reference token '" + reference_token + "'"));
13233  }
13234  }
13235  }
13236 
13237  return *ptr;
13238  }
13239 
13246  reference get_checked(pointer ptr) const
13247  {
13248  for (const auto& reference_token : reference_tokens)
13249  {
13250  switch (ptr->m_type)
13251  {
13252  case value_t::object:
13253  {
13254  // note: at performs range check
13255  ptr = &ptr->at(reference_token);
13256  break;
13257  }
13258 
13259  case value_t::array:
13260  {
13261  if (reference_token == "-")
13262  {
13263  // "-" always fails the range check
13264  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(402, "array index '-' (" +
13265  std::to_string(ptr->m_value.array->size()) +
13266  ") is out of range"));
13267  }
13268 
13269  // error condition (cf. RFC 6901, Sect. 4)
13270  if (reference_token.size() > 1 and reference_token[0] == '0')
13271  {
13272  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(106, 0, "array index '" + reference_token + "' must not begin with '0'"));
13273  }
13274 
13275  // note: at performs range check
13276  JSON_TRY
13277  {
13278  ptr = &ptr->at(static_cast<size_type>(std::stoi(reference_token)));
13279  }
13280  JSON_CATCH (std::invalid_argument&)
13281  {
13282  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(109, 0, "array index '" + reference_token + "' is not a number"));
13283  }
13284  break;
13285  }
13286 
13287  default:
13288  {
13289  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(404, "unresolved reference token '" + reference_token + "'"));
13290  }
13291  }
13292  }
13293 
13294  return *ptr;
13295  }
13296 
13310  const_reference get_unchecked(const_pointer ptr) const
13311  {
13312  for (const auto& reference_token : reference_tokens)
13313  {
13314  switch (ptr->m_type)
13315  {
13316  case value_t::object:
13317  {
13318  // use unchecked object access
13319  ptr = &ptr->operator[](reference_token);
13320  break;
13321  }
13322 
13323  case value_t::array:
13324  {
13325  if (reference_token == "-")
13326  {
13327  // "-" cannot be used for const access
13328  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(402, "array index '-' (" +
13329  std::to_string(ptr->m_value.array->size()) +
13330  ") is out of range"));
13331  }
13332 
13333  // error condition (cf. RFC 6901, Sect. 4)
13334  if (reference_token.size() > 1 and reference_token[0] == '0')
13335  {
13336  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(106, 0, "array index '" + reference_token + "' must not begin with '0'"));
13337  }
13338 
13339  // use unchecked array access
13340  JSON_TRY
13341  {
13342  ptr = &ptr->operator[](static_cast<size_type>(std::stoi(reference_token)));
13343  }
13344  JSON_CATCH (std::invalid_argument&)
13345  {
13346  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(109, 0, "array index '" + reference_token + "' is not a number"));
13347  }
13348  break;
13349  }
13350 
13351  default:
13352  {
13353  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(404, "unresolved reference token '" + reference_token + "'"));
13354  }
13355  }
13356  }
13357 
13358  return *ptr;
13359  }
13360 
13367  const_reference get_checked(const_pointer ptr) const
13368  {
13369  for (const auto& reference_token : reference_tokens)
13370  {
13371  switch (ptr->m_type)
13372  {
13373  case value_t::object:
13374  {
13375  // note: at performs range check
13376  ptr = &ptr->at(reference_token);
13377  break;
13378  }
13379 
13380  case value_t::array:
13381  {
13382  if (reference_token == "-")
13383  {
13384  // "-" always fails the range check
13385  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(402, "array index '-' (" +
13386  std::to_string(ptr->m_value.array->size()) +
13387  ") is out of range"));
13388  }
13389 
13390  // error condition (cf. RFC 6901, Sect. 4)
13391  if (reference_token.size() > 1 and reference_token[0] == '0')
13392  {
13393  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(106, 0, "array index '" + reference_token + "' must not begin with '0'"));
13394  }
13395 
13396  // note: at performs range check
13397  JSON_TRY
13398  {
13399  ptr = &ptr->at(static_cast<size_type>(std::stoi(reference_token)));
13400  }
13401  JSON_CATCH (std::invalid_argument&)
13402  {
13403  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(109, 0, "array index '" + reference_token + "' is not a number"));
13404  }
13405  break;
13406  }
13407 
13408  default:
13409  {
13410  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(404, "unresolved reference token '" + reference_token + "'"));
13411  }
13412  }
13413  }
13414 
13415  return *ptr;
13416  }
13417 
13427  static std::vector<std::string> split(const std::string& reference_string)
13428  {
13429  std::vector<std::string> result;
13430 
13431  // special case: empty reference string -> no reference tokens
13432  if (reference_string.empty())
13433  {
13434  return result;
13435  }
13436 
13437  // check if nonempty reference string begins with slash
13438  if (reference_string[0] != '/')
13439  {
13440  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(107, 1, "JSON pointer must be empty or begin with '/' - was: '" + reference_string + "'"));
13441  }
13442 
13443  // extract the reference tokens:
13444  // - slash: position of the last read slash (or end of string)
13445  // - start: position after the previous slash
13446  for (
13447  // search for the first slash after the first character
13448  size_t slash = reference_string.find_first_of('/', 1),
13449  // set the beginning of the first reference token
13450  start = 1;
13451  // we can stop if start == string::npos+1 = 0
13452  start != 0;
13453  // set the beginning of the next reference token
13454  // (will eventually be 0 if slash == std::string::npos)
13455  start = slash + 1,
13456  // find next slash
13457  slash = reference_string.find_first_of('/', start))
13458  {
13459  // use the text between the beginning of the reference token
13460  // (start) and the last slash (slash).
13461  auto reference_token = reference_string.substr(start, slash - start);
13462 
13463  // check reference tokens are properly escaped
13464  for (size_t pos = reference_token.find_first_of('~');
13465  pos != std::string::npos;
13466  pos = reference_token.find_first_of('~', pos + 1))
13467  {
13468  assert(reference_token[pos] == '~');
13469 
13470  // ~ must be followed by 0 or 1
13471  if (pos == reference_token.size() - 1 or
13472  (reference_token[pos + 1] != '0' and
13473  reference_token[pos + 1] != '1'))
13474  {
13475  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(108, 0, "escape character '~' must be followed with '0' or '1'"));
13476  }
13477  }
13478 
13479  // finally, store the reference token
13480  unescape(reference_token);
13481  result.push_back(reference_token);
13482  }
13483 
13484  return result;
13485  }
13486 
13500  static void replace_substring(std::string& s,
13501  const std::string& f,
13502  const std::string& t)
13503  {
13504  assert(not f.empty());
13505 
13506  for (
13507  size_t pos = s.find(f); // find first occurrence of f
13508  pos != std::string::npos; // make sure f was found
13509  s.replace(pos, f.size(), t), // replace with t
13510  pos = s.find(f, pos + t.size()) // find next occurrence of f
13511  );
13512  }
13513 
13515  static std::string escape(std::string s)
13516  {
13517  // escape "~"" to "~0" and "/" to "~1"
13518  replace_substring(s, "~", "~0");
13519  replace_substring(s, "/", "~1");
13520  return s;
13521  }
13522 
13524  static void unescape(std::string& s)
13525  {
13526  // first transform any occurrence of the sequence '~1' to '/'
13527  replace_substring(s, "~1", "/");
13528  // then transform any occurrence of the sequence '~0' to '~'
13529  replace_substring(s, "~0", "~");
13530  }
13531 
13539  static void flatten(const std::string& reference_string,
13540  const basic_json& value,
13541  basic_json& result)
13542  {
13543  switch (value.m_type)
13544  {
13545  case value_t::array:
13546  {
13547  if (value.m_value.array->empty())
13548  {
13549  // flatten empty array as null
13550  result[reference_string] = nullptr;
13551  }
13552  else
13553  {
13554  // iterate array and use index as reference string
13555  for (size_t i = 0; i < value.m_value.array->size(); ++i)
13556  {
13557  flatten(reference_string + "/" + std::to_string(i),
13558  value.m_value.array->operator[](i), result);
13559  }
13560  }
13561  break;
13562  }
13563 
13564  case value_t::object:
13565  {
13566  if (value.m_value.object->empty())
13567  {
13568  // flatten empty object as null
13569  result[reference_string] = nullptr;
13570  }
13571  else
13572  {
13573  // iterate object and use keys as reference string
13574  for (const auto& element : *value.m_value.object)
13575  {
13576  flatten(reference_string + "/" + escape(element.first),
13577  element.second, result);
13578  }
13579  }
13580  break;
13581  }
13582 
13583  default:
13584  {
13585  // add primitive value with its reference string
13586  result[reference_string] = value;
13587  break;
13588  }
13589  }
13590  }
13591 
13602  static basic_json unflatten(const basic_json& value)
13603  {
13604  if (not value.is_object())
13605  {
13606  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(314, "only objects can be unflattened"));
13607  }
13608 
13609  basic_json result;
13610 
13611  // iterate the JSON object values
13612  for (const auto& element : *value.m_value.object)
13613  {
13614  if (not element.second.is_primitive())
13615  {
13616  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(315, "values in object must be primitive"));
13617  }
13618 
13619  // assign value to reference pointed to by JSON pointer; Note
13620  // that if the JSON pointer is "" (i.e., points to the whole
13621  // value), function get_and_create returns a reference to
13622  // result itself. An assignment will then create a primitive
13623  // value.
13624  json_pointer(element.first).get_and_create(result) = element.second;
13625  }
13626 
13627  return result;
13628  }
13629 
13630  friend bool operator==(json_pointer const& lhs,
13631  json_pointer const& rhs) noexcept
13632  {
13633  return lhs.reference_tokens == rhs.reference_tokens;
13634  }
13635 
13636  friend bool operator!=(json_pointer const& lhs,
13637  json_pointer const& rhs) noexcept
13638  {
13639  return !(lhs == rhs);
13640  }
13641 
13643  std::vector<std::string> reference_tokens {};
13644  };
13645 
13647  // JSON Pointer support //
13649 
13652 
13686  reference operator[](const json_pointer& ptr)
13687  {
13688  return ptr.get_unchecked(this);
13689  }
13690 
13714  const_reference operator[](const json_pointer& ptr) const
13715  {
13716  return ptr.get_unchecked(this);
13717  }
13718 
13754  reference at(const json_pointer& ptr)
13755  {
13756  return ptr.get_checked(this);
13757  }
13758 
13794  const_reference at(const json_pointer& ptr) const
13795  {
13796  return ptr.get_checked(this);
13797  }
13798 
13821  basic_json flatten() const
13822  {
13823  basic_json result(value_t::object);
13824  json_pointer::flatten("", *this, result);
13825  return result;
13826  }
13827 
13858  basic_json unflatten() const
13859  {
13860  return json_pointer::unflatten(*this);
13861  }
13862 
13864 
13866  // JSON Patch functions //
13868 
13871 
13919  basic_json patch(const basic_json& json_patch) const
13920  {
13921  // make a working copy to apply the patch to
13922  basic_json result = *this;
13923 
13924  // the valid JSON Patch operations
13925  enum class patch_operations {add, remove, replace, move, copy, test, invalid};
13926 
13927  const auto get_op = [](const std::string & op)
13928  {
13929  if (op == "add")
13930  {
13931  return patch_operations::add;
13932  }
13933  if (op == "remove")
13934  {
13935  return patch_operations::remove;
13936  }
13937  if (op == "replace")
13938  {
13939  return patch_operations::replace;
13940  }
13941  if (op == "move")
13942  {
13943  return patch_operations::move;
13944  }
13945  if (op == "copy")
13946  {
13947  return patch_operations::copy;
13948  }
13949  if (op == "test")
13950  {
13951  return patch_operations::test;
13952  }
13953 
13954  return patch_operations::invalid;
13955  };
13956 
13957  // wrapper for "add" operation; add value at ptr
13958  const auto operation_add = [&result](json_pointer & ptr, basic_json val)
13959  {
13960  // adding to the root of the target document means replacing it
13961  if (ptr.is_root())
13962  {
13963  result = val;
13964  }
13965  else
13966  {
13967  // make sure the top element of the pointer exists
13968  json_pointer top_pointer = ptr.top();
13969  if (top_pointer != ptr)
13970  {
13971  result.at(top_pointer);
13972  }
13973 
13974  // get reference to parent of JSON pointer ptr
13975  const auto last_path = ptr.pop_back();
13976  basic_json& parent = result[ptr];
13977 
13978  switch (parent.m_type)
13979  {
13980  case value_t::null:
13981  case value_t::object:
13982  {
13983  // use operator[] to add value
13984  parent[last_path] = val;
13985  break;
13986  }
13987 
13988  case value_t::array:
13989  {
13990  if (last_path == "-")
13991  {
13992  // special case: append to back
13993  parent.push_back(val);
13994  }
13995  else
13996  {
13997  const auto idx = std::stoi(last_path);
13998  if (static_cast<size_type>(idx) > parent.size())
13999  {
14000  // avoid undefined behavior
14001  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(401, "array index " + std::to_string(idx) + " is out of range"));
14002  }
14003  else
14004  {
14005  // default case: insert add offset
14006  parent.insert(parent.begin() + static_cast<difference_type>(idx), val);
14007  }
14008  }
14009  break;
14010  }
14011 
14012  default:
14013  {
14014  // if there exists a parent it cannot be primitive
14015  assert(false); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
14016  }
14017  }
14018  }
14019  };
14020 
14021  // wrapper for "remove" operation; remove value at ptr
14022  const auto operation_remove = [&result](json_pointer & ptr)
14023  {
14024  // get reference to parent of JSON pointer ptr
14025  const auto last_path = ptr.pop_back();
14026  basic_json& parent = result.at(ptr);
14027 
14028  // remove child
14029  if (parent.is_object())
14030  {
14031  // perform range check
14032  auto it = parent.find(last_path);
14033  if (it != parent.end())
14034  {
14035  parent.erase(it);
14036  }
14037  else
14038  {
14039  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(403, "key '" + last_path + "' not found"));
14040  }
14041  }
14042  else if (parent.is_array())
14043  {
14044  // note erase performs range check
14045  parent.erase(static_cast<size_type>(std::stoi(last_path)));
14046  }
14047  };
14048 
14049  // type check: top level value must be an array
14050  if (not json_patch.is_array())
14051  {
14052  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(104, 0, "JSON patch must be an array of objects"));
14053  }
14054 
14055  // iterate and apply the operations
14056  for (const auto& val : json_patch)
14057  {
14058  // wrapper to get a value for an operation
14059  const auto get_value = [&val](const std::string & op,
14060  const std::string & member,
14061  bool string_type) -> basic_json&
14062  {
14063  // find value
14064  auto it = val.m_value.object->find(member);
14065 
14066  // context-sensitive error message
14067  const auto error_msg = (op == "op") ? "operation" : "operation '" + op + "'";
14068 
14069  // check if desired value is present
14070  if (it == val.m_value.object->end())
14071  {
14072  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(105, 0, error_msg + " must have member '" + member + "'"));
14073  }
14074 
14075  // check if result is of type string
14076  if (string_type and not it->second.is_string())
14077  {
14078  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(105, 0, error_msg + " must have string member '" + member + "'"));
14079  }
14080 
14081  // no error: return value
14082  return it->second;
14083  };
14084 
14085  // type check: every element of the array must be an object
14086  if (not val.is_object())
14087  {
14088  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(104, 0, "JSON patch must be an array of objects"));
14089  }
14090 
14091  // collect mandatory members
14092  const std::string op = get_value("op", "op", true);
14093  const std::string path = get_value(op, "path", true);
14094  json_pointer ptr(path);
14095 
14096  switch (get_op(op))
14097  {
14098  case patch_operations::add:
14099  {
14100  operation_add(ptr, get_value("add", "value", false));
14101  break;
14102  }
14103 
14104  case patch_operations::remove:
14105  {
14106  operation_remove(ptr);
14107  break;
14108  }
14109 
14110  case patch_operations::replace:
14111  {
14112  // the "path" location must exist - use at()
14113  result.at(ptr) = get_value("replace", "value", false);
14114  break;
14115  }
14116 
14117  case patch_operations::move:
14118  {
14119  const std::string from_path = get_value("move", "from", true);
14120  json_pointer from_ptr(from_path);
14121 
14122  // the "from" location must exist - use at()
14123  basic_json v = result.at(from_ptr);
14124 
14125  // The move operation is functionally identical to a
14126  // "remove" operation on the "from" location, followed
14127  // immediately by an "add" operation at the target
