14128  // location with the value that was just removed.
14129  operation_remove(from_ptr);
14130  operation_add(ptr, v);
14131  break;
14132  }
14133 
14134  case patch_operations::copy:
14135  {
14136  const std::string from_path = get_value("copy", "from", true);;
14137  const json_pointer from_ptr(from_path);
14138 
14139  // the "from" location must exist - use at()
14140  result[ptr] = result.at(from_ptr);
14141  break;
14142  }
14143 
14144  case patch_operations::test:
14145  {
14146  bool success = false;
14147  JSON_TRY
14148  {
14149  // check if "value" matches the one at "path"
14150  // the "path" location must exist - use at()
14151  success = (result.at(ptr) == get_value("test", "value", false));
14152  }
14153  JSON_CATCH (out_of_range&)
14154  {
14155  // ignore out of range errors: success remains false
14156  }
14157 
14158  // throw an exception if test fails
14159  if (not success)
14160  {
14161  JSON_THROW(other_error::create(501, "unsuccessful: " + val.dump()));
14162  }
14163 
14164  break;
14165  }
14166 
14167  case patch_operations::invalid:
14168  {
14169  // op must be "add", "remove", "replace", "move", "copy", or
14170  // "test"
14171  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(105, 0, "operation value '" + op + "' is invalid"));
14172  }
14173  }
14174  }
14175 
14176  return result;
14177  }
14178 
14211  static basic_json diff(const basic_json& source,
14212  const basic_json& target,
14213  const std::string& path = "")
14214  {
14215  // the patch
14216  basic_json result(value_t::array);
14217 
14218  // if the values are the same, return empty patch
14219  if (source == target)
14220  {
14221  return result;
14222  }
14223 
14224  if (source.type() != target.type())
14225  {
14226  // different types: replace value
14227  result.push_back(
14228  {
14229  {"op", "replace"},
14230  {"path", path},
14231  {"value", target}
14232  });
14233  }
14234  else
14235  {
14236  switch (source.type())
14237  {
14238  case value_t::array:
14239  {
14240  // first pass: traverse common elements
14241  size_t i = 0;
14242  while (i < source.size() and i < target.size())
14243  {
14244  // recursive call to compare array values at index i
14245  auto temp_diff = diff(source[i], target[i], path + "/" + std::to_string(i));
14246  result.insert(result.end(), temp_diff.begin(), temp_diff.end());
14247  ++i;
14248  }
14249 
14250  // i now reached the end of at least one array
14251  // in a second pass, traverse the remaining elements
14252 
14253  // remove my remaining elements
14254  const auto end_index = static_cast<difference_type>(result.size());
14255  while (i < source.size())
14256  {
14257  // add operations in reverse order to avoid invalid
14258  // indices
14259  result.insert(result.begin() + end_index, object(
14260  {
14261  {"op", "remove"},
14262  {"path", path + "/" + std::to_string(i)}
14263  }));
14264  ++i;
14265  }
14266 
14267  // add other remaining elements
14268  while (i < target.size())
14269  {
14270  result.push_back(
14271  {
14272  {"op", "add"},
14273  {"path", path + "/" + std::to_string(i)},
14274  {"value", target[i]}
14275  });
14276  ++i;
14277  }
14278 
14279  break;
14280  }
14281 
14282  case value_t::object:
14283  {
14284  // first pass: traverse this object's elements
14285  for (auto it = source.begin(); it != source.end(); ++it)
14286  {
14287  // escape the key name to be used in a JSON patch
14288  const auto key = json_pointer::escape(it.key());
14289 
14290  if (target.find(it.key()) != target.end())
14291  {
14292  // recursive call to compare object values at key it
14293  auto temp_diff = diff(it.value(), target[it.key()], path + "/" + key);
14294  result.insert(result.end(), temp_diff.begin(), temp_diff.end());
14295  }
14296  else
14297  {
14298  // found a key that is not in o -> remove it
14299  result.push_back(object(
14300  {
14301  {"op", "remove"},
14302  {"path", path + "/" + key}
14303  }));
14304  }
14305  }
14306 
14307  // second pass: traverse other object's elements
14308  for (auto it = target.begin(); it != target.end(); ++it)
14309  {
14310  if (source.find(it.key()) == source.end())
14311  {
14312  // found a key that is not in this -> add it
14313  const auto key = json_pointer::escape(it.key());
14314  result.push_back(
14315  {
14316  {"op", "add"},
14317  {"path", path + "/" + key},
14318  {"value", it.value()}
14319  });
14320  }
14321  }
14322 
14323  break;
14324  }
14325 
14326  default:
14327  {
14328  // both primitive type: replace value
14329  result.push_back(
14330  {
14331  {"op", "replace"},
14332  {"path", path},
14333  {"value", target}
14334  });
14335  break;
14336  }
14337  }
14338  }
14339 
14340  return result;
14341  }
14342 
14344 };
14345 
14347 // presets //
14349 
14358 using json = basic_json<>;
14359 
14360 } // namespace io
14361 
14362 } // namespace dependency_graph
14363 
14364 
14366 // nonmember support //
14368 
14369 // specialization of std::swap, and std::hash
14370 namespace std
14371 {
14377 template<>
14378 inline void swap(::possumwood::io::json& j1,
14379  ::possumwood::io::json& j2) noexcept(
14380  is_nothrow_move_constructible<::possumwood::io::json>::value and
14381  is_nothrow_move_assignable<::possumwood::io::json>::value
14382  )
14383 {
14384  j1.swap(j2);
14385 }
14386 
14388 template<>
14389 struct hash<::possumwood::io::json>
14390 {
14396  std::size_t operator()(const ::possumwood::io::json& j) const
14397  {
14398  // a naive hashing via the string representation
14399  const auto& h = hash<::possumwood::io::json::string_t>();
14400  return h(j.dump());
14401  }
14402 };
14403 
14405 template <>
14406 struct less<::possumwood::io::detail::value_t>
14407 {
14412  bool operator()(::possumwood::io::detail::value_t lhs,
14413  ::possumwood::io::detail::value_t rhs) const noexcept
14414  {
14415  return ::possumwood::io::detail::operator<(lhs, rhs);
14416  }
14417 };
14418 
14419 } // namespace std
14420 
14434 inline ::possumwood::io::json operator "" _json(const char* s, std::size_t n)
14435 {
14436  return ::possumwood::io::json::parse(s, s + n);
14437 }
14438 
14452 inline ::possumwood::io::json::json_pointer operator "" _json_pointer(const char* s, std::size_t n)
14453 {
14454  return ::possumwood::io::json::json_pointer(std::string(s, n));
14455 }
